localised_description: The Black Pyramid stirs, my liege, but to reveal the secrets within, five Books of Nagash must be found. Begin the search at once for other powers also seek domination over the Arch-Necromancer’s shrine.\n\nLearn more about Books of Nagash [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]]here[[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Firstborn of King Khetep, Nagash was overlooked for succession and forced to join the Mortuary Cult. He swiftly rose to become a powerful high priest, but envy of his brother, who succeeded their father as king, burned within Nagash like a brazier coal. Seizing his opportunity, he entombed his brother, Thutep, alive and claimed the throne for himself - thus began Nagash's reign of sorcerous terror.

But a throne would not suffice for the insatiable Sorcerer. Seeking greater power, he threw himself into the study of Dark Magic, melding it with Necromancy to unlock the very secrets of eternal life. He poured all he had learned into his blasphemous opus, the nine Books of Nagash. The next stage of his plan, if successful, would magnify his powers immeasurably...

Nagash then constructed a vast black pyramid to harness and channel the Winds of Magic. Upon its completion, Nagash felt his powers grow tenfold, though the cost to the Kingdom was ruinous. Even as his might surged, the outraged Nehekharan Priest Kings gathered in secret, devising a way to topple the sorcerous tyrant.

The Priest Kings mustered mighty armies and declared war, but to their horror Nagash raised countless regiments of Skeleton Warriors in reply. Realising flesh alone could not to defeat such horrors, the Priest Kings breathed life into the mightiest statues of Nehekhara. Stone Ushabti, Necrolith Colossi and Khemrian Warsphinxes fought alongside the living, and Nagash's legions were crushed, forcing him to flee. However, is Nehekhara finally rid of his evil?

Order finally returned to Nehekhara, but it was many years until the kingdom prospered again, under the rule of King Alcadizaar. The Mortuary Cult was held under close scrutiny, its researches severely curtailed lest there be a repetition of Nagash's horrors. Many years passed in peace, until Nagash seemed but a dark and distant memory.

All was not seemly well in the Nehekharan city of Lahmia, however. Spellbound by the Sorcerer's legacy, Queen Neferata recreated his Elixir of Life, though her method was flawed (she and her court gained eternal life, but were cursed with an insatiable thirst for blood). Their dabblings aroused the fury of King Alcadizaar, and the Lahmians fled in search of refuge.

Little did these first Vampires know, Nagash's dark will had guided their actions all along. They found themselves at his fortress of Nagashizzar, where the perfidious Sorcerer welcomed his twisted children with open arms. Together, they launched a fresh offensive against Nehekhara, catching the recovering kingdom unawares.

Nehekhara rallied its forces in defence, and the war ground on for many years, seemingly deadlocked. After a titanic effort, however, Alcadizaar finally smashed the Undead forces. The Vampires fled to new refuges in the Old World, while Nagash retreated once more in abject fury. This time, his wrath was absolute – he cast a foul contagion throughout Nehekhara, scouring it of all life. Only Alcadizaar did he spare to witness the horror.

Incarcerated and fading, King Alcadizaar was visited in his cell one night by a group of cloaked, twitching, rat-like creatures. They whispered to him and freed him, pressing a Warpstone blade into his trembling hands. Ascending to the dark Sorcerer's altar, the emaciated king caught Nagash mid-ritual: he bellowed a final war-cry and ran the sorcerer through with the crackling blade. It was over at last, though Nehekhara lay in ruins. But can such reckless hatred ever truly be extinguished?

Seen by an outraged Grimnir, those fleshless skulls have scored a lucky victory against our brave Dawi warriors. Naturally, this calls for a new entry in the Dammaz Kron - strike it out, send them back into the sand!

By Valaya's saddened gaze, those fallen, false kings of the desert do raid Dawi lands, leaving destruction and misery in their wake! Justice will be done, mark my words: this grudge shall be answered a thousand times over!

Grungni is disgusted to witness the sacking of our Dwarfhold fortresses by the Undead forces of the sand-dwelling Tomb Kings. Find them and kill them - all of them - strike this heinous grudge from the Dammaz Kron!
By Valaya's sight, the desert-dwelling Undead dare occupy an honest Dawi Hold. A grudge has been entered and must be struck out - these cravens will pay with their very Unlives!
The living send their champion to end us, but we will end this breather.
The Beastmen's gor thinks to frustrate us. End the creature.
The Northern Gods task their champions to come against us.
The Witch King's minions are abroad - one in particular must be silenced.
Dwarfs have a tendency to interfere with our plans whenever we venture beyond the desert realms. One of their bearded-breathers comes. Silence him.
These men of the northern realms are an empire of thieves and pretenders. Their king - a so-called emperor - sends one against us. Ensure they join the Realm of Souls.
The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.
The Asur are cowards. They do not send their hosts against us, but merely mouthed agitators instead. Kill their agent.
Accursed reptiles send an agent to interfere with our plans! End this creature's pathetic existence.
Skaven foes try and undermine us, just as they did with King Alcadizaar. Find their verminous agent and slay it.
The civil war for Nehekhara continues - they send an agent against us. Find them and send their spirit back to the Realm of Souls!
The abominations of Neferata try and spread their agents amongst us. Cleanse the world of their filth. Destroy their agent.
The Elves and their tree-creatures interfere in our expansion by sending an agent against us. Find the threat and destroy it.
The invaders and thieves often come from this nation; it is time for them to feel the scorpion's sting. Send the legions against their lands.
The ice dunes of the Dark Elves are a new realm to add to our own. The legacy of Nehekhara will grow beyond the deserts.
The mountain realms of the Dwarfs are valuable to us, for we need stone for the war statuary. Claim it.
The primitives of the north think themselves safe from the dead. Take their land and disabuse them of such a notion.
These filthy creatures defile ancient lands that once belonged to Nehekhara. Purify the region and claim them back.
The High Elves' arrogance will be their undoing; after all, we are truly immortal, not these fleshy things. Take their realm as punishment!
The reptiles view their borders with intransigence. They must make way for a resurgent Nehekhara. Claim this realm for the Undead.
Djaf, the dog-headed God of War and Death, demands that land be conquered from the vermin that infest realms that should belong to Nehekhara.
Our dynasties have ruled here millennia ago, take it back. These are your lands!
More of Neferata's children infest this land, such creatures must be purged and replaced with the true servants of Ptra and their sovereigns.
The woodland realms offer the Tomb Kings unique opportunities. Claim such a realm and our kingdom will benefit.
The rose unfurls to reveal its thorns, does it? We shall show these living fools what a brier patch truly is. Declare war.
These sub-man creatures are no threat to the glory of the Tomb Kings. War on them until their extinction.
Ptra the Creator sends the legions of Nehekhara to war, for the Gods of Chaos stand at the gates to the Realm of Souls and must not be allowed to cross the threshold.
Make war on the Dark Ones in their frozen climes, for that is the only meaningful discourse they understand.
The Dwarfs come to make war and we should not disappoint such stunted foes. Make short work of them!
This king calls himself an 'emperor', but his rule is weak - he is mortal for one thing. Teach this imposter the true meaning of sovereignty - declare war.
The Greenskin menace has festered long enough! Declare war on these primitive tribes and purge them from the world!
The High Elves have become a pain in your regal behind, so it is time to end their place in this world. Call the legions to war!
The Lizardmen threat can no longer be ignored. Declare war on the cold-blooded kind, let them see the power of death.
The ratmen infestation grows. These creatures have ever been a threat, it is time for them to finally perish.
To become the King of Kings, the other sovereigns must be dominated. The legions shall meet in battle.
The Vampires were a threat of our own making and the sins of Lahmia haunt us still. Now is the time extinguish their kind - make war on them.
The tree-Elves need uprooting. Make war on such long-lived creatures, and show them the true path to immortality.
The prey is marked. Ensure their end.
Conquer these lands for they are yours, whether its denizens - living or dead - know it yet.
Bring about the end of this being - we cannot suffer him to exist any longer!
This army is threat to your rule. Seek them out and bring them to battle.
This place contains crypts of a lost dynasty - it must be scoured.
Such a settlement, teeming with beings, must be destroyed. The desert gods demand it!
This one bears the title of king but his existence is merely the span of a slave. His royal blood is as thin as Elven wine, and for such a sin he must perish.
Even back in the old days it was considered a mercy when an animal became rabid to put the beast out of its misery. Hunt Gorthor down and perform this task.
The Chaos Gods send their 'best' against you, and on the field of battle no less. Ptra is not impressed. Hunt down their crowned champion, show them the power of a real sovereign.
That king - the Dark Elf one. Slay this iron-clad Elf and show the denizens of Naggaroth the power of the true kings, the ones that rule the desert realms!
This stunted king is said to hold grudges. Pathetic! His wrongs are nothing to ours, we awoke without our organs! Seek this ingrate out on the field of battle and end him!
It is time to seek out this 'emperor' we have heard so much about. Find this living king of men and slay him in battle - then the living shall truly fear us!
The Greenskins rally behind the beast known as Grimgor. Seek out this creature in battle and end his lust for our realm.
The Prince of the Asur, the one they hold as a champion and untouchable. Let us prove their claims false - we will hand him nought but death.
The reptiles take orders from the Slann - this Mazdamundi is particularly revered. Destroy it in battle and their reverence will quickly fade.
Seek out this ego-craving ratman and sever its head from its filthy body in battle. Then we shall see how loyal these Skaven truly are.
Their can only be one King of Kings. This one thinks to fight the most ancient of conflicts. It is well. Seek him out in battle.

This Vampire noble claims to a descend from a royal bloodline. His ancestors may have once hailed from Nehekhara but his personal lineage is nothing but mongrels. On the battlefield, hunt him down and destroy him!
This Elven abomination challenges Nehekhara! It likes to hunt, so make it the quarry. Find this 'king' and show him the power of true royalty.
Seek out this serf in battle - this dog - and end his pitiful life. Ptra demands nothing less!
This Beastmen may not be the best specimen of their feeble race but it should still be dealt with.
While the Northmen seem obsessed with skulls, we'll take any bones on offer - especially from the body of this champion!
In battle, hunt down this Dark Elf pretender and extinguish his soul.
There is a Dwarf that frustrates the will of the Royal Priest Kings of old. Hunt down this nuisance in battle and bring about his death!
The thralls to this child-emperor mock us. We should seek them out in battle and take their flesh-coated skulls.
Find this Orc filth that mocks us. Hunt down in the battle and end it.
Seek out the arrogant breather. Find the High Elf herald and slay it! Our honour demands it.
These reptiles use titles such as 'Oldblood' the arrogance! Ours would be the oldest blood there is, if we still had any. Hunt down this lizard usurper and end it!
Seek out Alcadizaar's bane - the Skaven creature that challenges us. Kill the creature in battle, crush his skull under the wheels of a chariot!
This serf - this slave - dares to defy you. Hunt it down in battle and break its soul!
Hunt down the Vampire-spawn - find the creature that dares call itself Unliving and end its existence quickly.
This Elven creature has been sent to challenge us - seek it out during the battle and kill it. Grind its skull into the ground!
The Errantry War of the breathers from the north blocks our way. Engage them with our legions.
We have let these Beastmen roam sacred lands long enough. Bring the warherd to battle!
Chaos comes. The filth-encrusted gods of the north must be stopped. Send your legions forth!
The Druchii come. Engage their dark host and stop them!
Dwarfs send a throng against us. Djaf demands their destruction - engage them in battle!
The uncivilised breathers from the north send an army. Meet them in battle - raise the legion!
An Orc rabble has invaded. Show these filth who should be invading who!
The High Elves send a host to face us. Do not let this challenge go.
The Bretonnians invade! Repel these living trespassers, make them pay for disturbing the dead!
So the Beastmen invade sovereign Tomb Kings land? Repel these creatures!
A Chaos horde, sent by their vile Gods, invades Tomb King lands. Our own gods demand they should be repelled!
The Witch King's thralls dare to invade our lands - these usurpers must be stopped!
The Dwarfs dare invade sovereign territory of the Priest Kings. Send them back to their mountain burrows!
And so these barbarians from the north dare invade the lands of the desert gods. Slay the slave-warriors make them clamour for their green and unpleasant lands.
The Orcs invade. Stop these green skin breathers!
A High Elf host invades sovereign lands of the ever-living Priest Kings. Repel these trespassers.
The Lizardmen invade! Push these creatures back into their foetid jungles.
Coming from their lairs, the Skaven invade! Send these pests back to their foetid nests!
As in life, war and invasion between the Nehekharan kings is inevitable. Now a rival invades and must be stopped.
Vampires send their wet legions against us, invading the realms of the desert gods. Halt this pathetic invasion.
The Wood Elves dare plant their roots in Nehekharan soil. Stop this Elven invasion!
The Lizardmen hiss that we are not part of their Great Plan, yet we are the only plan! Stop their force as it comes against us.
Find the Skaven army that challenges us. By Ptra, victory is the only option!
Djaf revels for the jackal-headed God of War will witness the Legions of Nehekhara fight once more. Seek out the enemy king's legion and engage.
The half-breed scum of Lahmia sends a force that must be stopped. Engage the fleshy, festering Undead!
A Wood Elf host is close. Intercept and destroy it!
War is not the only answer. An alliance is required so we may continue to exist.
These breathers have raiders our tombs for centuries. It is time to raid their lands and plunder their crypts!
The Dark Elf lands hide much valuable lore and secrets to eternal life. Raid their lands and seek such knowledge!
Crack open the Dwarfen Holds and raid their lands, homes and tombs for anything of value.
This young race of men have stolen secrets that belong to Khemri. We shall go, raid and return what has always been ours.
The Orcs have looted and stolen from us for too long. Now, raid their slum lands!
Enter High Elf lands and take! No longer will these arrogant breathers keep what should be ours!
No longer will the Lizardmen hide their so-called knowledge from our Liche Priests. Seek out their treasures, their plaques of lore. Raid their habitat.
We shall plunder the resources of the ratmen. Raid their warrens, destroy their under-world!
This inferior king hides relics we need. Raid his lands, scatter the sands and his legions. All we survey is ours.
Seek out the lands claimed by the Lahmia's bastard children - raid the lands of their bloodlines. Vengeance will be ours!
Enter the tree-strewn paths of the Wood Elves and take their life-source - claim it for the kings of Nehekhara!
Under the desert sands awaits a long-dead legion, eternally loyal and ready to serve. All it needs are the Liche Priests to utter an incantation of awakening.
Destroy a living city of Bretonnia. Send their presents fleeing into our bony embrace!
Seek out a city of the Dark Elves and raze it to the ground. Every stone must tumble. Ptra demands nothing less.
The Dwarfholds of the stunted are a ripe target for our legions. Make it so.
This new empire's death god inhabits every stone and garden in their vile realm. Topple their city.
The Orcs gather in one of their settlements. Raise the legions and destroy it.
The Gleaming towers of the High Elves rival the height of our pyramids. This cannot be allowed to stand - literally.
The temple-cities of the Lizardmen are a cache of lost lore that could bring about the Day of Awakening, unseal their crypts and burn what is left.
Seek out the Skaven nests and put an end to these vermin once and for all!
The city of a rival Tomb King encroaches on our greatness! Raze it, and execute the Necrotect to ensure our pyramid remains the greatest death shrine.
The only way to halt the Vampire threat is to destroy these night stalkers where they slumber.
The Wood Elves lurk in the deep woods. Send in your skeletal legions and fell any tree that could hold such vermin.
Raise a Tomb Prince and add him to your legions.
A Necrotect is needed to enhance the war statuary in our legions and ensure the greatness of death shrines.
Summon a Liche Priest from the Mortuary Cult to serve.
We require a Screaming Skull Catapult to ensure your reign.
Bring forth the desert knights to serve your majesty.
Summon the bodyguard from the Burial Chamber so they may serve in battle.
The archers of ancient Nehekhara remain the best in the world. Ensure they join your legions.
Awaken the war statuary. Stone must march with sand.
Order the chariots into service at once.

The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.
The time has come to hush the wailing of the Crone once and for all. Seek out Hellebron and end her!
At last, Malekith is in your sights! Traitor to your race, Sunderer, and slayer of your family. Find him, kill him!
The mother of all our woes - the Hag Sorceress herself - is ripe for slaying. Take her head, and slake our thirst for vengeance!
You have a new target, my king. Scouts report a threat to the Shadowlands - strike now, before they can bring further ruin.
The Shadowlands has a new enemy; the king must act and cull the threat before it festers into war.
The Shadow King will do anything to protect his realm. His warriors have learned of a threat that needs silencing.
A traitor calls for their own death! One of the Witch King's sycophants threatens our realm - take them into shadow!
War or peace - it matters not, a Druchii is always a viable target. The less of their treacherous kind exist, the safer Nagarythe will be.
Loec’s ravens squawk the name of another of Malekith’s minions to slay. Their time can be measured in mere moments from now on.
To go to war with the Shadowlands is to invoke the retribution of Alith Anar, who will seek out this target and usher them to death.
Those who provoke the Shadow King to war surely do not value life, for they will be deprived of it soon enough!
Although a High Elf, Anar does not play by the same rules as his noble kin; war is not just fought on the battlefield.
It is war with the Druchii! This traitor-kin needs their head severed from their neck! Loec has nominated Anar for this honour…
Loec, the God of Deadly Dances, has given Anar a name - a Dark Elf whose own dance should end, war or not.
The only good Druchii is a dead one. To aid the war, Anar must hunt once more; now he knows the identity of his prey.

The Asur Everqueen is the epitome of beauty - the wretched slaves of Ulthuan even call her ‘The Radiant’, the fawning fools! Despoil Alarielle’s capital. This will delight Khaine, and surely he will reward Hellebron with what she desires the most: her lost youth.

At last, a chance to capture the blackest of widows in her own web! Morathi’s lair is vulnerable; surely this is a chance for the Blood Queen to rid herself of the most power of rivals? Take the Hag Sorceress’ capital!
Alarielle, mother and protector of all the Asur, stands guard over Ulthuan. The invading Druchii must be pushed back!
ui_icon: ph the Queen returns to defend Ulthuan. The presence of the queen bolsters your soldiers, no amount of druchii armour could defend against their determinition.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description: There is a legend known to the sentinels in the watchtowers far to the north of Naggaroth. It tells of a great multi-headed beast: a War Hydra. The creature does not age, but simply gets larger and its scales denser as the years go by. The Beast of Raema is the perfect quarry, so you head toward the Land of Chill, aiming for the watchtowers that guard the Witch King's realm.\n\nAn underling brings you word that, only recently, the watchtower of Dargoth was attacked by a raging beast. The hunt - it seems - is on.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description: The Dark Elves, like all Elves, are cowards; they just hide their craven nature under a veneer of superiority. The tribe shall take from this watchtower whatever riches still remain, then bring violence to the pathetic survivors until one of them tells you what you need to know.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description: The Druchii will not talk. Better to simply deprive the wretches of life then waste any more time. Instead, summon one of your own; the Werekin shall track our quarry - the Beast of Raema will not avoid the Norse hunters for long.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description: You have learned that it was indeed a gigantic War Hydra that attacked the watchtower. This is the monster you hunt! Although there's no doubt, it has also come to light that the creature is not alone. Beastmen accompany the War Hydra, worshipping it as a deity. By all accounts, these Gors are even more rabid than their usual cloven kin. It matters not - if they get between you and your prey then they will become trophies as well!\n\nAs you follow the trail, your scouts report back that the beast has struck again! Even now it attacks another Dark Elf watchtower - now is your chance!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description:
There is a legend known to the sentinels in the watchtowers far to the north of Naggaroth which tells of a great War Hydra known as the Beast of Raema. It is the perfect quarry, never aging but simply getting larger and its scales denser as the years go by. Having received word that the watchtower of Dargoth had recently been attacked by a raging multi-headed beast, you headed toward the Land of Chill to investigate.

You arrived at the watchtower in the aftermath of the attack, the tower itself still aflame, with bodies of the recently-mauled littering the area. Given the scale of the devastation, there could be no doubt that the gigantic War Hydra that you hunt was the creature that attacked it. Furthermore, it also came to light that the creature is not alone. It is accompanied by Beastmen, who are worshipping it as a deity. By all accounts, these Gors are even more rabid than their usual cloven kin. It matters not - if they get between you and your prey then they will become trophies as well!

As you follow the trail, your scouts report back that the beast has struck again! Even now it attacks another Dark Elf watchtower - now is your chance!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
localised_description: While dancing in the Warpstone vapours and flames of the camp's fire, your Shaman claims to have been given instructions from the Dark Gods. He has learned that the ratmen of Clan Gritus have commissioned a great beast - a true abomination from the flesh-shapers of Clan Moulder. From his fervour-vision, the Shaman sees thousands upon thousands of screeching rats scratching on bloody walls, desperate to escape their fleshy prison...\n\nClan Gritus were last seen in the cold north - the perfect environment for any Gods-fearing Norseman.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
localised_description: Despite this horde not being Clan Gritus itself, these Skaven are no doubt a vassal-clan or even a decoy. This hunt is going to be a difficult one, for rats are notoriously hard to corner. The trail is at risk of going cold, quite literally. However, it was your Gods that set you on this course, and it is they who can give you the next breadcrumb in the trail. However, you cannot just make demands of the Ruinous Powers - a sacrifice must be made.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
localised_description: The Dark Gods have illuminated the path ahead - they seem as keen as you to grab this prize. It must be worth a great deal, or perhaps slaying such prey will inconvenience the Skaven's own bastard god, the Great Horned Rat? In any case, the way forward is now clear: the hunt is on!\n\nThe trail now goes below ground. This is home territory for the ratmen, but not so much for the Norse, who prefer enough room to swing their axes. Caution is advised.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
localised_description:
While dancing in the Warpstone vapours and flames of the camp's fire, your Shaman claimed to have been given instructions from the Dark Gods. He’d learned that the ratmen of Clan Gritus had commissioned a great beast - a true abomination from the flesh-shapers of Clan Moulder. In his fervour-vision, the Shaman also saw thousands upon thousands of screeching rats scratching on bloody walls, desperate to escape their fleshy prison...

You headed into the cold north where Clan Gritus had last been seen. Rats are notoriously hard to corner, however, and the trail was suddenly at risk of going cold. Razing a few settlements as sacrifices to the Dark Gods, it became evident that they are as keen as you to grab this prize and they illuminated the path ahead, leading you to the vicinity of the Temple of Addidoth. The abomination must be worth a great deal to the Ruinous Powers, or perhaps slaying such prey will inconvenience the Skaven's own bastard god, the Great Horned Rat? In any case, the way forward is now clear: the hunt is on!

The trail now goes below ground. This is home territory for the ratmen, but not so much for the Norse, who prefer enough room to swing their axes. Caution is advised.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame
localised_description:
Even by the Norse, it is known that the Annulii Mountains - the unbroken chain that surrounds the Elven home of Ulthuan - are a rich habitat for many wonderous creatures. While the Chaos wastes to the north will always provide the tainted and deranged, the creatures that inhabit the Annulii seem 'purer' and therefore more desirable prey.

Setting foot on Ulthuan is no easy task, the Elf-scum that selfishly live on the island have always gone to great lengths to protect it. But they will not deprive you now, especially when word has reached the tribe that a Phoenix matriarch, one that has not been seen in centuries, will appear on their island once again. To take that from the world would cause great upset to the Elves.

The rumour originates from Dark Elf contacts, a merchant on the black market trying to sell a large pinion of the Flamespyre. Time to give this contact a visit and investigate his wares.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame
localised_description: The rage in you - channelled by the Dark Gods - begs to punish this pale Elf for daring to make such a demand. Yet, you feel that one punch would break this fragile thing, denying your warband their hunt. You agree to the Druchii's terms and send your underling to find this victim. After all, you can always kill the Elf and his token bodyguards once you have the location of the volcano.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame
localised_description: Vaul's Anvil lies across the ocean, on the southern edge of Ulthuan. It is a raging volcano and sacred site for the Asur. The Norse gather their longships and set sail. The High Elves will do everything they can to stop the Northmen setting foot of their precious isle, but they shall fail.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame
localised_description:
Even by the Norse, it is known that the Annulii Mountains - the unbroken chain that surrounds the Elven home of Ulthuan - are a rich habitat for many wonderous creatures. While the Chaos wastes to the north will always provide the tainted and deranged, the creatures that inhabit the Annulii seem 'purer' and therefore are a more desirable prey.

Word had reached you of a rumour amongst the Dark Elves that a Phoenix matriarch, one that has not been seen in centuries, will appear on Ulthuan once again. Legend has it that it is a creature of Hekarti, existing between the mortal plane and the Realm of Chaos. The 'Mother of the Flame' only makes its appearance on the side of the mortal veil rarely, once a century at most, awoken into this world through the heart of a burning volcano. The source of the rumour was a Dark Elf merchant of the black market, who also had knowledge of where the Phoenix is due to appear. He would not give up the information without some petty bargaining, however, which you had little patience for. As you unleashed your Ice Wolves upon him, the wretch told you all you needed to know before one of them bit through his spinal cord with a wet crack.

Vaul’s Anvil, on the southern edge of Ulthuan, is your next destination – a raging volcano and sacred site for the Asur. The Norse gather their longships and set sail. The High Elves will do everything they can to stop the Northmen setting foot on their precious isle, but they shall fail.

The jungles of Lustria are teeming with deadly – and perpetually hungry – predators, but there is one legend that reverberates through the continent; one myth that spooks the Amazons and even has the Pygmies darting back into their warrens...

 Where Gargantulzan stalks nothing lives. The mightiest of feral Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries but, for once, *it* will become the prey – let the hunt begin!

A guide is needed to take you on the trail into the foetid jungles. Rumours spoken in hushed tones from one oar-slave to the next have reached you that the slave-merchants at the Point may have someone with such knowledge. The slavers will provide such a guide or become enslaved themselves...

At first the Skink claims ignorance of the dark tongue spoken by your tribe. It refuses to even speak in its natural Saurian. But when one of your men starts to cut off its head-crest, it breaks into a broken version of Empire-speak known as Reikspiel. This is a language your folk recognise from various raids across the Sea of Claws – it is the tongue of mewling victims, and fitting for this battered guide.\n\nThe creature babbles non-stop about some 'Great Plan' but after that is beaten from it, the reptile finally mentions a possible lead – an island on which sits a great Crimson Skull, home to the mighty behemoths of Lustria. It is a long journey ahead and so a stop for provisions and a blessing to the Ruinous Powers at the Norse colony of Skeggi would be wise.

After leaving Skeggi, your reptilian guide becomes far less reluctant and seems even helpful in giving directions though the dense jungle. If you didn't know better, you would think the creature was enjoying the misery wrought on your Norsemen - who are people used to cold and ice - now dealing with intense heat and gad-flies constantly feasting on their flesh.\n\nIn the far distance, unmistakable roars are heard of timeless beasts on the hunt. It seems the quarry is getting closer...

The jungles of Lustria are teeming with deadly – and perpetually hungry – predators, but the legend of Gargantulzan reverberates through the continent, spooking the Amazons and sending the Pygmies darting back into their warrens. The mightiest of feral Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries, but now will become the prey.

In an effort to obtain a guide to take you through the foetid jungles on the beast's trail, you sought out the slave-merchants of the Point. The pathetic slavers initially drew a blank on a willing guide, before one of them dared to make a suggestion, leading you to a cage containing a small reptile – a Skink. He claimed that with the right amount of ‘persuasion’, it would lead you to your quarry. At first the Skink claimed ignorance of the dark tongue spoken by your tribe, but when one of your men started to cut off its head-crest it broke into a broken version of Empire-speak known as Reikspiel, babbling non-stop about some 'Great Plan', before finally mentioning a possible lead.

After a brief stop at the Norse colony of Skeggi for provisions and a blessing to the Ruinous Powers, your reptilian guide leads you deep into the jungle, seemingly far less reluctant in giving directions. If you didn't know better, you would think the creature was enjoying the misery wrought on your Norsemen – who are people used to cold and ice – now dealing with intense heat and gad-flies constantly feasting on their flesh.

In the far distance, unmistakable roars are heard of timeless beasts on the hunt. It seems the quarry is getting closer...

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema
localised_description: Glorious! The Beast of Raema is just as the legends proclaim - the creature's many heads will make perfect trophies and a worthy sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Its Beastmen acolytes bray with a madness you have not seen in the Cloven Ones before, so be wary when tackling them. But enough posturing - the hunt nears its end and there is a monster to slay!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
localised_description: Through the stinking, cramped tunnels you go and then finally you emerge at Seep-Gore, lair of the Hellbeast. The creature lumbers forward, its straining abdomen appearing to pulse as if barely constraining the hordes within its distended belly.\n\nThe monster is truly is an abomination! Its heads will make many trophies and a worthy dedication to the Dark Gods... Kill it!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame
localised_description: Despite the Shifting Isles, you arrive in time, as the volcano growls. Assuming the snivelling Druchii told the truth, the Mother of the Flame will rise from Vaul's Anvil at any moment. Then, you see the High Elves deploy their Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard - warriors sent to guard this mythical creature and a sure sign that this is indeed the right time.\n\nBreak them apart to claim victory. This bird will make a perfect sacrifice!

After endless days trudging through the jungle, your warband arrives at a great temple scattered with the bones of beasts and other prey. It is a feeding ground. You turn to ask the Skink if this is the place to bait a trap, but the reptile has gone! All that remains is a shackle containing a foot gnawed through at the ankle. It seems the trap is not yours to set - for you are the bait!

A great roar rumbles across the clearing, the ground shakes, birds scatter from the lush canopies, and the usually-loud jungle is suddenly silent... until pierced by another roar. Then, from the trees, a chanting is heard "Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan!"

The behemoth has arrived, and you must now fight a Carnosaur of legend!

Those sanctimonious sops in armour, the Bretonnians, 'ave sent an 'eavily-defended convoy of merchant ships our way. Crow reckons they be heading to Araby, and by their sluggishness I'd say they're carrying a goodly haul by those escorts. Let's strike now an' take their riches for ourselves!

So… it would appear that some enterprising fellows from the New World 'ave decided to risk it all against the elements an' of course ourselves, who surely 'ave nothin' left to lose anyway. It's looking pretty likely that Sartosa is their destination. Though they're well protected, taking their cargo as our prize presents an opportunity we daren't pass up.

A convoy of Dark Elf slave ships are heading back to Slaver's Bay, laden with captives raided from Ulthuan's coasts. We should free them... not for altruistic reasons, you understand, but because of their potential as fresh recruits to go on account with us an' join the crew - drowned, raised 'n' bound, they'll be worth more than a cutter full o'gold sovereigns!

Pah! Northmen! Those stinkin' Norscan raiders 'ave been spotted heading back north of Naggaroth frozen following a successful raid on the coasts of the Empire. This particular tribe are known always to take captives for ransom at a later date, so this is an ample opportunity to fill our ratings.

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.

You are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.

That is, of course, only if you let him…

It rises from Manann’s firmament, like a tooth unfettered from a yearning maw. But this fang’s crown may be worth more than mere gold…

To the north of the pirate’s isle lies a bejewelled city whose wonder has the power to enchant and beguile.
To find what you seek, do not be so meek, for the guardian stands proud; so tall that its head is in the clouds.
Sleep is not required, for in the north there is something harsh amidst the treasure of the marsh.
Sleep is not required, for in the south there is something harsh amidst the treasure of the marsh.
Not all wonders are created by the gods themselves. Some are mortal creations, wherein lies what you seek.
Not all wonders are created by the gods themselves. Some are mortal creations, wherein lies what you seek.

It is not X that marks the spot, but the scrawls etched by ancients long thought lost.

It is not X that marks the spot, but the scrawls etched by ancients long thought lost.
Pierce the green mists, behold what arises from the canopy, and an ancient one shall greet you with a ruby eye.
Beware the grave, for it calls to us all. But where will you rest in peace? In soil, or in the depths summoned by the Maelstrom’s call?
Halflings would surely freeze if they visited this moot, but in the south lies a fire undimmed by ice.
Come to a coast ravaged by talon and claw, but do not miss the point for it traces the way to a monolithic secret.
Close to the mount of spiders, find what is lost, for the highlands beyond the plateau hold what you seek.
The desert sands hold only death, but legends also speak of eternal life should you seek the season that follows winter and discover the scarlet pools.
To walk though this passage is to stride through history; a place where Orcs, gods and emperors have fought, and the fire of their bloody rage is encased in darkness.
To find this treasure you must wander under the eyes of watchers that guard the ways, and into a kingdom where the seasons rule.
The Dragon stirs, awaking with fury, but forever trapped in the ash of his own making.
The Dragon stirs, awaking with fury, but forever trapped in the ash of his own making.

Afore Valaya’s saddened eyes, the filthy Uzkular of the sea have snatched a righteous victory from true, honest Dawi warriors. The Mother Goddess demands we hunt down this host and send them back to the depths… permanently!

Witnessed by Grungni, a rotten, valueless Undead horde has stolen Dawi treasures from Dawi lands and has dared to take them to Holds beyond our reach, but not beyond our sight - hunt down this host of dead Umgal and avenge this grave offence!

Observed with shock and anger by Grimnir, the dreadful, Unliving creatures of the Vampire Coast have sacked one of our Holds, burning and looting our great fortress. Naturally, this scandalous insult has been recorded in the Dammaz Kron – avenge out noble Dawi kin and strike it from the book!
A crestfallen Grimnir has noticed that the foul Undead ransack and occupy a settlement belonging to ordinary, righteous Dawi folk. The Dammaz Kron has a new grudge - see it is settled at once!

Harkon's mind is split between multiple personalities, all vying for dominance in his head. The only goal they share is the restoration of his psyche; to restore his mind, Harkon must be willing to seek out Lizardmen artefacts and learn of the spell that fractured it.

The still-living that dare to plague this realm were foolish enough to send an agent our way. What a specimen - Let's fill our goblets with their blood an' enjoy this fine diplomatic offering, before it gets cold.
This will be interesting - the unloved children of Chaos dare challenge us. Boo hoo! Slay the mewling beast! It’s a kindness really… no, really it is.
Chaos is the enemy of all - we 'ave to kill its agent before their foul taint spreads an' spores... and then we'll *really* be all at sea!

First rule of piracy is never trust a pirate, even one of yer own men... Actually, especially one of yer own men… No matter, ignore my ramblings - we should kill it before it makes a play for our loot!

Khaine commands the Druchii spill blood in 'is name, but 'e never specified whose blood it should be. Let's assist this worshipper of the Bloody-handed God to move closer to their idol by relieving them of their blood!
Dwarfs? Never underestimate 'em - their stature may be small, but the little sods can still cause you a lot of trouble. Kill this one now, before he bites yer kneecaps off!

The men of the Empire are nothing but sycophants to Sigmar, who cares nothing for their worthless lives, yet still they believe 'emselves superior. Let's remind the fools who rules the waves - let's slay their agent, and swiftly!

Greenskins? Don't make me laugh! "Green Tide"? Green puddle more like. Mind you, in large numbers they can be bothersome, so let's murder this one now an' send bits of 'im back to 'em, so they know to try a lot harder next time.

They’re very 'igh 'n' mighty, is Elves, and it's that sort of arrogance that will see them all drowned. Fancy sending a single agent against us instead of a fleet! Let's kill this one in a really int'resting way an' remind 'em back at Ulthuan that they're mortal after all.

The Lizardmen are just a bunch of brainy snakes - they talk of "Great Plans" but all they really do is interfere with ours! Let's kill this 'orrible thing now before it can cause any more 'arm. Now *that's* a great plan!

This solitary Northman acts against us. Naturally, this sort of thing absolutely can't be tolerated - give 'em a yard and they'll take a nautical mile. I say kill this one quickly, and rid ourselves of a problem.
Skaven are little more than vermin. Now, vermin are known for feeding on the dead, but they also drown very easily, so let's sling this one in the drink before they get ideas 'bout the crew, yarrr?
Though we share some goals in common, the Tomb Kings cannot be permitted to interfere with our plans. This agent of theirs cannot be allowed to live. Let's send 'em a Sartosan message - kill it!

Though we’ve all tasted the Blood Kiss, our landlubbin' kin have started to act against us. Presumably, this has somethin' to do with all that 'swarming across the world'-lark rather than good, honest pirating. To make a point, we should slay their agent, making it clear 'oo authored the death.

Oh pull the other one! Would you believe that the creatures of Athel Loren have dared to venture out and challenge us - here, where we command the waves an' tides?! Let's kill this one slowly - it will put off the other cowards from leavin' their little forest.

I think we've made ourselves perfectly clear on this matter - the coasts of the Old World belong to *us* now. We must evict the previous tenants, an' with extreme prejudice, 'cos we don't want repurcussions further down the line, do we?

Why waste all that time an' energy toiling and sweatin' to put a proper pirate base together when you can just relieve someone else of theirs? This place was run by sea dogs like us, so there won't be much in the way of furnishings. Nevertheless, let's take the place and fly our own colours from its walls.

That sorry bunch, the Dark Elves, long to return to their island of Ulthuan, but they the lack resolve of yer 'ardbitten, salty sea dog. To strengthen it - to do them a favour, yer might say - let's take their territory. That'll give 'em the best reason ever to return 'ome.

The troublesome Dwarfs are famed for their wealth, but not their generosity. Clearly, they must be taught to share, like the fractious children they resemble - let's march up there now an' take by force what they will not give up willingly. What say ye?

This settlement of puny men currently belongs to the living, which is something we're gonna 'ave to change, don't yer think? I say we conquer these lands for the furtherment of our own goals - that way lies sense.

They do say that the so-called "Green Tide" has swallowed much of this world. If this be true, we should sail straight on through, full ahead, an' take it back off 'em. This place makes for the perfect starting point, no?

Those arrogant island-dwellers, the Asur, do not consider our Undead horde to be a threat, so say our sources. I say that their ego shall be their undoing! We should launch a major foray into their lands, starting 'ere, today, with this settlement!

Those rubbish sailors, the slimy Lizardmen, 'ave found that their forces 'ere are overstretched. I reckon we must act before they sort their little supply problem - let's take this land from 'em, pushing them deeper and deeper into their jungle retreats.

Those primitive bufoons, the Norscans, build simple settlements which, when ruined, make great foundations for our own, superior ones. Let's reduce this place to rubble and dust - I reckon it'll make a fine outpost yet!
The ever-putrid ratmen hide and skulk in their warrens 'neath the soil. I say we go down there now and flush 'em out - slay the dirty little cowards and build an empire of our own!

The Tomb Kings' once-great desert empire was destroyed by the denizens of the dead. Looks like they didn’t learn their lesson the first time! It's our destiny to take their town an' remind 'em who's superior, whether on land or sea.

I think we can all agree that our Sylvanian cousins have little idea how to manage the... 'needs' of the living. They should learn to think of 'em as pilot fish dependent on the much-larger whale - us - for direction. I say we take this town from 'em and demonstrate the proper way forward.

Bah! This is good, serviceable land but it's being wasted on a few measly tree houses! We should tear them down and build a proper pirate settlement in their place - somewhere to feed alms for our much more deserving cause. What say you?
Those silly Bretonnians, with their legends and stupid shining armour are 'overburdened' with treasure, the poor mites. We should help them out, like, by relieving them of their loot - yay?
I dunno 'bout you but I'm getting sick to the back teeth of those ridiculous Gor herds - they've been a thorn in our side for far too long. 'Tis time we sent 'em to their graves!

Those so-called 'Dark Gods' send their puppets to infect the world with their taint! *Our* world, mind - they've certainly got gumption, I'll give yer that. We should stop the rot - kill the Chaos fiends and keep the seas for the dead, the way 'twas meant to be!

Filthy, stinkin' pirate scum! Not like us, you understand - different, lesser pirates who go against the code 'cos they've got no respect. These traitors need a lesson. Let's kill 'em all - that'll learn 'em!

As you will know, I have very little time for the Druchii - they think themselves the rulers of the sea and masters of all who sail the waves. We know different, however - Manann the Destroyer is god here and we are his 'umble servants like.

Ooo I'm scared! Those Dwarfs are back and apparently they've got scores to settle with us. I say we re-write those entries and make them the last to grace their petty 'Book o'Grudges' - slay every last tiny one of 'em!

Here's a riddle for yer rum-addled bonces: "Who is the greatest enemy, always at yer shoulder?" Time of course - 'e'll lead 'em to Death, which waits for neither man nor beast as we all know. Let's kill 'em and raise them for our ranks and ratings! What say you?

Those Greenskins seek war with all! You gotta hand it to 'em for their tenacity and fightin' spirit though, no? It's almost a shame that we're gonna have to fight 'em and waste every last one of the stupid green gits!
Like you, I've run out of patience with the Asur, who 'ave meddled and been tolerated for far too long. But it ends 'ere - we should ready the fleet for war!

Those cold-blooded Lustrian lizards live an' die by the garbled plans of a long-forgotten race. They're on a hiding to nothing if you ask me - we should make some great plans of our own an' end their miserable servitude, don't yer think?

The Norscans just don't know when they're beaten, the mindless cretins - they're all beard an' no brain. We should kill these particular ones before the Dark Gods start payin' attention and present a united front, yes?

...And still the cowardly, stinkin' rats come at us - fit only for slaughter if the truth be told. They're not much of a foe when it comes down to it are they? Let's slaughter the lot of 'em and be done with it!

You've gotta respect their tenacity, and defeatin' death is a fine thing an' all that, but really the time of the Tomb Kings has long since passed. Now, they're becomin' a nuisance - if we keelhaul one or two and make the others walk the plank, they might get the message that, here on the 'igh seas, we're the ruling power.

Now, we'd be a little naive if we trusted the Vampire Counts, kin or no. Like us pirates, they 'ave the 'abit of betrayal - a hard one to break I'm sure you'll agree. We should vanquish them with haste and bring their armies under our thrall!

Looks like the tides have brought *total* war to our shores. Each day that passes, it's gettin' closer, so we must act now. Bury the Asrai beneath the waves - they'll think twice 'bout leavin' their tree 'ouses after that!

This lily-livered landlubber has a price on their head, which makes 'em something of an attractive target for salty freebooters such as we. Taking this life means we'll be able to claim a generous reward - I'm in, are you?
This place will make a handy base from which to launch all sorts of raids an' actions. If we capture this region and fly our colours 'ere, our pirate brothers-in-arms will support us, I knows it.
This foe is an enemy of all our kind, so we much face 'em in combat and end their run. Think of it as an symbolic and existential battle - one we absolutely cannot afford to lose.
I don't like this lot and I know you don't either, so I'm proposing that we take the fight directly to their door, 'cos a victory here could well be crucial during the wars to come. Are yer with me?
Cor, blimey! This place is ripe for the picking with loot and plunder of all kinds - we should strip it clean in Stromfels' name!

Our enemies think they 'ave the edge, but you an' I know differently - destroying this place of theirs will deal them a heavy blow, make no mistake. Shall we burn it all down and take their trinkets for ourselves?

localised_title: No Grave for the Grail Knight
localised_description: Ahhh the fancy king of Bretonnia, with 'is - admittedly really quite lovely - suit of armour and 'is pious devotion to that old hag. He thinks 'imself untouchable, yer know! We should rend 'im in two - break the illusion of infallibility and crush the false hope he gives to his people! Let's see 'im talk of destiny with an axe through his 'ead!

The leader of that stupid herd of Beastmen has reared its particularly 'ungry 'ead once again. I say we lop it orft and watch 'is Gors crumble. I'd like to see 'em try to hunt without 'im - they'll be chargin' 'round in circles, attackin' each other. Free entertainment! Hilarious!

The Dark Gods' lackies swarm around a single leader, who 'imself is obsessed with their grace and favour. This will make our job quite a lot simpler - his death will be the end for these armies of Chaos, so we need to kill this so-called 'Everchosen' in battle, and soon, afore the whole bally lot of 'em show up and we're in bit of a pickle!

Ahh, Luthor Harkon - the ruler of the so-called Vampire Coast, no less. I say we throw 'im all the way down to Stromfels' Chest for the arrogance he's shown, or maybe we send 'im back to The Awakening as just another lifeless corpse to be raised an' bound? Either option works for me!

That prissy, long streak o'seaweed, the ruler of the lanky Dark Elves, is little more than hot air in a barrel. I say we end his reign and the send the Druchii into a panic. Then, we can just pick 'em off like fish in said same barrel. Job done and off to Sartosa for a slap-up feast and grog for all the boys! Yarrr!!

The Dwarf Lord? Do me a favour! He's no more than a petty, bitter librarian consumed by imagined slights an' supposed insults. He's also really, really short, which many of the lads find 'ysterical. We should crush 'im and then write the final entry in 'is blood!

Wow, the emperor 'imself has shown up! That must mean we're doin' something right. Remember he's just a politician, really, 'oo plays at being a warrior. I say we meet 'im in battle so 'e can see first hand that dead pirates cannot be swayed by fancy cloaks an' pretty words.

Oh look - the big boss of the Greenskins has graced us with 'is presence. Like all his kind, he's too stubborn to die and too stupid to retreat in the face of a force like ours! If we can't kill this one, we should bury 'im under an endless zombie horde - either way, he must be dealt with before sundown.

The greatest swordsman in all of Ulthuan 'e may be, but he's still mortal, which we can all agree puts 'im at something of a disadvantage. Shall we introduce the fool to the Gunnery Mob? A dozen or two blunderbusses to the face oughta end this so-called 'sword master'!

As powerful as it is ancient, so they say - the 'ead of all the Lizardmen. I know these snakes, however, and I can tell yer now if we cut off its head, the others will flounder - it'll be the beginnin' of the end for our oldest foes!

The leader of those pathetic Norscans is said to be an accomplished warrior who 'as travelled many a sea. Whether or not that be true - and I suspect it's just flannel as he's just a walking beard really - we should remain cautious. I say we do not take 'im lightly but do take 'is head, yarrr!!

The 'Headtaker' - yep, I know, the arrogance of the thing - is apparently the greatest warrior those cowardly ratmen have to offer. If this be true, then slaying 'im in battle will crush the morale of 'is whole pathetic, ratty race. Couldn’t come soon enough if you ask me!

Ahhh, our old friend the king of self-congratulation - a legend in 'is own lunch hour - is drawn up in front of us with an army. A shame, as we could've 'atched a few lucrative schemes with the Tomb Kings, but instead we're gonna 'ave to kill the lot of 'em. Let's grind 'is army into the dust!

There's nothin' like a good, honest, vengeful rivalry… and this is nothin' like one! Your Unlivin' rival's petty machinations are growing tedious and unimaginative - killin' him in battle will free us from this walkin' annoyance and free up 'is victims to be killed, raised an' bound by us!

They call 'im 'Ariel's Chosen', but when it comes down to it he's little more than a sea dog, but not a good one - a pathetic whelp who'll be easily overcome I'm sure. We should take the battle to 'em before the midwinter pyre robs us of the chance to strike a crushing blow to the Asrai's morale!

Ha! The Bretonnians really are the limit! This foolish 'champion' of sorts believes that their mythical 'Lady' will protect 'em from us! Let's show all those who follow false gods that none can withstand Death's cold embrace! Well, except you of course - you're Unlivin' proof you are.

Oh 'ere we go - more grunting an' nonsense from the beasts o'Chaos. Apparently, this particular 'effer is revered among his stinkin' kind - let's fill it full of lead an' show 'em that pistols trump everything else!

It appears that the Dark Gods are playing their tedious games with yet another simpleton - he believes they actually expect 'im to triumph in battle - against us!! Can you believe the stupidity? I say we kill 'im quickly and put an end to this miserable tale!

Our rivals think they can challenge our power, so we must assert our dominance, lest every scurvy-ridden sea dog on the ocean believes they too can turn on us. Kill their leader in battle, then all will see that it is us an' us alone who rule the waves of this world!

The weasely Druchii believe that it is they who harbour the lords of dread, but we know different like, don't we? Let's prove their misconceptions to be falsehoods - Show 'em the true meaning of dread - slay this leader of theirs in full view of their men!

Normally, I’d be dead bored by this point, but as it turns out, this Dwarf has proven to be quite fierce. Not a problem for a vicious, murdering bunch of pirate scum like us though is it? And killin' him should deal a significant blow to 'is declining race! Let's do it!

This Imperial type has proven popular among both his men an' the Empire's diplomats, such as they are. I reckon that killing 'im and raising his corpse will shake the whole of man's realm to its stupid, cowardly core! Let's spill some blood - pass my bill 'ook, Bernie!

Though 'tis well known that Greenskins are stupid an' pointless, this particular specimen has been developin' somethin' of a reputation among 'is kind as an apt killer. If that be the case, we should kill 'im in battle an' break the morale of 'is boys - they'll crumble in no time, you mark my words!

The High Elves may well be famed for their martial prowess, but no matter how talented they are, sheer numbers will eventually break even the greatest warrior. Prove that to the Asur by saddlin' up the Undead horde and sendin' 'em out.

I like to think of the Lizardmen as a single, giant snake - cut the head orft an' they'll flop about a bit, then breathe no more. If they dare to move against us again, we should kill their leader, sit back and 'ave a few rums whilst they flail and flounder.

This Norscan 'champion', it would appear, has managed - unbelievably - to attract the attention of 'is fickle gods, the Ruinous Powers, an' has gained a name for 'imself as a warrior who does not fear death in any of its guises. He may not fear 'is end, but he would do well to fear what happens afterwards!

The Skaven - as a whole, you understand - are like a ship without a keel: totally spineless. This particular specimen may well have risen through their verminous ranks, but that's of little merit really. I say we kill this ratman - in fact, let's kill 'em all, every last man rat of 'em!

This Tomb King believes it is our equal in battle, but several ages 'ave passed since they were top o'the food chain. We should grace this nauseating bag o'bones with a second an' final death! Shall we kill 'em again? Come on, I want a go...

Our landlocked cousins believe themselves to be superior, even though they just sit there in the dark whilst we're out piratin' for profit! Killing this particular one would serve as a suitable warnin' to others who might want to challenge our dominance. Let's do 'em - as a warning like!

They say that the forests an' woodlands of Athel Loren are burstin' with life - that's even more livin' for us to choke the life out of then, no? We should start by plucking this 'ere weed - sorry, did I say 'weed'? I meant Asrai leader!

Those mortals of Bretonnia ride atop their steeds, thinkin' themselves all unstoppable like. Clearly, they need to be confronted an' filled with musket balls, then raised back into our service. Imagine... our very own elite cavalry brigade! Let's get down to it - there's much killin' to be done!

Ere we go again! They are certainly relentless, those tinkers the Beastmen, but they've been roaming around the land for far too long, unchecked. It's time we met 'em in battle and put an end to their hunt once an' for all - what say ye?

The armies of Chaos march this way, believing themselves chosen by the Dark Gods and tasked with bringin' about the End Times. What a load o'guff, I say - I don't think their Gods 'ave even noticed they're 'ere! Just as well, really, as we're going to kill 'em all now an' put their army under new management!
Rival pirates have gathered a mighty crew, the cheeky bunch o'beggars! Let's greet 'em with a broadside that will shiver their timbers an' rattle their stinkin' Undead bones, yarrrr!!!
So, those lanky, cunning Dark Elves have put together a great army in the hope that we'll cave. Naturally, we won't - let's destroy this cruel host before it can get the upper hand!
Ah, Dwarfs - my favourite, you know. I like 'em boiled with just a little salt an' vinegar! Oh, I do like a good feed - let's go an' pick up dinner!

Manann blesses us this day, me hearties - the Empire have sent an army of their very best living men to face us. Let's not muck about - 'ow about we kill 'em quickly and reinforce our ranks 'n' ratings?
Eads up, lads - 'ere come the Greenskins, literally 'mob-'anded' and 'ungry for… well, their own deaths, I reckon, once our Gunnery Mobs get stuck in and cut 'em in two!

Those 'igh 'n' mighty High Elves mean to meet us in battle with an elite 'ost no less! Well, I dunno 'bout you but I wouldn't wanna disappoint them - let's march forth and give 'em more than a good run for their money!

These Bretonnian fools have promised the impossible – an errantry war against death itself! Slay these ignorant mortals - they're nothin' but a nuisance and it warms me cockles to see 'em screamin' and drownin' in all that armour!

The Beastmen have dared to enter territory that everybody knows belongs to us - the little scamps! We can't let a transgression like that go unpunished now, can we? Let's kill all of 'em and then I suppose we'll 'ave to find a use for their corpses...

Like clockwork, the armies of Chaos 'ave arrived, seeking to destroy all we've built up o'er the years. Yep - I agree, it is unacceptable behaviour. We should meet them in battle and see to their immediate destruction.

A band of rival pirates 'ave invaded our land and are looking to take our loot for 'emselves! Cheek like this simply cannot stand! We need to block off their retreat and finish them in battle once and for all!

Dark Elves 'ave marched into lands that all 'ere know are rightly ours. We can't tolerate this sort of thing - give 'em an inch an' they take a nautical mile. Let's load up the cannons with buckshot an' fill 'em full o'holes!
The Dwarfs have invaded our land - these stunted fools come seeking our territory but all they'll find is their own doom! Yarrr! March against 'em - turn 'em into steaks for our tea!
The Empire might claim these lands as their own, but the fools don't realise that we acquired this prize fair an' square, like, and we will not relinquish it without a fight. So, let's go to battle!
They're nothin' if not persistent, those dirty little Greenskins. They've come here, to *our* land and seek battle. I saw we give 'em what they want an' preferably more than they can 'andle!

Those highfalutin, lanky landlubber, the High Elves, 'ave sent an army to our lands, bless their cotton socks. Apparently, they've got destruction on their minds, which must be awful for 'em, the poor mites. Let's relieve 'em of their lives, shall we? Shall we raise our dead and prepare for a scrap?

Those snaky Lizardmen are invading! Trouble is, at one point all this belonged to 'em, so they've got the arse 'bout our presence 'ere. I reckon that we need to push 'em back before they can undo all our progress in these parts!
Those dirty Norscan dogs 'ave invaded our lands - *our* lands, the cheeky swines. Let's seek 'em out and send 'em back to the frozen north from whence they came!

You've really gotta watch 'em like a hawk - those tenacious ratmen have burrowed their way into our lands. Let's take the breath from their bodies and break this host into lots o'little rat pieces! Yarrr!!

The stinkin', untrustworthy Tomb Kings have gathered together their armies of old and moved 'em against us. Seems a bit unfair - after all, we just want loot an' power - that's not too much to ask it is? Let's meet 'em in battle an' ensure they do not march again.

The sneaky, but nevertheless namby-pamby milksops, the Vampire Counts, have raised their own Undead force and march into our lands. Clearly this is more than a bit naughty - it is unacceptable. We've allowed them to exist alongside us for long enough; this affront will be their final mistake – let's get to battle!

The Asrai - that's Wood Elves to you uneducated lot - 'ave got off the fence led their armies against us in an invasion of our lands, their armies bolstered by tree-spirits, whatever they are. This move will be their undoing, however, as the rot of death seeps into their wooden allies we'll seek their destruction! Prepare for battle!

The Lizardmen have raised an army - no doubt what's on their minds is mashin' us up into a pulp. I know, I know - like they 'ave a hope, especially with Stromfels and Manann at our backs. I saw we attack now before they're good an' ready.

If you tired of the Norscans, chances are you're tired of killin' - they've raised something of a force, intendin' to go to war on behalf of the Dark Gods'. I think we need to slay 'em all before they can march forth and cause problems for us.
A horde of dirty, stinkin' ratmen 'ave been seen up 'ere on the surface, where they 'ave no right to be. I think we need to get raisin' and bindin' an' then deal with these pests, without delay!

Never takin' no for an answer, the Tomb Kings 'ave raised an army an' surely plan to attack us. Under the circumstances, I think it would be best that we meet 'em in battle an' crush 'em before they've even begun to march!

The Vampires of this land 'ave raised an army and it's looking like they intend to meet with us on the battlefield. This will definitely be their last mistake – let's move to head 'em off an' then slay every last one of 'em with stakes an' garlic an' whatever else we can find, yarrr?

Part of the trouble wiv Wood Elves - 'cos there's several ways they can get on yer nerves - is that you never know where yer truly are with 'em. You can't trust 'em and you can't live with 'em, so the only remainin' option is to kill as many of 'em as you can - preferably all of 'em at once. Let's go!
Now, I know it may not sound particularly piratey to you, but a pact between us *is* required. An alliance will guarantee that our plundering days continue for quite some time yet.

The people of this realm are overburdened with luxuries, the poor beggars! I say we aid these unfortunate mortals an' lighten their loads somewhat. What do yer reckon? Let's raid their roads to free them of their 'eavy burden.

Those swindlin' scallywags - those honourless pirates - 'ave stolen the riches of the land and the poor folk that live there! Its our duty, as good, honest, 'ardworkin' sailors, to take back these treasures and, er, return 'em to their rightful owners. Let's raid, pillage, and plunder, until we've reclaimed every last stolen penny!

The Dark Elves will never achieve their goal to return to Ulthuan if they continue to be distracted by such unnecessary trifles! We need to raid their lands an' take their treasures away - they'll thank us in the long run I'm sure.

That dying race of Dwarfs still 'ave plenty o'treasure down in the vaults of those holds they dare not return to for fear of rats 'n' Orcs 'n' the like. They can’t miss what they don’t know is missing - I say we loot these holds for ourselves!

Apparently, the Empire’s trade routes are - and I quote - "fraught with dangers". I say the mortals who take these roads are asking for trouble! Let's raid these 'em an' punish the merchants who travel them for their truly terrible 'ubris - a terrible thing in any being.

Stromfels an' Manann - gods, I hate the Greenskins, wiv their… green skins an' nasty breath. Some of 'em 'ave the beginnings of an understanding of the value of treasure, but most are more interested in pullin' teeth outta the dead. I call that "poor asset management", and it's not on - let's raid their stashes and punish these gits!

Renowned for their craftsmanship an' the beautiful trinkets they make, the High Elves certainly 'ave abilities. Unfortunately, those abilities don't extend to defeatin' the likes of us - let's take their gold off of 'em and inspect it for ourselves!

Those Lizardmen - an' you've gotta admire they're persistence on this matter - are still pitifully clingin' on to the words of a dead race lost to time. We need to relieve 'em of this burden - take those statues they still obsess over an' teach 'em a lesson!

Norscans are far too uncivilised to understand the true value of the treasure they hoard - clearly, only we appreciate its real worth. Shall we take their trinkets from them, so they learn somethin' about the true nature of the world?

The ratmen have no interest in the beauty of gold and treasure, as they only trade in Warptokens an' backstabbin'. They steal the world's wealth to deny superior races their glory, which is more than a bit of a liberty. Let's take back these riches shall we?

The Nehekarans once understood the value of gold an' built great big monuments to celebrate their wealth. Now, the Tomb Kings just obsess over little jars an' forget 'emselves. If they don't want 'em, we should take their riches away - think of it as de-clutterin' like...

Forever plotting an' schemin' - far more than us - the lords of this 'ere land won’t even notice if we lift a few treasures from under their… well, where their noses used to be anyways. Shall we raid this region while they are distracted? Would make sound commercial sense in my opinion.

I freely admit that I don't understand Wood Elves. The Asrai’s lands are filled with riches, but they spurn 'em and 'ang about in the trees for centuries. It don't make sense, does it? Let's launch a raid against 'em an' take these treasures for ourselves!

There's plenty of dead in the ocean now, all waitin' to be raised for our armies an' crews. Trouble is, we've not got enough chiefs - we need more leaders to control 'em. I think we should summon a new Lord - you agree?

The livin' Bretonnians act against us! It would appear that they're planning to strike at us using this settlement as their base of operations. We need to get over there an' burn it down before they can act.
Our rivals out at sea 'ave taken this land - we can't allow 'em any respite, mind you. We need to burn down their settlements an' take their ships for ourselves - we alone rule the seas!
The Dark Elves 'ave interfered with our plans for too long! Let's destroy this settlement in order to remind 'em that the dead rule the seas… and the coasts… and, er… well everywhere really!

Once again, those pesky, landlubbin' Dwarfs hide in their mountain Holds, hoping to weather the storm that's surely comin' - too stubborn to die, too indecisive to put up an effective fight. This will be their fatal error - destroy this Hold and make it their burial tomb instead!

That phoney god of men, Morr, sends 'is servants to ensure the dead stay restin' an' never rise again. These worshippers must be killed if the dead are to rise to *our* call. It's fitting, then, that we kill 'em an' raise 'em to our service! Let's destroy their base of operations!
The filthy, maraudin' Greenskins occupy this land. We really cannot coexist with such savages as these, can we? Shall we burn down their settlement for 'em, as a bit of a gift, yarrrr?
The tide is rising an' the wind is right, so the time to attack the Asur is nigh. Let's burn down this settlement while the waves are still supportive of our cause?

The Lizardmen have long been a thorn in our side, so we must burn down this land o'theirs - destroy their spawning pools an' raze their fancy temples too. It's almost a shame to be sayin' goodbye to our oldest foes!
More Norscans, gettin' in the way and makin' a nuisance of 'emselves! It'll be noisy and painful for them, but we need to burn their place down now so that we may push forward.

The Skaven 'ave built their city beneath the ruins of our next target. If we just bring these ruins down upon 'em we'll crush our enemy down into their 'oles - it'll be really 'ard, if not impossible, for 'em to come back from somethin' like that!

I tell yer - they're just not interested in all that gold an' wealth anymore. We could get in there, burn down their place and take all these riches for ourselves. There'll barely even notice - trust me!

The Vampires of this land raise the dead for their own purposes, which of course denies us potential crewmembers. Naturally, we can't allow 'em to steal from us, so let's burn down their stronghold an' carry the corpses for ourselves, yarrr?
The terrain here in this woodland impedes our movements. If we destroy the settlement an' spread death's embrace through its roots, they'll never come back at us, not in a million years!

A Mourngul Haunter has strengths which absolutely should not be underestimated - its eternal hunger for flesh can be a great asset to us, remember. However, it's worth notin' that our control over such a beast can never be entirely certain...

Let’s recruit a Vampire Fleet Captain; they aren’t half good at magic an' know a thing or two about ships as well! Just point 'em at the enemy, give 'em a share of the booty and you’ve got yourself a fine new crewmember!
Let's summon a Gunnery Wight shall we? It'll aid our missile units no end - the expertise they've retained from their, er, actual lives, is invaluable to us.
Our melee hordes are so numerous there's no army - livin' or dead - that can match 'em, in my estimation. I say we raise even more - what say you?

Considering they're really quite dead and there's bits droppin' off 'em, the dexterity of our Zombie Horde is second to none. That bein' the case, shall we raise more of 'em an' watch the enemy drown in lead?
Our armies require long-range firepower, just like our ships. We should therefore recruit some artillery to open up a devastating new sea-rout to destruction - yarrr!!
The terrible creatures at our disposal are fearsome in battle - we could make use of 'em an' lay waste to our enemies'… well, everything our enemies 'ave, includin' their lives!

The search for the wreck of the Vengeance is underway and using the map we gained from the shop in Sartosa we have set sail to the shallow seas of the Dragon Spine. However, upon arrival we have spotted a ship flying the flag of The Sunken Land Corsairs. What these pirates are doing at this very location is unknown, it is perhaps a coincidence, but regardless they stand before us and the wreck of the Vengeance; and more importantly the Star-metal Harpoon sunk within her.

localised_title: The Pearl of the Kraken Sea
localised_description: Jus’ north o' Norsca thar be a little-known expanse of ocean called the Kraken Sea. It is important to them crackpot Northmen o’ the nearby coastline of Skjold, who drop the remains of their fallen warriors there. T’them, there be great favour to be had bein’ eaten up by those mutated sea-monsters of Chaos, but some of the souls are rejected by the fickle Gods, marooned underwater an’ forsaken ‘til the right juju gets ‘em up an' killin’ again.

The pirate known as Lucky Levi met ‘is end at the ‘ands of ‘is own men after dabblin’ in black magic with 'is lucky rabbit’s foot. The fool was tryin’ to raise Zombie Deckhands for his crew, but ‘is first mate was not best pleased at bein' replaced by the walkin’ dead, an’ so shivved his cap’n while he slept. But Levi’s Undead mob continued to serve their master, throwin’ the first mate an’ the rest of the livin’ crew overboard an’ scuppered Levi’s ship.

Make no mistake, a swarm o’ Fell Bats at sea always ends in blood-soaked waters. As the pirate cap’n Salazar sailed his ship the Salt Lord up the cursed coast of Mousillon, carryin' a single rare Estalian shillin’ swiped from the castle-port o’ Castelo Novo, the blood-suckin’ monsters attacked, killin’ cap’n an' crew in seconds. They say the evil things made their home amongst the rotting corpses an' tattered sails of the driftin’ vessel, but the Salt Lord was ne’er seen by mortal eyes again.

High above Manann's ocean realm, in the place them landlubbers call the Southern Grey Mountains, thar be a place wiv vast seams o’ gold ore known as the Vorgo Crags.
