Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The goddess of the hearth, healing and brewing, Valaya once bestowed great gifts upon the Ancestors so that we could assist our fellow Dawi in need. There is no doubt that all Dwarfkind will be greatly boosted by the return of these powerful items.

The accursed demands to aid Skavenblight have left your resources depleted and your position weak. Raiding the enemy will furnish what you require, and keep your minions busy enough to prevent them plotting against you.

localised_title: The "Get Off My Chuffing Land!" Grudge
localised_description: In Grimnir’s outraged sight, the filthy, chuffing Greenskins dare hold on to Khazids owned and built by Dawi of Karak Kadrin. This is a grudge that must be avenged immediately!
Looked upon in shame by Grimnir, the cheating elgi curs have brought low our throng. This defeat must be avenged.
Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, the elgi host came and by some quirk of fate or outright cheat, they have defeated us in battle. Log that in the book!
As seen by Grungni, the inscrutable Lizardmen unfairly attacked and defeated our throng - an injustice that must be brought upon these cold-blooded cravens.
An outrage in Grungni's sight, the filthy, devious ratmen have ambushed honourable Dawi warriors and slain many fine fellows. The most vile of grudges - vengeance is demanded!
Witnessed by Valaya, the filthy murder-worshipping elgi raid our lands. Stop these thin-skinned wazzocks and settle this grudge.
Under the withering gaze of Valaya, the so-called 'High Elves' raid our lands. The low elgi filth! Mark it in the Dammaz Kron and bring them to justice.
Under the very eyes of Grimnir did the Lizardmen raid Dwarfen lands. A crime against the Ancestors; revenge is the only answer against these filthy reptiles.
Seen by an enraged Grungni, the stealing Thaggoraki raid our lands, taking our hard-earned treasures and innocent Dawi lives. Revenge is demanded!
In view of Valaya, the damnable, dark-hearted goth-loving elgi dare to sack our holds. Have every last one of them found and killed!
In Grungni's deplored sight, the sour-faced elgi sacked a Hold of our kin. These humourless wazzocks need a good spanking!
In Morgrim's strained sight did the reptiles come and sack our settlements like the cowardly cold-blooded mongrel things they are! It is recorded and so requires action!
Seen by a disgusted Grungni, the noisome vermin dare to enter our Holds like the chuf-eating bastards they are. A great crime must be righted - kill the thaggoraki!
As witnessed by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the dark-hearted elgi take Dawi settlements for their own. The cravens must pay and the Khazids returned to the Karaz Ankor.
By Valaya's sight do the elgi come to our realms and take our towns. A curse on these thin folk. Return the stolen settlement to us at once!
As witnessed by Smednir, the Lizardmen have taken our mines and towns. A crime whose coldblooded perpetrators must be punished!
The so-called lions of Bretonnia are feeble kittens. Have them murdered.
Hunt this Gor and take its filthy head!
The Northmen often mistake us as fellow peons to their dark masters. A reminder is needed that the Druchii answer to no one.
As the Dreadlords bicker they send their Khainite servants into the night.
The stunted whisker-hoarder has crossed us - Khaine's wrath upon him!
These inferior creatures do not know their place - murder their champion, spread fear amongst their feeble populace.
Find the Greenskin beast that threatens our plans and sanction his life, as sacrifice to Khaine!
Seek out the Ulthuan cur that frustrates us - take their life and crush their Waystone!
An amphibian of the south dares to frustrate the plans of the Witch King; swift reprisal is called for.
The vermin think themselves competent assassins - they have no idea!
This Dark Magic spinner thinks himself immune from murder simply because he is already dead. Prove him wrong!
The Tree-dwellers of the east may think us cousins, but familial blood will not save this target.
The fragile mayflies that worship the lake-hag think their lands safe… think them protected… they are not.
It is time to draw fresh borders in our chill lands. The map will be drawn in the blood of enemies.
The mountain halls of the Dawi are the remnants of a dying race - time to put them out of their misery.
The throne of man is fragile and can be easily shattered. Send the ravagers west!
The Greenskin lands are arid and worthless, there is no reason to take them other than spite. Never let it be said the Druchii lack this worthy attribute.
A worthy mission, one that has been issued before and will be again. Take the realms of the feeble Asur!
The Lizardmen hoard great power in their humid, sweltering jungle hovels. We must seek it out, plunder and enslave!
As distasteful as it is, we must take the Under-lairs away from the vermin. They no longer need them.
The tomb castles of the dead, and the fell lands surrounding them, are saturated in Dark Magic. Such power will be of use.
It is time to take the trees from the Asrai. They will resent this move above all others. Good!
The king of the backwater realm mocks us. We will reap a toll from his people and the pretend goddess they revere.
The Cloven Ones think to make war with us. Such primitives have no idea what a true war is!
The thralls of the Chaos Gods think to shackle us; it is time to put the Northmen in their place!
We shall make war! Power is at stake, and the spilling of blood will put us in good stead with the God of Murder!
This should not take long. We will wage a war upon the Dwarfs. It will be short and bloody, just like their corpses.
Bring about a violent war upon the cretins of Sigmar, wreath their corpses, towns and lands in blood and fire.
The Greenskins like war? Then we will give them it, feed them so much violence they shall choke on it!
All other wars are a sideshow - there is only, one true war…
We make war with the reptiles. We shall show these primitive beasts how the civilised kill!
It is not for the vermin to dictate to us when death comes. War comes to Hruddithi whether they want it or not!
If the dead crave war to keep them away from the Dark Prince's embrace, then who are we to disappoint them?
The Asrai are weak - now is the time to make war on the scions of the God of the Hunt and his ailing queen.
Your mission is clear: seek out the king, or his insipid maid, and bring them low. Murder them in Khaine's name!
The Beastlord taunts you. To kill it in delicious battle will show the consequences of mocking the Druchii.
The Dark Gods send their champions to test us. Hunt them down in battle and show the Dark Gods what true warriorhood is.
Who is Khaine's favoured? There is only way to find the answer…
Take the crown off the fat fool's head… but only when the Dawi cretin is a tiny, lumpen corpse.
The leaders of mankind's broken empire are foolish indeed to challenge your might. Meet them in battle and show them why!
Such beasts waste our time, distracting us from the true cause. Make short work of their leaders and the rest will flee in terror.
The Princes of Ulthuan are our most hated foes, but to kill them in battle is not enough! Make them beg for mercy, but never give them any!
These scaly relics of a forgotten era think themselves relevant - finish them in battle, and prove them irrelevant!
Skaven fur is not prized, yet a cloak of their mangy coat made from their most powerful may amuse our gods - if only for a fleeting moment.
It is laughable they think themselves nobles - they have neither the poise nor legacy. Slay them in battle - show them how true nobility behaves.
This king and his tree-pet offer no threat to us - we should kill them at the height of their power and laugh as their followers weep!
The one that disguises herself as some mannish god has champions - show her how weak her chosen are. Make her followers doubt her power!
A beast seeks a worthy challenger, but it is not worthy of us. Give it a quick death, not out of mercy - never that - but only to prove our point.
The Northmen dare receive a few gifts from their Gods and thinks them superior to us! There is only one answer to this insult!
A rival thinks to usurp our progress for his own political game. The time for veiled insults has passed – violence upon the battlefield is the only recourse.
Let the stunted fools list their grudges. There is only one answer for such bookkeepers - to add another insult to their petty list!
The champions of the Empire must secretly crave death, for theirs is an impotent nation. We should give them their desire.
Orcs are loud and uncouth, lacking the merciless efficiency of the Elven race. They brag and jeer - all mouth and no action, unlike the Druchii!
Such precious creatures, these nobles of Ulthuan! More in love with their hairstyle than their skill at arms. That is why we reap them!
Who stands at the peak of the food chain? These so-called predators? I think not!
Skaven are rodents who forgot to walk on all-fours. They are parodies, and their champions are the greatest joke of all. Deliver the punchline!
While mortals quail when faced with the Undead, see them for what they are: vessels of Dark Magic, a handy source of power when slain.
The forest is full of weeds, but there are some things weedier than the plants themselves…
An army of men gallop upon on lands. When prey comes so willingly into our grasp we should not turn down such gifts.
Beastmen sully our lands! Send forth the beast masters to round up this herd!
The Chaos Gods send a host past the watchtowers and into our realm. They seek sacrifice, but it is they who will be placed upon the bloody altar!
A rival city sends legions in a mistaken bid for power. The Black Council will hear of this! In the meantime, the Cauldrons of Blood must be filled.
The impotent chin-hiders have marched into realms claimed by the dynasty of Malekith. Now this Throng will surely end.
Does the Emperor think to cow us with that? A few scared men? Show them why this is such cruel folly.
An Orc force blunders into our realm - turn it back or turn it inside out!
The Asur dare to trespass - Ulthuan is not enough for them. Find and slay their solitary host!
These fools make vows they cannot keep - an errantry war against the Druchii is doomed to failure. Make it so.
The Beastmen invade, but this brayherd will be guided only to its death!
And so the Dark Gods send their thralls. However, we have seen such invasions before and this one is no different, despite what their Everchosen deems.
The Black Council is dissolved - for now at least, there is war in Naggaroth until Destroyer is unsheathed…
That little dalliance a few millennia back between the Dwarfs and the Asur is nothing compared to the hurt we will meter out!
The Empire dares to invade our realm? It is as unthinkable as it is ridiculous! Unleash the legions, halt this madness and bring back a fat tally of slaves!
One of the Greenskins' fell gods has sent his scum into our realms. Drive them out!
Aenarion's bastard children dare to invade us! Destroy the usurpers, make Isha shed many tears!
They come from the south - the reptiles of fallen, decrepit gods. We will send them back to their makers!
The ratmen come, defiling realms Atharti has set aside for the Druchii. The vermin must be pay - there can be no mercy!
The Vampires come - thinking to cast dusk upon the Land of Chill - but the night is already here!
The Asrai invade, spreading their decrepit Ghyran magic. Repulse and destroy.
An army of reptiles slither into our realms; it needs stamping on - as would any form of infestation.
Skavenblight sends a force of rats to undermine our realm. Show their Council what happens when it crosses the Witch King!
An Undead host marches into your realms. Send our forces to unbind and destroy the corpse legion!
A kindred of King Orion trespasses. The hypocrisy is staggering, they brook no intruders in their realms yet dare trespass in ours?
An alliance is necessary - find one before the Hag Queens grow impatient. However, ensure we are the ones to end the pact - and on our terms.
Raid the nations of men - start with the fools and victims of Bretonnia.
If we do not strike first against this rival, they will come for us.
The Dawi hoard riches and useful resources - if we take a few bearded slaves with us, then more's the better.
The mannish empire is said to be a place of milk and honey… and now blood and death!
Go to the Badlands and raid from the Greenskins - find their mounds of 'shiny stuff'.
Raid Ulthuan. Take every last resource, every soulstone and soul you can!
Strike into the jungles - find what secrets the reptiles keep there.
The Skaven gather Warpstone - it is of limited value to the Druchii, but we should take it to spite them all the same.
…may still horde power. Dark Magic and ancient lore is gathered and jealously guarded by Vampires and Necromancers - take it all!
Raid Orion's realms: burn and destroy and bring back Asrai slaves!
The Age of Hateful Peace is long past. Muster the garrisons, the Druchii march to war!
The time for spite is now - burn the mannish hovels to the ground!
This culture is for the strong; mercy is weak. Raze and destroy your enemy's cities.
The Dawi mines may not burn but can easily be flooded with water or blood - it matters not which.
It is time the men of the Empire knew that their god is a fraud. He will not come to save them. Let their nation burn!
We do to the Greenskins what they would do to our towers, but we do it with a certain flair!
Do you wish to live deliciously? Then burn and raze the homes of our despicable kin!
The temple-cities are covered in gold. It is a metal that holds little value to us, yet depriving others of it is reward itself.
Burn the burrows and tunnels of the Skaven, turn their networks into a furnace!
The cities of the dead are shrouded in necrotic gasses - how easily they will burn!
The tree will burn - the Asrai shall see the home charred and destroyed. This is the way to greatness!
Khaine demands, so we should provide.
The shadows are empty - it is time to fill them with murder!
The Mistress of Magic calls forth a willing acolyte.
Have the bolt-wrights manufacture more artillery. If they hesitate, flog them.
Seek out more Cold Ones, so our warriors may ride steeds worthy of their majesty.
The time has come for the Dreadlords of the Citadels to release their best. The Age of Strife is here.

localised_title: Let Fly the Shards of Death
localised_description: The Asur think they are something at range - we shall blot out the sky with our firepower!
Call upon Clar Karond - have the Beastmasters summon their pets.
The flower of Bretonnia unfurls; we should pick its most lustrous petal.
The warherds need taming. Seek out their alpha and end him!
Kaos comes - we should seek out their champions, such as this one.
The Druchii coward wreaks havoc upon us. Send his soul to the Dark Gods!
Find the short prideful one that frustrates us - silence his boasts and grudges.
Mankind sends their agent, but this child knows nothing of the world - his ignorance will be his undoing!
The Green Tide throws up a herald. Find and slay this nuisance.
The Princes play games of intrigue, oblivious to the true peril. Silence him with the speed of Asuryan.
The jungle dwellers have unleashed a reptilian agent to frustrate us; it needs dealing with.
The Skaven are up to mischief. Hunt down their agent, find out what it thinks it knows and silence it!
The mayflies - mankind - look upon us with jealously, wanting our lifespans and cheating death to do so. Look at this creature as an example.
While we oft-remain cordial with our Asrai cousins, occasionally the king's followers stray too far from the woods…
That mankind thinks it owns the western coasts of the continent is amusing; that they think to keep them, even more so.
The Druchii make much of invading Ulthuan, let us see how they react when we take their frozen lands.
Must we take their dirty, dark, musty, horrid mines?
The Empire have proven an ineffective bulwark against the Dark Gods - it is time to claim the lands for the Asur.
The lands of the green tide must be taken and risen so that the fell sea of green stench is contained.
These lands were once ruled by your ancestors. It is time they were returned!
Claim the jungle - the secrets within will enlighten us all.
Take the lands of the Skaven, if only to cleanse and scour them.
We must invade the dead realms and bring life to the desolate soil.
Our Asrai cousins must understand that their realms have always been those of the Phoenix Throne; it is only now that we must enforce that claim.
The Bretonnians are not our allies. They think in the short term as befits their lifespans. We must act.
There is only one answer when dealing with the Children of Chaos - war!
The Dark Gods and their mortal followers must be stopped. The Asur go to war!
The longest war - the most bitter of all wars - begins again!
The Dwarfs spout about the grudges accrued by the Asur. Time to strike our own record!
Come, Men of the Empire, face the might of the Asur!
The Orcs have ever-been a blunt spear in our flank. It is time to go on the offensive and snap its accursed shaft!
Civil war may be rare but it is not unheard of. Once more a Prince's intrigue spills out onto the battlefield.
The reptiles are keepers of great power, which is needed, but they obfuscate. Unfortunately, war is the only answer.
There can only be war against the rat-men; their kind deserve nothing less.
The Unliving are an offence to the Goddess Isha; the Everqueen has deigned they cannot be allowed to exist.
It is regrettable, but the Asur and Asrai must go to war.
The Royarch of the Bretonni or his Fay-mistress have wronged us. Seek either out in battle.
Send the hosts, hunt the warherds, and take the horns from their most powerful beasts!
The champions of order must seek out the champions of destruction! Let it be so!
The Khainite Assassins are not the only ones who can target death; we will seek out the wretched bloodline who brought the Sundering down upon us!
Find the stunted king and take his crown… and his beard for our collection!
The Emperor has proven a threat to the Asur, the kindest and quickest solution is his swift elimination; seek him or his representative out in battle!
Find the Orc Warboss, take the beast's head, and watch his hordes flee!
It was destined to come to this… brother vs. brother - prince vs. prince. The land drenched in blood.

localised_title: Lost Children of the Old Ones
localised_description: The reptiles of Lustria are lost children to a fallen race. We must usher in a new era; their leaders are the cost of this transition.
We must risk disease by coming into contact with the Skaven… yet their leaders must be brought to battle!
The Vampires have a Khaine-cursed habit of returning to life. Seek out their leaders and take their heads!
We must bring silence to the forest - the Kings in the Wood must fall!
A show of force is required for the stubborn men - one of their champions must die so they may learn.
Such primitives only understand one thing. Take down their alpha-brute, spay it - kill it - and then they will know they are beaten.
In the battle's wake, find the mortal champion of Chaos. The Asur will overcome!
The Druchii are obsessed with vengeance over a slight of their own making - now we should give them a real reason for their anger! Find their leaders and slay one!
Seek out Dwarf Thanes and Lords and weave your own cloak from their filthy, Dawi whiskers!
Mankind's warriors are so sure of themselves - let's see just how sure when they face our martial prowess!
The Orcs follow yet another of their thuggish kind; strike it down in front of its followers, so they know of their impotence!
Insults at court are one thing, but in battle it is actions, not words, that will win the day.
The Saurian ancients send a scarred champion against us. It is slow - our speed and precision should make this an easy match…
The vermin have leaders that cower behind their own kind! Such cowardice should not be a surprise - show them why they should fear our coming!

localised_title: What is Dead Should Really Die
localised_description: The weakness of the Undead hordes is their need of champions for animus. Kill their fell leaders and the entire army will fall!
The Asrai are not our natural enemies, but their stubbornness causes ire. A quick kill of a Noble in battle may sway them to the true cause.
The Knights of Bretonnia are laughable versions of our own proud Silver Helms - meet them in battle and show them why!
There is little else to say - it is time to bring the warherds to battle!
Find the Chaos horde - bring forth Aenarion's fury!
No longer on the defensive, it is the Asur's time to act - bring the fight to the Dark Elves and win!
Our warhost shall meet the Dwarfen throng and it will be beards that are lost, not Elven locks.
Men are too focused on their own glory, so we must therefore bring them to battle for a lesson that needs teaching!
Orcs rampage and their path is therefore difficult to predict, even for our Mages. Better to hunt this mob and end it!
We are forced to march on our own kin. The tears of Isha will flow!
The thralls of Ladrielle invade. Make them regret that decision!
The Cloven Ones invade - repel the Beastmen, and send a message to their dark masters that Ulthuan remains pure!
Just as Aenarion did before his ascension to the Phoenix Throne, we must repel a Chaos invasion.
The Druchii return - a bitter desperate invasion. Repel them just as you did at Finuval Plain!
It is the Dwarfs - both ancient allies and foes - that seek our doom. We'll fill their tome of grudges for this!
The Emperor of men has made a grave mistake - the Phoenix Throne is not his to take. Show the mortals why!
This Greenskin invasion will fail just as it did when led by that putrid Goblin, Grom the Paunch.
So it is war within the kingdoms of Ulthuan - such sorrow! We must be victorious so order can be quickly restored.
The servants of the Old Ones fail to adapt as the world changes, and now they invade! They shall fail.
We must not let the filthy ratmen sully the shores of our homeland. Halt the Vermintide at all costs!
The dead come - corpses of mortal men, led by Vampires who seek our power. Strike them down with magic and sword combined!
The dogs of the King in the Woods and their keepers dare to stray beyond the Worldroots and invade us! They must be stopped!
Saurian warriors are hunting in Asur lands! We must not become prey - we must seek them out.
A Skaven army dares to corrupt and plague our realms! The Everqueen orders their destruction, and so we obey.
A Vampire marches his dregs across our lands - syphon Dark Magic and see these corpses return to natural death.
The King in the Woods sends guards into Asur realms - a trespass that must be answered!
We must ally with the short-lived if we are to beat those that bring darkness to our shores.
Finubar, at the behest of his war council, sends forth a call to muster - one which every Asur must answer.
The cities of Bretonnia are a foul parody of the Elven havens they were built upon. Imitation is not flattery!
The spires of Naggaroth should be toppled - it is our duty!
The Dwarfholds are crude affairs - both aesthetically and in how they harm the foundations of the mountains themselves.
The mannish hovels are sprawling hives of scum and knavery - it does them good to see such affronts to construction burn.
It is a surprise to see that Orcs live anywhere, but these dwellings hurt the eyes - they should be scoured from sight.
The king demands punishment for rebels and traitors!
Cities of the Lizardmen spent much of their existence lost - make sure these ones remain lost forever!
The Skaven long desire to land on Ulthuan - destroying their burrows and nests will fetter them from the ocean.
The gravesites and necropolises of the Undead are abhorrent to Asuryan and must be destroyed when encountered.
Destroy the tree halls, and may Lileath forgive us!
Our Nobles must be tested in battle, before they join the courts in governance - send for one.
The Loremasters are knowledgeable and well spoken, making fine dignitaries.
High Magic is one that only the mages of Ulthuan can wield - the Slann are a spent force. Send to the White Tower and summon one now.
More artillery is needed. Set the bolt-wrights to work!
Swift Elven steeds, and the warriors who bear them, are the best in the world.
There is nothing like the gleaming spears and purity of a High Elf warhost. Summon it!
Few can match the archers of Ulthuan, for they are the best in the world. Will they answer the muster?
The bestial allies of the High Elves have ever been the Dragons of Caledor - it time to rouse them.
This trespasser shuns the Old Ones and worships some warmblood construction that lurks in a pond! Destroy!
This creature is an abomination of the Ancient Enemy's design. It must be silenced!
The Ancient Enemy has many mortal servants - this one offends the Old Ones.
The Elf-spawn warmblood consorts with the enemies of the Old Ones. It must be cleansed from the plane.
Those who delve - Dwarf-spawn - send one of their number to frustrate us. Eliminate it.
The Untamed Ones prove themselves unworthy, but this is not a new concept. Nevertheless, our masters have ordered this one's death.
The enemy that is green send one of their number against us. Destroy it.
Elf-spawn meddle in our affairs once more. Our masters have decreed that the death of this one should be a fitting chastisement.
A younger Mage-Priest has misinterpreted the Great Plan. Purging one of his servants will be the most efficient method of realignment.
The Xa'kota send one of their agents against us. Sotek's wrath upon it!
Those that defile the Old Ones rules on life have a creature that threatens us. It must be hunted and destroyed!
These servants must return to the island and leave the trees. Take the life of one to teach them the error of their ways.
The armoured, untamed ones that ride upon fast-moving mammals... their lands have been declared forfeit by the Great Plan.
The Elven servants denigrate their purpose… to serve. Now, they consort with Daemon-spawn. We must flush them from the cold lands they have mistakenly declared their own.
The short warmbloods have delved too far. It is against the Great Plan to dig that deep. Take the mountains from them!
The cosmos screams, for it knows that the untamed ones wander too far and too quickly. Their realms must be vanquished!
The fungal parasites that have taken hold of this world must be cleansed from the lands. So commands the Lord of the Solar-City.
The servants were left on an island paradise - ringed by the World Pond - but they have proven incompetent in its care. Cold-blooded stewards are needed.
The Geomantic Web weakens due to dissonance and corruption - restorative methods are immediately required.
An infestation plagues the world and Sotek demands action. Take the lands back from the Rat-spawn - purge it of their taint!
Lift the shroud from the lands inhabited by the dead meat that refuses to die!
Those Ringed By Ocean have strayed far from the Old Ones intent. Some have taken refuge in the Worldroots. This is against the Great Plan and must be corrected.
The younger race of mankind must be chastised.
The horned abominations of the Ancient Enemy must be fought and destroyed.
There can be only war against the Ancient Enemy. No other course is to be considered.
We can no longer tolerate the misbehaviour of the Old Ones' servants, especially those who dwell in the north. It is war!
Those who live under the mountains are close to extinction. We should not let them linger…
Our masters have consorted with the stars and declared that war upon the warmbloods is the only answer.
We must give these creatures what they most desire... war.
The Great Plan has been lenient towards the Elf-spawn... until now.
Following a disagreement between two Mage-Priests - one that has been three millennia in the making - there will now be a short war, culminating in realignment.
All vermin must be purged from this world. It is a cosmic decree, the absolute desire of Sotek. Let it begin.
The Undead should not exist. Death is permanence. And so Order must be restored.
The Elf-spawn of the far colonies have invoked the ire of the Old Ones. It can only be war.
The hunt is on. Seek out their leader and devour them!
Ours is a race of eons; theirs, but a few millennia. Show the beasts why by slaughtering their Lord! Tlanxla demands!
There is no greater sacrifice to bring before the Star Chamber: the head of the being who represents the ultimate enemies!
Night surrounds this one. So immersed in darkness, we are blind. Help the Mage-Priests see by its elimination!
The Beard-spawn falsely claim a debt against us. We are the ones who meter punishment to the younger races. Take their king as a reminder.
These children know nothing of the horrors we must face. They get in our way - especially this one. The only answer is his sacrifice - make the necessary preparations!
These beasts are like a writhing serpent. Take its head - hopefully it will not grow back!
Once more we must remind the Elf-spawn of their place: a more permanent punishment is deemed necessary via the removal of their leader.
The Skinks have read and re-read the sacred plaques but have come to the same conclusion: for the great purpose to progress, this one must die.
This should not need saying, but the Rat-spawn leader must die! See to it!
The unnatural one flouts sacred laws laid down by the Old Ones. It must be eliminated in battle!
Complexities with the Geomantic Web and entanglement with the Worldroots leave us no choice but to seek the end of their leader.
This untamed one is causing discordance, like grit between scales. Hunt and kill!
Find this warm-blooded beast and slay it on the battlefield. A worthy sacrifice to Tlanxla!
It is time to hunt! The mummified remains of Lord Kroak stir - it demands the spilling of blood, the death of one aligned to the Ancient Enemy.
There is prey about: an Elf-spawn who defiles our sacred sites. Caxuatn, the Predator, demands that you hunt!
This warmblood has caused great annoyance - it bellows and wears unsightly hair under its maw. It must be hunted in battle and slain!
The arrogance of these younger races must be brought to task. Show them true power by culling one of their number in battle.
The Saurus were not merely bred for war, but designed for it. Show the green warmbloods why, by killing the most powerful of their number.
The servants have spawned a troublesome creature which meddles with things it does not comprehend. Hunt it down in battle!
This one defies the commands of our revered masters. It has been defined as prey. Begin the hunt!
The Rat-abominations are cowards! The Mage-Priests have defined one to slay in battle which will make the rest flee.
The Undead Plague is connected to one of their powerful magic-users. If we hunt this locust and kill it in battle the corpses will atrophy.
To halt the Elf-spawn advance we must hunt their champion. Only in battle will the death honour Tlanxla!
A warmblood cohort of Untamed Ones approaches. It must be destroyed.
The Old Ones have spoken - these horned abominations of the Ancient Enemy should be terminated. Now.
The Ancient Enemy sends forth their abhorrent legions - spawn the cohorts and destroy them!
The dark-hearted Elf-spawn need castigation. Begin the hunt!
The ones that delve are defined by their greed, but now their avarice affects the Great Plan. They must be confronted!
Let the Saurus taste the air - it smells of man-flesh. Begin the cull.
The Orc-spawn come, and we will meet their brash challenge. Send the cohorts forth!
The servants of the island are troublesome; their warhost must be culled.
Intruders! The warmbloods invade. They must be destroyed!
The Cloven warmbloods dare to sully the lands of the Old Ones. Spawn defenders!
The servants of the Ancient Enemy come to invade. They must be stopped!
They come from the north to take our Cold Ones, but no longer! Halt the invasion of the Dark Ones!
Here come the warmbloods upon their short stunted legs - let them see our teeth!
From across the World Pond they come to plunder and invade. Such insolence! Defend and punish!
The Greenskins come and swamp us, trampling through ancient sites. The spawn must be stopped. Repulsed. Destroyed!
The island servants seek to invade sacred realms. They have forgotten their place and their status! Remind them!
Fellow Saurians run amok! They invade our realms, which is not part of the Great Plan. We must defend ourselves!
This is not the first time the Rat-spawn have sought to invade our realms from below. Sotek will have his vengeance - we are his tools!
Corpse-spawn tread on ancient paths… an invading swarm. They are trespassers, whether living or dead, see to their true demise!
The Elf-spawn seek to invade us, but they do not know our trees as we do. Defend the jungle!
These Saurian invaders are discordant! Seek them out and destroy.
An accursed Rat-swarm is loose - send forth your warriors and hunt the vermin prey!
The smell of death leads a trail that can easily be scented by tongue and nose. Hunt down the Corpse-abominations and see them returned to their natural state!
The Elf-spawn from across the world pond send a host. Intercept them and feast on their warmblood flesh!
The plaques show what is already witnessed in the constellations. An alliance is not only expected but necessary!
Order the pool-keepers to scatter the seeds - the spawnings pools must begin gestation!
The Untamed Ones have their own inferior cities and settlements - all their works must be destroyed!
Tear down the cities of despair - let the Elf-spawn know they should have stayed upon their island paradise, gifted to them by the Old Ones. They are ungrateful.
The Mountains were a gift from the Old Ones: sculptures which the warmblood delvers have defiled.
The settlements of the Untamed Ones have no order! They are constructed with no thought to Geomantic alignment. Such disorder must be erased!
Orc-spawn settlements are made from their bodily waste. No such thing was ever intended by any of the Old Ones!
The Elf-spawn servants place their settlements beyond the bounds of their home. This must be punished.
They have displeased the Old Ones and must pay the ultimate price!
Rat-spawn thrive under the ground. Their tunnels must be flooded and their nests purged!
The graves and charnel pits of the Undead must be given back to the jungle!
It is written on the plaques: Elf-spawn must inhabit the island of the World Pond. Nowhere else!
Your cohorts need reliable warriors to lead them. The Saurus will answer to their own.
The Council of Chiefs agrees they must aid us in our great purpose.
A Skink Priest has been sent by his Revered Master; the Mage-Priest has foreseen his purpose with us.
A cave of Cold Ones has been discovered, already tamed and ready for riders. Truly, the Old Ones work in mysterious ways...
More Saurus are needed, for the interlopers always return.
Our revered masters demand more warriors to strike from afar, like a scorpion's sudden sting!
Hunt and herd the jungle's beasts, for they are needed for our great purpose.
Find the pretty Man-thing, stab him good.
This Beastman threatens Skaven. Eliminate that threat. Yes-yes.
An agent of Chaos frustrates us. Clan Eshin have been summoned to kill the thing.
Orders from Skavenblight: kill the nasty, spiky Elf-thing.
The Dwarf-thing must die, yes-yes!
This Man-thing disrupts our plans, send Clan Eshin to deal with it.
Warpstone is green, but other green things are not so nice. Orc-things! Have one killed!
The shiny Elf-thing makes plans against us. Make a lethal plan against him!
Sotek's filthy servant knows of our plans. It must be silenced!
A rival with longer whiskers will get the credit if he is not-not stopped. Hire Eshin, that will solve the problem…
The Dead-thing is not dead. We should make it dead. How should we ensure it stays dead? An Assassin can get it dead.
Find the tree-hugger, send an Assassin to kill it - stab it!
Expand your realm - take the Man-thing kingdom for the Horned Rat.
The land of the spiky Elf-things is ours, the Elf-things just don't know it yet-yet.
The ancient lairs of the Dwarf-things will soon be part of the Under-Empire.
Time to-to rise through the sewers, invade the cities of the Man-things!
The Green-things are in our way. Remove them from their hovels, so we can get to-to the real valuables.
The homeland of the Elf-things remains disgustingly pure. Time to change that.
The Reptile-things think the jungles of Lustria theirs, but this time Sotek will not-not save them!
Time for the Clan to make its move, steal land off the lesser clans and look powerful in front of Council!
The realms of the Undead are ripe for stealing, their dead slaves are too slow to stop us!
We have orders, rot the trees the Elf-things call home, yes-yes!
The Council have spoken, declare war on the Man-things, good-good.
We are the Children of the Horned Rat, they are the Children of Chaos. But which one is best? There is only one way to find out…
The Dark Gods send their nasty Man-things against us. We should make war!
The spiky Elf-things steal our slaves. Those slaves are ours! There is only one recourse.
Time to kill lots and lots of Dwarf-things.
Orders of the Council: war in the Empire-lands, great status awaits the clan that kills the most - go-go!
Get the Orc-things, when their back is turned!
The Vermin Lords whisper to us-us - time to fight the Elf-things. What could go wrong?
The clans are ready. We fight against the Reptile-things and their Toad-thing masters, yes-yes!
Clan war is upon us-us. A good chance to be rid of rivals within and outside the clan.
Make war with Dead-things the Council orders… Why us? Clan Skerris donation to Grey Seers of many Warptokens is surely coincidence!
Declare war on the Elf-things, strip bark from their trees, piss on leaves, yes-yes!
This Man-thing leaders mock you! Do your thralls chitter behind you too? Kill this thing, eat-eat then no one will dare laugh!
The Hoof-thing's time has come. Make all children of the Gods know who stands tallest!
Why-why do Chaos always get to take over the world? Our time! Start by killing this ever-ever-ever champion, or the one with the blonde fur.
Witch king should we fight-fight? Dwarf-thing king? No. Sparkly Elf-thing king? No-no. Spikey Elf-thing king? Yes-yes!
The Dwarf-things have a sparkly crown that should be yours. Kill the thing that wears it, and take the crown to much adulation!
The Man-thing with his hammer or magicks. The Council say he needs dealing with… so deal with it.
Time for the Green-thing to die. Not because the Grey Seers order it, but because it suits your plans.
Time to bring out your best dagger, go and stab that smug Elf-thing. Take its head.
There are ancient things that order the rest of the Reptile-things about. Killing them will give you much status with the Lords of Decay.
Now is your chance to further your plans - kill your rival, and the Council of Thirteen will laud you-you.
These creatures of Nagash are nothing compared to that one, and we took care of him just fine. You don't need the Fellblade. Do it now!
The tree hugging Elf-thing king and the angry Bark-thing must die. This is the Council's orders, do not-not fail.
The Shiny Elf-thing champion frustrates us, see if fall in battle - bite its throat out! Yes-yes!
Only one race is blessed with horns - the Children of the Horned Rat - the others are mere pretenders. Prove the lie by slaying one of their champions.
This Metal-thing seeks to usurp our plans. Eat it, and steal its might.
Spiky Dark Elves are hard to kill and even more difficult to eat - lots of spikes to get stuck in throat and between teeth. Even so, it should be done.
Nothing makes the Clanrats chitter more than seeing a dead Dwarf-thing. Keep your Clanrats on-side by getting your best Dwarf-killing helmet on…
Seek out the Man-thing in battle and escort him to his doooom!
Time for the no-fur Green-things to die. A dagger in the eye of their leader should start things off nicely.
Tall. Smug. Fragile. Elf-things are all these, yes-yes! Time to bring these insufferable Elf-things low. Kill their tallest, purest and watch the others cry-cry!
The Reptile-things are dominated by the Toad-things - kill them in battle and the serpent-worshippers will run.
Another rival - one that wants everything you have acquired-stolen arises. Ensure this creature knows you are the most potent!
The blood-sucking Dead-thing thinks to challenge us. When it turns its rotten back, strike!
There's a pointy-eared Elf-thing that doubts your existence. Show it what is real!
The Man-things fond of riding the Nag-things charge into our realms. Confront them.
The Beast-things dare hunt in out territory - show them who is really hunted!
Spiky-things of enemy Gods send an army against us. Intercept - yes-yes!
The Spiky-Elf-Things have an army pouncing about our realm. The Grey Seers want it intercepted - do it.
The Dwarf-things dare send an army of beards into our realm - they think it's their realm, no-no!
An army of Man-things approaches. Are you hungry?
The Green-things have sent a mob against us. Fool-fools! Show them no mercy!
Here come the Elf-things. Think they can just wander around Skaven territory. Bite their knees off!
The armies of the Hag-thing that squats in horrible clean water sends the Man-things against us. Fight back!
We have plans-schemes to perform and the Hoof-things are a distraction - let them come, then wipe them out!
The Gods that war with the Horned Rat send their minions against His children. We must not fail the Horned One!
The Elf-thing reavers come - we must enslave them before then enslave us!
The Dwarf-things come! Take their heads, take their beards, eat their corpses! No mercy for the hated Beard-things!
The Man-things dare-dare to invade us? We are their nightmares made real - repel and revenge, yes-yes!
The Greenskins send a tide to invade our realms. We will out-breed and overwhelm them. Summon the Vermintide!
By the Horned Rat's Teeth, the Elf-things dare to invade - an outrage that must be stopped!
One of the prophecy's etched into the Black Pillar state how the Serpent-God's long tongue will come for the Skaven. And they must be ready.
Civil war… again. Another clan wants our Warpstone. We should take theirs instead!
The Vampires and their Dead-things invade. After our Warpstone to power their magicks. Stop them-them!
Trees send their roots into our tunnels. The Elf-things and their wood-spirit allies invade. Gnaw at their roots!
The Lizard-things send a force to thwart our plans. Intercept and destroy, yes-yes!
Another clan sends a pack of their Clanrats into our territory. To leave them would be to show weakness…
Dead-things come. Their trespass is a grave error indeed.
The Elf-things march a host into our realm! They must be punished, yes-yes!
We need an alliance! Make a pact, after all, no other race is as loyal and dependable as us, yes-yes!
Raid the Man-things - kill their warriors, take their valuables and steal their children!
They think they are good-good at taking slaves? Will shall show them-them!
The Underway is ours by right - take it from the Dwarf-things!
It is time to reap what the Man-things have sewn. Raid their lands and bring it back to the Under-Empire.
The Green-things are of limited use, but Clan Moulder always has needs of spare specimens. Go and raid their lands.
The Elf-things' lands are said to be incorruptible… we shall see-see about that!
Sotek's slime-covered lands are ours. Clan Pestilens resurgent - yes-yes!
More Warpstone is needed - we shall take-steal it from rivals. The Lords of Decay will never know.
Go into the realm of the Dead-things - take-steal what we need.
Invade their tree-nests - piss on their homes, scat and scavenge their forests!
More rats are needed. Whip the breeders into action. Grow our forces - engorge the packs for battle.
Make the Man-things and their Hag-thing god quail, despoil their lakes and burn their cities to the ground!
The spiky Elf-things look down their fleshy muzzles at us! Bring ruin on their towers.
Bring about destruction upon the stone nests of the Dwarf-things. It is as we have always done-done!
The Man-things choose to forget what we did in Nuln, years ago. They will believe in us after this!
The Orc-thing infestation goes beyond annoying - scour their settlements from the surface.
Burn and break the gleaming towers of the Elf-things. Make them cry pretty tears!
The homes of the Reptile-things cannot just be plundered - they need to be destroyed.
This clan has proven a weak enemy - enslave their Clanrats and burn their nests. All their Warpstone is now ours!
These dead-things are weak. Invade their realm take their Dark Magic, burn their books-tomes! Good-good.
Cut down the trees of the Elf-things. And destroy the rest - make it perfect for-for Skaven occupation.
We need arcane might. Clan Skryre have Warlock Engineers they are willing to-to lend, if we meet their price.
Time to call upon Clan Eshin and petition for a killer.
The Plague Priests sing a hymn of death. Persuade them to your cause.
Bolster your pack with a Warp-lightning Cannon and watch the enemy scuttle away!
To toughen your battle line, breed more of the black-furred Stormvermin.
The Runners that fill the ranks of Clan Eshin can strike target's from afar. Before the enemies whiskers can even twitch.
Clan Moulder demand a hefty price, but it is worth every Warptoken… bring forth the Abomination!
The stunt-rats that pilot the Doomwheels are ready - they just need their mounts…
The sign of the Jaguar God has been witnessed on both the ground and in the sky. Huanchi is on the prowl and so the cohorts must act. A sacred spawning will come forth should the prey be caught.
The signs are in the sky; a sacred spawning is imminent, but first Caxuatn, the Predator, must have his prey.
Slann awaken with a start - their equivalent of a nightmare - but it is just the Old One God of War, Tlanxla, making his will known. When he is appeased, a sacred spawning shall be granted.

The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

The snakes migrate in great numbers, a sure sign that Sotek demands action from one of his chosen priests. If they are worthy then their cohort will be blessed with a sacred spawning.

The Old One Quetli, the Warrior - his stars shine brightest of all. This is an omen that a sacred spawning is due, but sacrificial payment in the blood of enemy warriors is first required.

The Old One known as the Arbiter of Duty has sent a prophecy through the frenzied dreams of the builder Skinks: industry is required and with it will come a spawning of revered beasts.

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

Tlazcotl the Impassive is patient and determined. His sign is flocks of birds suddenly becoming still and silent, perching for days and never moving. The Great Plan will be revealed in time; until then the Lizardmen must grow in power, both militarily and economically. This will please the Old One and award his followers a sacred spawning.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.

The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Winds of Magic coalesce and shift along the Geomantic Web. The Old One, Potec, sends an omen. Should the Slann heed his warning then a sacred spawning is surely due.

A shipwrecked Marauder with a large raven tattooed across his chest – revealing him to be a follower of Tzeentch – is dragged before Teclis. Upon interrogation it is discovered that the Dark Lord of Change may be instigating an imminent invasion of Ulthuan! The High Loremaster must read from the Scroll of Hoeth and know the terrible truth…

Lileath’s Moon Staff was one of three sacred gifts bestowed upon the Elves by the goddess herself. Yet its power wanes, with Skaven activity around nearby Warpstone deposits dampening the staff's potency. To reawaken it, Teclis must purge the vermin from the surrounding lands.

Two of Karond Kar's greatest sons currently roam the world's oceans. One, the Beastlord Rakarth, has filled the city's infamous dungeons with all manner of monstrous horrors. The other, Lokhir Fellheart, delivers golden idols and spectacular artefacts to the city’s vaults. But Karond Kar’s truest currency is neither beasts nor priceless trinkets, but slaves.\n\nWere either of these two fearsome Druchii able to fill the city’s slave markets to the brim they would be well placed to make a play for the city itself and declare themselves its Drachau...

localised_description: In an effort to garner the favour of the Dark Prince, the Druchii Hag Sorceress Morathi has put into motion a most heinous plan. A tribute of Elven souls, both Asur and Asrai, is to be offered up by the Cult of Excess as tribute to Slaanesh. With artful manipulation she fabricated a diplomatic gathering between her hated cousins as a means to facilitate the sacrifice. Trapping them and summoning a rift at their meeting place, she successfully transported them to Slaanesh's realm, where they remain trapped, helpless to the whims of whatever finds them. Yet sending them there was only half the plan; one will be needed to strike the killing blow to complete the sacrifice – one who can travel to the Realm of Slaanesh with His blessing…

It is not without reason that they say Doctor Festus’ curative powers are greater than any other who walks the world. Not that he has any interest in healing others – since being gifted intimate knowledge of disease by Father Nurgle he has been consumed by an insatiable and ruthless desire to experiment, a sliver of the Plaguelord’s boundless delight in perpetuating the cycle of life and death. Thus Festus forever seeks exotic ingredients to brew his noxious potions, frequently foraying into the Realm of Nurgle via fluctuating portals known only to him, in the hopes of harvesting something delectably vomit-inducing. He is due such an expedition, though this time he might be pleasantly surprised at what awaits him beyond the veil…
The weak and helpless hordes that plague these lands hide behind walls they hope will save them. Destroy this fickle illusion, and raze their cities to the ground!

Every battle is a chance for glory, and every victory a sign of the Blood God's inescapable dominance. Sweep down upon the battlefield with blazing rage in your heart, to vanquish the enemies of Khorne and anoint yourself with their blood!

Far from the cold ravages of the northern steppes, an insignificant Orc Warboss named Muga had taken his crew into the Underway to “find sum stunties ta bash”, but instead stumbled straight into a Skaven hideout. In a self-preserving panic, the ratman mystic leading the nest tore open the fabric between worlds in a haphazard attempt to summon a Bloodthirster into his ranks. Perhaps Khorne had momentarily turned his gaze and seen an opportunity? It is more likely, however, that the Seer had simply lost control of his rift, for in an instant the Orc Warboss, his crew, and the entire Skaven host were sucked into the Realm of Khorne where they now await their fate. Once again, the Blood God shall lavish his consort with the greatest gift of all – war!

Most remain blind to the conniving machinations of Tzeentch until their tragic fate is already sealed. Thus, as the unsuspecting nations of the Empire and Cathay seek to manifest a portal between their lands, avoiding the dangers of the Ivory Road, they remain oblivious to the true architect of their plans—the Great Schemer himself. As construction on the portal was completed, the forces of each nation were drawn through the gateway, and pulled into a twisted and unfamiliar Daemonic landscape. Yet there are many powerful pawns in the God of Magic's schemes, for an urgent summons demands Vilitch's presence in the Realm of Tzeentch. Though the twisted plots of his God remain a mystery, the part Vilitch is to play will no doubt soon become startlingly clear.

At last, the blasted plateau of K’datha reveals its ancient secret. A hidden corner where sits the twisted ruins of Zanbaijin, a place older than the race of men, obscured from the mortal plane by the veil between worlds. With the sigils learnt and invoked, a passage to the city’s cursed arena has opened. Where over the centuries, numberless would-be champions have come with their followers to go to battle with their rivals and prove themselves to their patrons. Yet here, not even the laughing Gods could claim the souls of the fallen, for the ancient Altar of Battle has always taken them as its own prize. Until now.\n\nThe Altar’s bounty lays bare. The next champion of the Fallen City shall be its last, the claimant to tribute that will change the course of history. A Chaos God is about to rise – make the journey to Zanbaijin and ensure that it is yours!

These Greenskins block your advance, acting as a filthy, green barrier between you and your kin. Show no mercy and push on through!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Under the disgusted gaze of the Ancestor Gods, the armies of Undeath spread their wicked curse. Long have their transgressions been recorded in the Dammaz Kron, since the days of Neferata and her reign of evil. Now three throngs of our brave warriors have fallen to the blood-drinkers. Make an offering to Grimnir, and even the score against these vile creatures!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Ancient tales recited around Asrai campfires speak of the mysterious Tree Spirits of the Far East, powerful beings thought to be associated with Adanhu, eldest of Elders, but far removed from the Old World’s forests. For reasons forgotten in time, some of Athel Loren’s most ancient denizens left the great forest long ago to journey to the previously unexplored extremes of the life-giving Worldroots. Beyond the distant mountains to the east, in the lush jungles of southern Cathay, these spirits made their unlikely home. Yet today they are reduced to a small enclave beset on all sides by mischievous locals – the local Monkey people loyal to the Dragon Emperor. A show of force against the Cathayans will make it much easier to facilitate a reunion with these venerable beings, whose knowledge and power over the local fauna could make them very useful allies.

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: The Empire’s enemies, both mortal and otherwise, have long sought to topple what Sigmar built. Foes who step foot upon Imperial soil find themselves vanquished by the fury of their steel and gunpowder soon enough. Nonetheless, the safety of the populace can never be ignored.\n\nThere have been reports of mutilated bodies appearing across the Sylvanian countryside; a grave threat that serves as a timely reminder that we must secure our homeland.

The reports were not exaggerated – bodies abound were discovered clawed, savaged and feasted upon by some unholy creature. A peasant comes forth speaking of a near-deadly encounter with a seemingly feral Vampire, before the intervention of an aristocrat known as Countess Gabriella prevented him from becoming the creature’s victim. Curiously, the Countess addressed the Vampire as “Ulrika”. If this is the same individual that Karl Franz once recalled saving his life from a would-be assassin, then further investigation is required.\n\nThe peasant believes the Countess and Ulrika have retreated to Nachthafen Castle. Entering the citadel will require you to masquerade as nobility, best achieved with the help of a gold-laden treasure vault.

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: The Motherland’s enemies, both mortal and otherwise, have long sought to claim her. Foes who step foot upon the frozen tundra find themselves entombed in her icy grasp soon enough. Nonetheless, the safety of the populace can never be ignored.\n\nThere have been reports of mutilated bodies appearing across the Sylvanian countryside; a grave threat that serves as a timely reminder for us to secure our homeland.

The reports were not exaggerated – bodies abound were discovered clawed, savaged and feasted upon by some unholy creature. A peasant is encountered who speaks of a near-deadly encounter with a naked, feral Vampire, before the intervention of an aristocrat known as Countess Gabriella prevented him from becoming the creature’s victim. Curiously, the Countess addressed the naked Vampire as “Ulrika”. If this is Ulrika Straghov, missing daughter of the deceased Ivan Straghov, who had warned Tzarina Katarin of the impending Chaos invasion, then further investigation is required. \n\nThe peasant believes the Countess and Ulrika have retreated to Nachthafen Castle. Entering the citadel will require you to masquerade as nobility, best achieved with the help of a gold-laden treasure vault.
We need to build a strong structure to support the Great Drill as it breaches Hashuts Realm. When we have enough resources we can send them to the drill and build it bit by bit.

At a secret launch site somewhere nearby, construction of the Great Drill nears its completion. Those to be offered to Hashut are soon to be chosen. In the meantime, recent advancements in your capital require your attention, for we are at the cusp of engineering feats crucial to the Drill’s success.\n\nLearn more about the Great Drill of Hashut [[url:script_link_campaign_drill_of_hashut]]here[[/url]].

At a secret launch site somewhere nearby, construction of the Great Drill nears its completion. Those to be offered to Hashut are soon to be chosen. In the meantime, recent advancements in your capital require your attention, for we are at the cusp of engineering feats crucial to the Drill’s success.\n\nLearn more about the Great Drill of Hashut [[url:script_link_campaign_drill_of_hashut]]here[[/url]].

At a secret launch site somewhere nearby, construction of the Great Drill nears its completion. Those to be offered to Hashut are soon to be chosen. In the meantime, recent advancements in your capital require your attention, for we are at the cusp of engineering feats crucial to the Drill’s success.\n\nLearn more about the Great Drill of Hashut [[url:script_link_campaign_drill_of_hashut]]here[[/url]].

The Ancestor God Gazul wielded the power of the elementals; his relics hold the key to the devastating forces of the Underearth. Desirous Undead covens pilfer far and wide to gain even an iota of that power – within their boundaries is where Gazul's relics might be found.

The Ancestor God Grimnir long ago ventured north into the Chaos Wastes. That fool was lost, alone and out of his depth, dropping trinkets as he passed through the Cliffs of Death. We must search for them amongst the foetid crags and mountain passes!

The Ancestor God Grimnir long ago ventured north into the Chaos Wastes. That fool was lost, alone and out of his depth, dropping trinkets as he passed through the Cliffs of Death. We must search for them amongst the foetid crags and mountain passes!

The Ancestor God Grungni cravenly led the Dwarfs into the earth, only to be forced to return and fight without knowing the true worth of his gift for mining. The throngs of the weakling western Dwarfs carry a relic attributed to him, passing it from army to army within their mountainous borders.

The Ancestor God Grungni cravenly led the Dwarfs into the earth, only to be forced to return and fight without knowing the true worth of his gift for mining. The throngs of the weakling western Dwarfs carry a relic attributed to him, passing it from army to army within their mountainous borders.

The Ancestor God Morgrim was the first Dwarf Engineer, whose tool relics have been held in stewardship by paragons of his cult throughout the ages. This is a chance to steal one such relic and use it to show them first hand that Dhrath-Zharr engineering is far superior to their sorcery-less tinkering.

There are few more far-fetched tales of the Dawi weaklings than that of the exiled Ancestor Skavor, son of Gazul, who it is told moulded his flesh and became an enemy of his own people. One artefact associated with him, said to contain as much potential as the other Ancestor God relics, is being used as a ceremonial trinket by a wayward horde of Lustria.

The Ancestor God Smednir, patron of metalworking and ore refinement, is perhaps the least worthless of the weak western deities. Yet just as with the others, the fate of his relic is yours to decide. One of his creations sits as an heirloom in the treasure hall of the Dwarfs’ northernmost Hold.

The Ancestor God Thungni left the secret of Rune Magic to the Dwarf race. Only he and a few of his undeserving descendants could wield the great power he discovered, which can be tapped into using the Runic Tablet stored in Karak Azorn’s treasure hall.

The Ancestor God Valaya’s powers may have prevented Dwarfkind’s annihilation at the hands of Chaos, but it cannot prevent her secrets from being exploited for our ends! A long-lost vial of potent salve said to be brewed by Valaya’s own hand sits unassumingly in the loot pile of a nearby Ogre troop.

The Ancestor God Valaya’s powers may have prevented Dwarfkind’s annihilation at the hands of Chaos, but it cannot prevent her secrets from being exploited for our ends! A long-lost vial of potent salve said to be brewed by Valaya’s own hand sits unassumingly in the loot pile of a nearby Ogre troop.

The Great Drill of Hashut needs to be primed before operation can commence. Gathering and desecrating the Artefacts of the traitorous Ancestor Gods will grant the Great Drill enough power to descend into the depths and bore through the mantles of rock into Hashut's domain.\n\nOnce the relics are found, however, temptation and hubris must first be overcome. Personal fame, reverence and sorcerous might are things not so easily passed up by the Dhrath-Zharr.

Your fusion of Dwarfen engineering and Daemonic sorcery as an abomination of the worst kind has led the Dwarfs of the west to send a throng against you. How fitting that the Dwari-Thagi march themselves to their own sacrifice to the Father, in turn bringing you one step closer to the revelation and desecration of the relics they hold so dear!

Your fusion of Dwarfen engineering and Daemonic sorcery as an abomination of the worst kind has led the Dwarfs of the west to send a throng against you. How fitting that the Dwari-Thagi march themselves to their own sacrifice to the Father, in turn bringing you one step closer to the revelation and desecration of the relics they hold so dear!

Your fusion of Dwarfen engineering and Daemonic sorcery as an abomination of the worst kind has led the Dwarfs of the west to send a throng against you. How fitting that the Dwari-Thagi march themselves to their own sacrifice to the Father, in turn bringing you one step closer to the revelation and desecration of the relics they hold so dear!

The will of Hashut is at times clear, other times inscrutable. He sees into the souls of mortals and can distinguish the malign from the innocent, though in his eyes all are destined for hell-bound torment. And now the Daemonspite Crucible, Drazhoath’s favoured talisman, must be reforged and quenched with more innocent souls to renew its power. Yet Hashut does not reveal his judgement of those he cuts down – enemies must be killed in scores to eventually satisfy the Father of Darkness.

The Uzkular – the Undead – roam the deltas of the River Ruin. No doubt due to the magical effluent being carried downstream and mixing with the countless bodies that litter the muddy and caustic river mouth where it meets the Sea of Storms. The Ashen usually pays no heed to such meagre inconveniences, but recent attacks on his labourers are now posing a real threat to the supply lines. A direct military response is now imperative!
Ancient runes inscribed upon Graven Sceptre’s iron shaft glow red with the rage of Hashut – a sign that the Great Bull yearns for the Ashen One to spread the torment of war throughout the land!

The Great Drill of Hashut is primed for operation. Powered by the desecrated artefacts of the traitorous Ancestor Gods, it will descend into the depths and bore through the mantles of rock into Hashut's domain. The lakes of the Bull-God's blood will be yours!\n\nHowever, the bitter kin of the west have followed your glorious trail of destruction and now come to upend your grand plan. The grudge-keeper and his weakling subjects must not only be kept away from the Drill, but slaughtered for their audacity!

Powered by the desecrated artefacts of the traitorous Ancestor Gods, it will descend into the depths and bore through the mantles of rock into Hashut's domain. The lakes of the Bull-God's blood will be yours!\n\nHowever, the bitter kin of the west have followed your glorious trail of destruction and now come to upend your grand plan. The grudge-keeper and his weakling subjects must not only be kept away from the Drill, but slaughtered for their audacity!

The lakes of the Bull-God's blood will be yours!\n\nHowever, the bitter kin of the west have followed your glorious trail of destruction and now come to upend your grand plan. The grudge-keeper and his weakling subjects must not only be kept away from the Drill, but slaughtered for their audacity!

The Stone Mantle, one of Astragoth’s most powerful talismans, has become weakened and damaged with age. Few know how truly old the artefact is, however, but it has the appearance of a hardy cloak. No mere tailor can ever hope to repair it – only the arcane techniques of the Dark Lands’ Daemonsmithies can restore its ancient power.

The will of Hashut is at times clear, other times inscrutable. He sees into the souls of mortals and can distinguish the malign from the innocent, though in his eyes all are destined for hell-bound torment. And now the Daemonspite Crucible, Drazhoath’s favoured talisman, must be reforged and quenched with more innocent souls to renew its power. Yet Hashut does not reveal his judgement of those you cut down – enemies must be killed in scores to eventually satisfy the Father of Darkness.

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: The Empire’s enemies, both mortal and otherwise, have long sought to topple what Sigmar built. Foes who step foot upon Imperial soil find themselves vanquished by the fury of their steel and gunpowder soon enough. Nonetheless, the safety of the populace can never be ignored.\n\nThere have been reports of mutilated bodies appearing across the Sylvanian countryside; a grave threat that serves as a timely reminder that we must secure our homeland.

The reports were not exaggerated – bodies abound were discovered clawed, savaged and feasted upon by some unholy creature. A peasant comes forth speaking of a near-deadly encounter with a seemingly feral Vampire, before the intervention of an aristocrat known as Countess Gabriella prevented him from becoming the creature’s victim. Curiously, the Countess addressed the Vampire as “Ulrika”. If this is the same individual that Karl Franz once recalled saving his life from a would-be assassin, then further investigation is required.\n\nThe peasant believes the Countess and Ulrika have retreated to Nachthafen Castle. Entering the citadel will require you to masquerade as nobility, best achieved with the help of a gold-laden treasure vault.

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: The Motherland’s enemies, both mortal and otherwise, have long sought to claim her. Foes who step foot upon the frozen tundra find themselves entombed in her icy grasp soon enough. Nonetheless, the safety of the populace can never be ignored.\n\nThere have been reports of mutilated bodies appearing across the Sylvanian countryside; a grave threat that serves as a timely reminder for us to secure our homeland.

The reports were not exaggerated – bodies abound were discovered clawed, savaged and feasted upon by some unholy creature. A peasant is encountered who speaks of a near-deadly encounter with a naked, feral Vampire, before the intervention of an aristocrat known as Countess Gabriella prevented him from becoming the creature’s victim. Curiously, the Countess addressed the naked Vampire as “Ulrika”. If this is Ulrika Straghov, missing daughter of the deceased Ivan Straghov, who had warned Tzarina Katarin of the impending Chaos invasion, then further investigation is required. \n\nThe peasant believes the Countess and Ulrika have retreated to Nachthafen Castle. Entering the citadel will require you to masquerade as nobility, best achieved with the help of a gold-laden treasure vault.

While Astragoth remains the most powerful of the Conclave of Sorcerers – who rule Zharr-Naggrund in Hashut’s name – he is not immune to its machinations. Thus, it is Astragoth’s legion that has been charged with guarding and ensuring the safety of a precious Convoy train. Should the convoy be lost then the ageing Astragoth could suffer an irreversible loss in status amongst his peers. Protecting it shall be no small feat – the Convoy must travel on one of the most perilous routes through the Dark Lands.

Zhatan’s master, Ghorth the Cruel, keeps his brutal commander busy by having him satisfy Zharr-Naggrund’s insatiable demand for fresh Labourers. To help wield his military power effectively, Ghorth regularly arms Zhatan with equipment from his own arcane armoury. Such murderous toys do not always come without strings, however, and Ghorth does not hesitate to continually challenge Zhatan to prove himself. Thus his latest order is for Zhatan to spread the Warhost of Zharr’s authority by annexing more lands, in turn further feeding Zharr-Naggrund’s ruthless industrial machine. In return, Zhatan will receive a piece of armour that belonged to one of the greatest Chaos Dwarf warriors to have ever led the hosts of the Dawi-Zharr.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Workers at a vital refinery have rebelled against their overseers – spilling a lake’s worth of valuable tar. That such an incident should happen in the shadow of Zharr-Naggrund is an outrage. The Conclave of Sorcerers has called upon Zhatan the Black to restore order, make an example of the rebels, and deal with the incompetents that were meant to be supervising the site. Mercy is for the weak.

Ghorth the Cruel has decided to bestow upon his commander Zhatan another piece of powerful weaponry: the shield-splitting Obsidian Axe. As is often the case, the weapon’s assignment does not come without conditions and Ghorth has kept the axe’s power dampened, for now. In issuing an impotent weapon of such great potential, the eminent Sorcerer Lord is not merely living up to his epithet – this is another challenge unto his loyal servant. Until Ghorth bears witness to enough of the Chaos Dwarfs’ enemies falling before the Commander of Zharr, the axe’s strength will stay dormant.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The energies of Shyish wax and wane amid tides of blood and carnage. On corpse-ridden battlefields, where death lingers like a fog, the Purple Winds of Magic blow a gale, offering untold power to all who dabble in its mysteries. Cut a violent path through the enemies of the Empire and embrace the arcane strands of magic it unleashes; one day soon they may be forged into deadly focus, and wielded like a weapon towards your foes.
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}

{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}

A recent uprising of Orc and Goblin Labourers almost spilled over into full-blown rebellion, if not for the conniving actions of one of your Hobgoblin middle-managers. Your informants tell you that the Hobgoblin had initially joined the rebellion, before working his way into the inner circle of the rabble-rousers and promptly plunging his knife into every one of their backs.\n\nOf two things there is little doubt: first, that the Hobgoblin's actions were not made as an act of loyalty to you, and secondly that potential catastrophe to the supply lines had been averted by his backstabbing nature. Yet some damage had still been done, with the leaderless droves of escaped Orcs and Goblin Labourers now scattered to join nearby Warbosses. March out to claim back the losses from your workforce and perhaps find this Hobgoblin to put him in a more useful post.
{{tr:wh3_dlc23_mis_gen_assassinate_character_agent_chd_description}}
