Kislev once kept constant vigilant surveillance over the Road of Skulls, but now Khorne’s beasts overrun the old outpost settlements. The spirits of home beseech you to purge the Daemons and restore Kislev’s eyes in the north!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Since the outposts were lost centuries ago, the Road of Skulls has been an area shunned by the Tzars, allowing the creatures of Chaos its use for passage to Kislev. But no longer! The Daughters of the Forest listen to the spirits of home, who demand this Daemonic thoroughfare be stemmed.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Khornate-Daemons’ lust for murder will drive them towards you eventually, but the sooner the Daemons are felled, the sooner you can potentially exploit the magic that permeates their very flesh and bone.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

The mindless Savage Orcs continue to encroach upon Cathayan lands, spreading their filth and terrorising the people under your protection. The Kingdom of the Dragon must be cleansed of this violent scourge, once and for all!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

The vile Greenskin threat grows ever more menacing, as the so-called Skull-takerz rampage across the land. These creatures are a disease upon all they encounter, an infection that must be rooted out and eliminated without mercy!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

The forests of Naggaroth are rife with ambient magics, calling out to those who would harness their dark power. Controlled by the enemies of Kislev, such arcane might remains a monumental threat to the children of Ursun. Conquest is the only answer; claim this land and utilise its magic in the name of the Motherland.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

The reach of the Motherland is ever expanding, proving the enemies of the Ice Queen have nowhere to hide. The Dark Elves may fortify their lands and pray to their dark gods – it does nothing to stop whole swathes of their land being swallowed by Kislev's might.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The cruelty of the Dark Elves continues to threaten the people of Kislev, with their forays from the Land of Chill growing in both frequency and savagery. It is time to give them something to fear on home soil. Make their armies bleed, until tales of your sorcery take root in their nightmares.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

By blood, blade and magic, a foothold must be established in the land of Lustria. Gaining a solid base of control will lay the foundations for expansion – in such a dangerous land, it is the only way for the expedition to succeed.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

The expedition has ground to a halt in the wake of the Savage Orcs' meddling. Such base creatures cannot be allowed to impede the business of the Dragons. Rid the land of this menace; only then may the expedition into Lustria progress.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

The proud fools of the Empire constantly insert themselves into the Great Conspirator's schemes, seeking to restore order where there should be Chaos. Eliminate this imperial annoyance; they will interfere in Tzeentch's schemes no longer!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

It is not enough to simply occupy small pockets of land, surrounded by foreign powers. Dragons are no meek creatures, after all; they strive only towards total dominance.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

A certain magic lies beneath the dull protocols of bureaucracy, entwining itself with the daily ongoings of administration. Only when every decision is in perfect synchronicity with the Winds of Magic, can the Celestial Empire truly thrive.\n\nLearn more about Matters of State [[url:script_link_campaign_matters_of_state]]here[[/url]].

The final ritual is at hand! Flexing the bounds of the Great Compass, its power shall soon be extended, growing more attuned to the Elemental Winds than ever before. The benefits to Cathay shall be endless! However, as expected, the Lizardmen protest in outrage, declaring that such rites fly in the face of the Old Ones and their Great Plan. Their meddling is assured, but a Dragon does not bow before mere reptiles. As the Cold Ones rally to arms, the Celestial Empire shall stand defiant. Put an end to their foolish intrusion – nothing must interfere with the rituals completion!
HIDDEN Cuexotl
HIDDEN Ziggurat of Dawn
HIDDEN The Southern Sentinels
HIDDEN The star tower

The final ritual is at hand! Flexing the bounds of the Great Compass, its power shall soon be extended, growing more attuned to the Elemental Winds than ever before. The benefits to Cathay shall be endless! However, as expected, the Lizardmen protest in outrage, declaring that such rites fly in the face of the Old Ones and their Great Plan. Their meddling is assured, but a Dragon does not bow before mere reptiles. As the Cold Ones rally to arms, the Celestial Empire shall stand defiant. Put an end to their foolish intrusion – nothing must interfere with the rituals completion!

Fyodora Ungol and her sisters have reached out with a twisted tale, sharing stories of a dangerously powerful witch and a Hex capable of bewitching weak mortal minds. They are willing to share the location of this mysterious Hex-wielder, yet their feigned fear and enthusiastic help is undoubtedly suspicious. It would seem an ambush may lie in wait, yet this may be one trap worth walking into willingly. If these sisters possess the Hex they described, then its knowledge must be snatched from their skulls, through a gaping head wound if necessary!

Something burrows deep beneath the earth, reeking of sinister corruption – an Underway perhaps, infested with filthy vermin. Whatever the cause, its rot has withered the land, with every ounce of its power emanating from a single point of infection. Such power could be used in the creation of a new Hex – one that could entrap such vile trespassers before they ever have chance to plant their virulent seeds of corruption. Seek out the source of this cancerous blight – the essence of whatever lies at the heart of this scourge must be harvested!

Teeming with mystical energy, the Magical Forests scattered across the land are a ripe source of Spirit Essence, promising untold power to any who might channel it. With Dark Magic, gateways may be opened to each forest, providing an endless fount of spiritual energy.\n\nThe Wood Elves however, prove a constant thorn in the side. Seeing such things as a threat to the sanctity of their land, they defend the Magical Forests against all intruders, barring entry to any who would seek to channel their essence. Dealing with these misguided miscreants will prove a challenge, yet with the aid of the malevolent spirits of the forest, the ancient power of these woodlands may yet be within reach.

Never before has the world seen such a collection of Forbidden Hexes, each a powerful maelstrom of Dark Magic in their own right. Combined into the Malediction of Ruin, they have the power to potentially erase all wickedness befouling the land, bringing the forces of corruption to calamity. With a target chosen and the ritual set in motion, all manner of dark forces descend, seeking to interfere out of desperation to avoid their inevitable doom. Hold the forces of evil back; once the ritual is complete, the land shall be cleansed of their filth forevermore.

Where the dead roam, their spirits also wander, practically begging for someone to make use of their wretched souls. Enthralled by Dark Magic, a broken spirit may be called forth as but one part of a deathly army of spectres, intent on haunting their summoner's foes. Yet first, their mouldering corpses must be dealt with. The rotten Undead still walk the earth, guarding the spirits yet to be set free. Send them to their second deaths, for only then can their spirits be bound to an afterlife of endless service.

Once a gift from the Dragon Emperor, the Storm Wind Coronal has since been lost with the fall of the Snake Gate, lying cruelly just out of reach. With the Great Bastion compromised, all of Grand Cathay stands vulnerable; only once the Snake Gate has been reclaimed can the strength of the Celestial Empire be restored. Through conquest and occupation, the enchanted Coronal may finally be returned to its rightful owner, ready to take its place upon the Storm Dragon's brow once more.

In recent months, crop failures, illnesses and pestilential plagues have befallen the farmlands of Grand Cathay. Whilst seemingly isolated instances to the casual observer, Yuan Bo discerns deeper than most. The machinations of the Ruinous Powers are at play within the realm, seeking to undermine and destabilise the smooth running of the provinces. At the Jade Dragon’s word, his agents have closely investigated each suspect instance, and after a time, found profane markings, runes and glyphs at the sites of all of these disasters. If left unchecked, these will merely be the start of an epidemic that ravages the rural heart of Grand Cathay.

Bearing magic attuned to the Iron Winds, the Horns of Shang-Yang are as powerful as they are rare. When the city of their namesake was wrested from its rightful ruler, the Horns too were lost. Such power cannot be allowed to reside in the wrong hands and nor can the proud city of Shang Yang be allowed to crumble under the mismanagement of unworthy occupiers. It is time to retake the city; those sitting within its walls will soon learn that the Iron Dragon's vengeance is a force to be truly feared.

Mother Ostankya’s eyes glaze over as she is suddenly overcome by a torrent of whispers from the spirits of the land. In hallucination, she scries a cave somewhere in the distant mountains where deep within sits a cavern of rare ice crystals, a place thrumming with the ancient magic of the land concentrated in dozens of glimmering stalagmites and stalactites. A single shard of one of these formations could be a powerful centrepiece for Ostankya’s crown, augmenting her influence over the spirits who facilitate her frightening spells. Yet as she drifts out of her vision, she also makes out a cacophony of monstrous roars, shrieks and howls... Something feral awaits!

The Changeling always has his multitudinous fingers in many pies, and one scheme put into motion many days prior is now coming to delightful fruition. The Trickster’s Staff, an ancient Tzeentchian artefact of little importance to the Old Worlders other than being worth a great deal of gold, sits securely in the vault of Dwarf merchants at Karak Azgaraz. By the Changeling’s machinations it had previously been in the possession of Empire merchants, only for him to promptly steal it back from them and plant it into the Dwarfs’ possession. With his deceitful whispers, the Empire merchants have been led to believe that the Dwarfs stole ‘their’ priceless artefact, and they now prepare to march on Azgaraz where bloodshed will surely ensue. The Changeling, of course, will take his customary front-row seat…

Fyodora Ungol and her sisters have reached out with a twisted tale, sharing stories of a dangerously powerful witch and a Hex capable of bewitching weak mortal minds. They are willing to share the location of this mysterious Hex-wielder, yet their feigned fear and enthusiastic help is undoubtedly suspicious. It would seem an ambush may lie in wait, yet this may be one trap worth walking into willingly. If these sisters possess the Hex they described, then its knowledge must be snatched from their skulls, through a gaping head wound if necessary!

Something burrows deep beneath the earth, reeking of sinister corruption – an Underway perhaps, infested with filthy vermin. Whatever the cause, its rot has withered the land, with every ounce of its power emanating from a single point of infection. Such power could be used in the creation of a new Hex – one that could entrap such vile trespassers before they ever have chance to plant their virulent seeds of corruption. Seek out the source of this cancerous blight – the essence of whatever lies at the heart of this scourge must be harvested!

Teeming with mystical energy, the Magical Forests scattered across the land are a ripe source of Spirit Essence, promising untold power to any who might channel it. With Dark Magic, gateways may be opened to each forest, providing an endless fount of spiritual energy.\n\nThe Wood Elves however, prove a constant thorn in the side. Seeing such things as a threat to the sanctity of their land, they defend the Magical Forests against all intruders, barring entry to any who would seek to channel their essence. Dealing with these misguided miscreants will prove a challenge, yet with the aid of the malevolent spirits of the forest, the ancient power of these woodlands may yet be within reach.

Never before has the world seen such a collection of Forbidden Hexes, each a powerful maelstrom of Dark Magic in their own right. Combined into the Malediction of Ruin, they have the power to potentially erase all wickedness befouling the land, bringing the forces of corruption to calamity. With a target chosen and the ritual set in motion, all manner of dark forces descend, seeking to interfere out of desperation to avoid their inevitable doom. Hold the forces of evil back; once the ritual is complete, the land shall be cleansed of their filth forevermore.

Where the dead roam, their spirits also wander, practically begging for someone to make use of their wretched souls. Enthralled by Dark Magic, a broken spirit may be called forth as but one part of a deathly army of spectres, intent on haunting their summoner's foes. Yet first, their mouldering corpses must be dealt with. The rotten Undead still walk the earth, guarding the spirits yet to be set free. Send them to their second deaths, for only then can their spirits be bound to an afterlife of endless service.

localised_title: Saytang the Watcher: Who Watches the Watcher?
localised_description: From an unknown vantage point, a legendary colossus gazes over the eastern empire, paying close attention to the Dragons’ trials and tribulations. It is said that whenever war is waged righteously in the Celestial's eyes, the one known as the Heavenly Bowman leaps across the very mountains to aid those who display adeptness in marksmanship on the field of battle. Thus, those who fight skilfully for the greater good of Grand Cathay need not wait long to meet the greatest of her towering sentinels…

Grand Cathay’s ancient Constructs are a source of its great strength. The lifeforces imbued within previously-inanimate sculptures, now brought to life, play a crucial role in the Dragon armies’ martial prowess. Every last molecule in such entities is magically connected, both inside and out – the bond between all Lions and Sentinels of stone, jade and jet inexorable and far-reaching. With more of such combatants in your forces, the most powerful of their kin shall also be roused.

localised_title: A Tale of the True Path
localised_description: Word has spread of a noble’s son, a once-great Knight of the Empire, who roams the Chaos Wastes in search of a greater purpose. Most remarkably he bears the insignia of a Tzeentchian cult, the Brethren of the Golden Eagle. His loyalties had him pursued doggedly for a time by the Templars of Sigmar, the Empire’s Witch Hunters, but once they caught up he proved his status as the greatest swordsman in his Knightly Order. Perhaps in time this Champion-in-the-making will make his way to us, but in the meantime we must ensure there are more like-minded warriors to help him embrace Chaos.

localised_title: A Tale of the True Path
localised_description: The noble breath of the wandering Knight is carried as a whisper upon the Winds, speaking of a tall monolith he has encountered deep in the Chaos Wastes that holds history, magic and prophecy. Yet standing between the Knight and the answers leading him to Chaos’ embrace is a bloodthirsty Doombull and his warherd! If this warrior is ever to reach his full potential in Tzeentch’s estimations we must provide him with the assistance he might require to reach the revelations he seeks.

localised_title: A Tale of the True Path
localised_description: Having reached the ancient monolith deep in the Wastes, the great Knight stands on the cusp of learning the truth and completing the path seemingly laid before him – but for one final insurmountable trial. In one-to-one combat the warrior is more than a match for the monolith’s Doombull guardian, but the sheer numbers in the beast’s warherd makes the Knight's survival nigh on impossible. Tzeentch’s plans may be unknowable, yet your gaze has been drawn to this Champion deliberately. It is time to play your part.

localised_title: The Golden Knight: Descendant of Leysa
localised_description: The Golden Knight is Kislev’s living symbol of unification between church and state: the greatest living warrior in Kislevite soldiery, whose sacred duty is to ensure the peace and sanctity of Kislev’s lands, regardless of politics or bureaucracy. The current incumbent would be a powerful ally indeed, the daughter of a notable fallen companion of Boris Ursus himself and a warrior of grim determination: Naryska Leysa, who takes notice of those who display martial supremacy in the Motherland’s eternal fight.

localised_title: The Golden Knight: A Golden Lineage
localised_description: Roused by your military successes, the Golden Knight rides forth to protect your realm! Before she can take to the field with you, it must be sanctioned by official decree. To establish the Ice Court's jurisdiction, her service must be overseen by a Royal Barracks.

localised_title: The Golden Knight: Descendant of Leysa
localised_description: The Golden Knight is Kislev’s living symbol of unification between church and state: the greatest living warrior in Kislevite soldiery, whose sacred duty is to ensure the peace and sanctity of Kislev’s lands, regardless of politics or bureaucracy. The current incumbent would be a powerful ally indeed, the daughter of a notable fallen companion of Boris Ursus himself and a warrior of grim determination: Naryska Leysa, who is not above seeking out more sinister powers to the west to help purge all corruption that threatens the Motherland.

localised_title: The Golden Knight: A Golden Lineage
localised_description: Roused by your military successes, the Golden Knight comes to defend your realm! Before she can join battle, however, the esteemed warrior requires an Outpost to serve as rendezvous point and base of operations in your hex-touched lands.

Parchment has been seen falling from the skies over nearby battlefields. The scribblings upon them bind powerful magics into the pages, waiting to be unlocked by any who might claim them. Where they came from or why they litter the fields of war remains a mystery, yet one thing is for certain: every word brims with the Changer's arcane power. If the culprits behind this flurry of spells are ever to be located, questions must be asked. Perhaps those captured in battle may have tales to tell us?

Your investigation has proven fruitful, indeed. It seems the Blue Scribes of Tzeentch – P'tarix and Xirat'p – are the frenzied force behind the haphazard magics that have plagued so many battlefields across the land. Better yet, a clue to their current location has now reared its head, as Chaos surges within a nearby settlement. If you act quickly, you could capture the region before the Blue Scribes have chance to move on, spreading their twisted mischief further outside of your reach.

It seems the Blue Scribes of Tzeentch – P'tarix and Xirat'p – are the frenzied force behind the haphazard magics that have plagued so many battlefields across the land. Better yet, a clue to their current location has now reared its head, as Chaos surges in a nearby settlement. If you act quickly, you may be able to catch the Blue Scribes in action, while they torture and twist every being in the area.

The Blue Scribes may have just slipped your grasp, but a show of force is not the only way to entice them to your side. They have been given an impossible task  in recording every fragment of magic they can find, for the possibilities have multiplied in mortal hands. The Lost Athenaeum will provide a space in the mortal realm capable of housing their surplus spells – perhaps that would be enough to lure these Wandering Wizards from wherever they currently skulk?

The Black Pyramid is an iconic fixture within the theatre, but it has a few surprising tricks of its own. Your plan for this theatre requires a grand ritual to be cast at the site of this monument.
The Black Pyramid is an iconic fixture within the theatre, but it has a few surprising tricks of its own. Your plan for this theatre requires a grand ritual to be cast at the site of this monument.
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
The exiled Bloodthirster, blinded by rage, probably wouldn't notice a singular misplaced weapon. You could make better use of it than he.
Working with the Oracle can only lead to greater mischief within the mortal world.
Sometimes there's an elaborate prank behind your devious machinations, sometimes it's just about sending a message.

Those ancient Necrotect cities are monuments to extravagance and excess. You could probably find a better use for their trinkets, and your forces might even learn a thing or two about subsisting in these inhospitable lands.

The Red Duke is a constant thorn in the side of the otherwise virtuous Knights of Bretonnia. You've hatched a plan to bolster his forces, forcing the Bretonnians to commit their forces to combating the Undead scourge.

Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.

localised_title: You Made This? I Made This
localised_description: Provided you can cause a bit of a distraction, the insane engineer Ikit Claw probably wouldn't notice if a few of his weapons were missing...
You've heard rumour about some kind of magical material empowering the elven settlements. Sounds like a suitable tribute when you next go for a visit.
The pompous Knights of Bretonnia think their cavalry to be the finest in the land. They won't be boasting as much when they are dead.
The oak at the heart of Athel Loren has some sort of spiritual significance to the locals. It would be an awful shame if it was used as kindling for a campfire...

The only fitting scheme for the Chaos Wastes is an invasion of the realm of Nurgle itself. Everyone is invited, including Khorne, and Slaanesh. Once everyone has gathered, then the party really begins.

The only fitting scheme for the Chaos Wastes is an invasion of the realm of Nurgle itself. Everyone is invited, including Khorne, and Slaanesh. Once everyone has gathered, then the party really begins.
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
Working with the Oracle can only lead to greater mischief within the mortal world.
The other Ruinous Powers have their most exalted Daemons leading the charge in the great game. Kill them. Kill them all.

Various different Daemons, both lesser and greater, squabble and war within the Chaos Wastes. They think themselves the best, the most powerful, the one who will win their God's favour; they are all the same. You should give them one more thing in common: make them dance to your tune, piper.

The battlefields of the wastes serve both as the proving grounds for Daemonic forces, and the recruitment centres to train new ones. Prove your mettle by destroying your rivals, and many a Daemon will flock to your mischievous cause.

For too long have the oppressed Labourers of the Dark Lands been forced to work unpaid for their overseers. You, of course, are a big advocate for improving the plight of those in servitude. Naturally, you have some plans for the Greenskins after they are freed from their daily duties.

For too long have the oppressed Labourers of the Dark Lands been forced to work unpaid for their overseers. You, of course, are a big advocate for improving the plight of those in servitude. Naturally, you have some plans for the Greenskins after they are freed from their daily duties.

Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
Setting up a base of operations within the theatre's major trading hub would be a wise choice, especially if the market is run entirely by your own cultists.
Why attack the Tower of Hashut when you can just walk in unopposed?
The Dwarfs of the Dark Lands think Hashut is their true god. It is time to teach them who is the real master of Chaos.
Ogres know a thing or two about how to sack settlements effectively. They might be willing to help you out, especially after you beat them into submission.
One of those Greenskin Warlords thinks he's better than the rest, and that even the Everchosen would fall to his 'chopper'. Quite a storm would be whipped up if the so called "best" had a better…
A so called Lord of Dragons is marauding around the Dark Lands, apparently knows a thing or two about harnessing fire in battle. Sounds like a thing you should... 'borrow'.
You've managed to secure some Skaven Warlock Engineers to do your bidding within this theatre. The ploy is a simple one: blow up their fancy wall.
You've managed to secure some Skaven Warlock Engineers to do your bidding within this theatre. The ploy is a simple one: blow up their fancy wall.

Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
Trading caravans from Cathay are rumoured to find some of the finest relics during their expeditions to the west. It is very thoughtful of them to collect presents for your forces.
Regional alchemists have been devising new methods to improve barriers and wards. You know someone with whom they would gladly share those research notes...
The great northern Dragon stands as a bastion against the Daemonic forces of Chaos. You should teach them that nowhere is safe.
The great waterways in and around Cathay serve as important roads for trade and travel. Take control of them all, and use them to spread your influence across the land.
The blades of Clan Eshin's assassins are infamous within the realm of subterfuge. It would be awfully rude of them not to give you one for your own machinations.
The wandering reptile finds himself far, far away from his brethren. Is it time for his journey to end.
The elusive bureaucrat believes himself to have eyes and ears everywhere. Let them watch, let them listen. It will only make his demise sweeter if he sees it coming.

There is supposedly an ancient tablet here with some kind of important significance to the Lizardmen and their silly plan. You can think of a certain scurrying clan within Lustria who might have an exceptionally contagious idea for what to do with such a relic...

There is supposedly an ancient tablet here with some kind of important significance to the Lizardmen and their silly plan. You can think of a certain scurrying clan within Lustria who might have an exceptionally contagious idea for what to do with such a relic...
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
Whilst not directly useful to your current escapades, you cannot think of anything that will anger the Lizardmen more than a Daemon of Chaos masquerading as one of their leaders.
The Lizardmen believe Chaos doesn't exist in their so called "Great Plan". Let us see if getting slaughtered is also part of their plan...
The settlements of Lustria are supposedly fortresses against the enemies of the Slann. Whilst watching from enemies without, they will not be prepared for invasions from within...
The High Elves have done you a favour, and gathered a whole bunch of spoils within a few key locations. Might as well go pick them up whilst you are here.

There is a unique opportunity in this theatre to mess with the Dark Elves' slavers. You have enlisted the support of a few nautical Necromancers, who foresee a more bloated destiny for the slaves within the Black Arks.

There is a unique opportunity in this theatre to mess with the Dark Elves' slavers. You have enlisted the support of a few nautical Necromancers, who foresee a more bloated destiny for the slaves within the Black Arks.
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
You can probably get up to a lot of mischief if you took the form of one of the Dark Elf leaders. But why stop at just one?
There is something about sacking sacred forests that is deeply satisfying. Especially when you get a bunch of rowdy orcs to do it for you.
The White Dwarf has ventured to Naggaroth to settle one last grudge. You can think of an apt way to make sure he never has to worry about any more grudges...

Armies of Dark Elves get in the way of some of your more ambitious schemes within the theatre. No need for subtlety on this one; the Elves of this land only listen to those with murderous prowess. Knock them out of commission.

The rowdy Norscan warriors do not understand subterfuge – only battle. The plan here is simple: break the resolve of the mortal men until they have no choice but to be pawns in your dastardly schemes.

The rowdy Norscan warriors do not understand subterfuge – only battle. The plan here is simple: break the resolve of the mortal men until they have no choice but to be pawns in your dastardly schemes.

The rowdy Norscan warriors do not understand subterfuge – only battle. The plan here is simple: break the resolve of the mortal men until they have no choice but to be pawns in your dastardly schemes.
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
Deep within the region of Hell Pit lies one of Clan Moulder's twisted laboratories. Your forces could probably find something fun to play with if the pesky rats guarding the entrance were dealt with.
The three major cities stand as statements of Kislevite defiance against Chaos. Seems fitting to populate them with a few Daemons.
The Norscan warriors have a tradition of putting up monoliths to celebrate the petty accomplishments of their mortal warriors. They must be directed towards the proper God.
Norscan champions exert influence throughout the tribal lands via battle, with the defeated regularly swearing fealty to the victor. You could make use of a few more playthings.

The lords of the Empire are holding a diplomatic summit, but they seem to have forgotten your invitation. No matter, you will just have to invite yourself and turn these petty nobles against their obviously rotten Emperor!

The lords of the Empire are holding a diplomatic summit, but they seem to have forgotten your invitation. No matter, you will just have to invite yourself and turn these petty nobles against their obviously rotten Emperor!

The lords of the Empire are holding a diplomatic summit, but they seem to have forgotten your invitation. No matter, you will just have to invite yourself and turn these petty nobles against their obviously rotten Emperor!
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.

The County of Sylvania has always had strong magical energies, thanks to the influence of the resident Undead scourge. If you spread the reach of Tzeentch to this province, you could harness the Winds of Magic for your own schemes.
The so-called Emperor of man thinks a big castle and mechanical war machines can hold back the forces of Chaos. You should show him just how naive he really is!
Your Daemonic forces could use a little training. There should be some training dummies lying around to practice on.
Dwarfen runesmiths perceive their stunted warriors to be an invincible wall. Prove them wrong with a little field testing, and liberate the relics for your own forces' benefit.
The armies of the fallen doctor constantly plague your cults. Grab a scalpel and excise the tumour!

A great vortex of Chaotic energies sits within the heart of Ulthuan. With a little bit of meddling, it should be possible to let a slither of chaos escape its grasp. The High Elves will be utterly seduced by this scheme.

A great vortex of Chaotic energies sits within the heart of Ulthuan. With a little bit of meddling, it should be possible to let a slither of Chaos escape its grasp. The High Elves will be utterly seduced by this scheme.
Your first step in any theatre should be to sow the seeds of mayhem.
The Elves of Avelorn think themselves safe, with their 'radiant' leader protecting them. Lets see how secure they feel when their so-called Everqueen turns out to be a Daemon in disguise.

localised_title: Dedicate the Shrine of Khaine to Chaos
localised_description: The Blighted Isle is a revered location across all the Elven races, and yet all they use it for is a museum for a dusty old sword. You should install some new curators and take the blade for yourself, allegedly cursed history be damned. What's the worst that could happen?

The four gatehouses of Ulthuan are meant to protect the interior of Ulthuan from incursions. Is that really going to stop you though? It's time to open the gates, and the walls, and everything in-between.

Far too many relics are washing up on the shores of the undead pirate stronghold south of Ulthuan. You're basically doing them a favour by liberating one from their tired, overburdened, zombified arms.
There is only one being who could be the subject of the final, ultimate scheme. The greatest prank you've ever devised. This will be your magnum opus. You just need to assemble the correct pieces...
There is only one being who could be the subject of the final, ultimate scheme. The greatest prank you've ever devised. This will be your magnum opus. You just need to assemble the correct pieces...

Once a gift from the Dragon Emperor, the Storm Wind Coronal has since been lost with the fall of the Snake Gate, lying cruelly just out of reach. With the Great Bastion compromised, all of Grand Cathay stands vulnerable; only once the Snake Gate has been reclaimed can the strength of the Celestial Empire be restored. Through conquest and occupation, the enchanted Coronal may finally be returned to its rightful owner, ready to take its place upon the Storm Dragon's brow once more.

For too long have the enemies of Cathay wielded dark magics against the Dragon Emperor and his kin, hoping to bring the Celestial Empire to its knees. Arcane incursions begin to run rampant, as the kingdom's foes grow ever bolder.\n\nThough there are artefacts suited to stand against such a threat, imbued with the dark energies of Yin, one must first prove worthy of bearing such power. It seems the path to becoming a worthy defender of the people must first be carved out with countless victories.

Shining jewels of brilliant jade are said to lie hidden throughout this land, looted by enemy powers too foolish to know their worth. According to ancient rumour, such gems are teeming with mystic energy, granting boundless sight to any who should possess them. Armour adorned with such jewels would be a powerful boon indeed – one need only wrench the shining stones from the hands of the unworthy.

In recent months, crop failures, illnesses and pestilential plagues have befallen the farmlands of Grand Cathay. Whilst seemingly isolated instances to the casual observer, Yuan Bo discerns deeper than most. The machinations of the Ruinous Powers are at play within the realm, seeking to undermine and destabilise the smooth running of the provinces. At the Jade Dragon’s word, his agents have closely investigated each suspect instance, and after a time, found profane markings, runes and glyphs at the sites of all of these disasters. If left unchecked, these will merely be the start of an epidemic that ravages the rural heart of Grand Cathay.

Bearing magic attuned to the Iron Winds, the Horns of Shang-Yang are as powerful as they are rare. When the city of their namesake was wrested from its rightful ruler, the Horns too were lost. Such power cannot be allowed to reside in the wrong hands and nor can the proud city of Shang Yang be allowed to crumble under the mismanagement of unworthy occupiers. It is time to retake the city; those sitting within its walls will soon learn that the Iron Dragon's vengeance is a force to be truly feared.

The embers of inspiration burn fiercely, as the toil and smoke of the smithy beckons, urging the most talented of craftsmen to lend it the sweat of their brow. One day soon, an item of peerless quality will emerge, forged through flame and magic. Yet, such grand creations require refinement. Allow the Lore of Yang to ebb and flow amidst the clamour of battle, harnessing the spirit of every triumph. Only then will the furnace burn hot with arcane energy, imbuing the newly-crafted artefact with the essence of each and every victory.

The Cauldron of Power withers and wanes, its arcane energy almost drained from constant use in Kislev's defence. Many materials will be required to resurrect the Cauldron's magic. Fortunately, such materials can be found in abundance within the realms of the Motherland's enemies…

Mother Ostankya’s eyes glaze over as she is suddenly overcome by a torrent of whispers from the spirits of the land. In hallucination, she scries a cave somewhere in the distant mountains where deep within sits a cavern of rare ice crystals, a place thrumming with the ancient magic of the land concentrated in dozens of glimmering stalagmites and stalactites. A single shard of one of these formations could be a powerful centrepiece for Ostankya’s crown, augmenting her influence over the spirits who facilitate her frightening spells. Yet as she drifts out of her vision, she also makes out a cacophony of monstrous roars, shrieks and howls... Something feral awaits!

The Changeling always has his multitudinous fingers in many pies, and one scheme put into motion many days prior is now coming to delightful fruition. The Trickster’s Staff, an ancient Tzeentchian artefact of little importance to the Old Worlders other than being worth a great deal of gold, sits securely in the vault of Dwarf merchants at Karak Azgaraz. By the Changeling’s machinations it had previously been in the possession of Empire merchants, only for him to promptly steal it back from them and plant it into the Dwarfs’ possession. With his deceitful whispers, the Empire merchants have been led to believe that the Dwarfs stole ‘their’ priceless artefact, and they now prepare to march on Azgaraz where bloodshed will surely ensue. The Changeling, of course, will take his customary front-row seat…

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The vile brutes among the Ogre Kingdoms have wrought untold damage to imperial lands, slaughtering countless innocents to feed their endless gluttony. It is tie to cut their Feastmaster open, and put an end to their gory banquet of flesh!\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
