localised_description: Gaining a foothold in the lands dominated by Khorne's scourge will require a price paid in blood. Decimate the Cult of the Crimson Skull, and stake the Urfather's claim atop a pile of their decaying corpses.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Flaming Scribes enact their petty schemes, tainting the air with Tzeentch's foul magic. It is an insult to the Urfather! Wipe them from the face of the world, and put an end to their plots forevermore.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: To take the Slayer's Oath means to seek redemption for an act most shameful, for which the only recourse is to seek an honourable death in battle. Curiosity, however, is a foe that cannot be killed with mere weapons. And nothing draws on one's curiosity like the recent reports of mutilated bodies appearing across the Sylvanian countryside, testament to a new foe no doubt in need of slaying. \n\n The Spirit of Grungi's defences should be built up before venturing forth; this vessel cannot meet the same fate as the Undestructible Thunderbarge or the Unsinkable Ironclad. The former blew up and the latter sank... but this time things will be different!

The reports were not exaggerated – bodies were discovered clawed, savaged and feasted upon by some unholy creature. A peasant comes forth, telling of his near-deadly encounter with a seemingly feral Vampire, before the intervention of an aristocrat known as Countess Gabriella prevented him from becoming the creature’s next victim. Curiously, the Countess addressed the Vampire as “Ulrika”, a familiar name sparking a glimmer of recognition among your allies, Gotrek and Felix.\n\nGotrek tightens his grip around his axe, clearly intent on killing their former comrade, but as he and Felix quarrel the peasant explains to you that the Countess and Ulrika have already retreated to Nachthafen Castle. Entering the citadel will require you to masquerade as nobility, something best achieved with the help of a gold-laden treasure vault and a little flare for subterfuge...

{{tr:cdir_events_dilemma_choice_details_localised_choice_title_wh3_dlc25_dwf_book_of_grudges_dilemma_too_many_grudges_1FIRST}}\n\n{{tr:effects_description_wh3_dlc25_effect_dwf_book_of_grudges_grudge_mission_penalty_dummy}}

{{tr:cdir_events_dilemma_choice_details_localised_choice_title_wh3_dlc25_dwf_book_of_grudges_dilemma_too_many_grudges_1SECOND}}\n\n{{tr:effects_description_wh3_dlc25_effect_dwf_book_of_grudges_hard_grudge_mission_penaty_dummy}}

As good at fixing up machines as it is at bashing foes, the Persuader has proven to be a very useful tool indeed. Yet for too long this intricately-designed hammer has fallen into a state of disrepair. Document the successes of other Dawi engineering in battle – perhaps what is learned from this battlefield research might be used to restore the Persuader to its former glory!
In service to the Elector Countess of Wissenland, Elspeth von Draken must help strengthen the Empire’s borders as she waits for greater evils to show themselves.

Visions flood Elspeth von Draken’s mind… she sees a crown upon a pedestal, before her vision soars into the air to reveal [[i]]a keep, surrounded by mountains[[/i]]. The location of this powerful artefact? As she snaps back to reality, she feels compelled to seek it out – before others do.

[[col:yellow]]Elspeth’s visions have revealed a keep, surrounded by mountains.[[/col]]

[[col:yellow]]Use any army to search for this location by ending turn with them in the correct region.[[/col]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by the Longbeard elders, against the elgi of the Fey Forest. The War of Vengeance ended once the elgi Grudge was proclaimed settled by High King Gotrek Starbreaker, yet since that time, all Dawi who step foot in Athel Loren report nothing but hostility and death by elgi hands. Quelling the Longbeards’ anger at these transgressions will take more than just the conquest of the forest – the guilty must also be buried within them.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by all kings, written in their blood and passed down the bloodlines, against the intolerable existence of the Dawi-Zharr. Many deny the Dawi origins of the Dark Lands’ abominations, and our annals tell us very little about the fate of those lost in the Age of Migration. All must accede, the mere suspicion that there exists Dawi who willfully turned from the Ancestor Gods, our people, and our way of life, is a shameful stain upon us all that must be wiped away.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by Belegar Ironhammer of the Angrund Clan and true King of Karak Eight Peaks, against those responsible for the defilement and occupation of Vala-Azrilungol. Some time has passed since the last retreat from the citadel at Eight Peaks, and its loss still stands as the Ironhammer bloodline’s greatest shame. They urge all Dawi to spare no expense to help purge its current occupiers and reclaim the Great Hold, taking a heavy toll of grobi and thaggoraki blood![[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by the Longbeard elders, against the elgi of Ulthuan. The War of Vengeance may have long ended, but tales of the atrocities committed against us during the conflict still pass from generation to generation, festering as wounds that can never heal. For many Dawi, the Phoenix Crown that sits within Karaz-a-Karak’s vault was not recompense enough for elgi insolence and Dawi losses, and Ulthuan should have been taken with it. It is not too late for a final reckoning.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by Thorek Ironbrow, Master Runesmith and discoverer of Karak Zorn, against the uzkul and lizard-beasts responsible for the demise of our ancestral capital. Through Ironbrow’s resolve and perseverance, the fabled Hold of the Upland Plateau has been refounded. Inscribed runestones in the city hint at the cause of its downfall: repeated invasions from the most powerful ghoul-kings, lizard-fiends and Daemons that hold sway over those lands. So it shall be, vengeance must find them.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by Thorgrim Grudgebearer, successor to the throne at this time of begrudging, against those other races who dare occupy the fallen Holds of the Karaz Ankor. Centuries of Chaos invasions, war, disaster and calamity has seen Dawi hegemony over the World’s Edge Mountains dwindle. No longer shall our former bastions be isolated islands surrounded by a sea of foes. All must be reclaimed, Dawi supremacy restored, in mighty acts of war and vengeance![[/i]]
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: [[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared posthumously on behalf of the deceased Throndik Snorrisson, former High King and son of Snorri Whitebeard, against the great elgi betrayer Prince Malekith. Though oathbound to remain true to the ideals that he and Whitebeard had fought for together, the elgi wazzock Malekith has been overcome by corruption, becoming a scourge to the world along with his Naggarothi elgi. Let it be written here, as it was said by Whitebeard himself: There is nothing so foul as an oath-breaker.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by Thorgard Cromson, Great King of Kraka Drak, against all who threaten the Realms of the northern Dwarfs. The alliance between Thorgrim Grudgebearer and the northern clans is hereby invoked, beseeching all Dawi to march against the murderous warmongers of Norsca. We must recognise the northmen for what they are: ready supplicants to the Dark Gods who must be eradicated from those lands.[[/i]]

The mountain city of Karak Dum is well-known to you, where great furnaces and smithies of the Dawi had once become overrun by the encroaching Forces of Chaos, who made the city the jewel in their Ruinous crown. It is a great shame of your kin that many heirlooms were lost. Though its remaining inhabitants had been rescued during the Spirit of Grungni’s previous foray, there has been no word from the city since. Many of its treasures are thought to still remain in its holds – more than reason enough to go back and resecure the city!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: {{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_grudge_legendary_settlement_karak_dum}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: [[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared posthumously on behalf of the deceased King Borri Silverfoot of Karaz Bryn, against Neferata and her uzkul thralls. The former citadel at the umgi-named Silver Pinnacle was once a great stronghold, taken in a single attack by the Queen of Evil and her loathsome forces. King Borri and many Dawi perished that night – their deaths can only be avenged by returning the citadel to Dawi hands and sealing away Neferata’s evil once and for all.[[/i]]

[[i]]Be it written that the Council of Kings bore witness to this Grudge, declared by all kings, written in their blood and passed down the bloodlines, against the intolerable existence of the thaggoraki menace. By Skavor, we have battled the wretched ratmen for millennia, yet our hate for the hideous creatures is undimmed. It is time to take the final fight to them and wash away centuries of Grudges with raki blood. The locations of their two main warrens at opposite ends of the Karaz Ankor are known – any Dawi force fit and ready to deal the killing blows is obliged to do so![[/i]]

Your Handgunner programme has given the Gunnery School a batch of new cadets eager to learn in the field. Let us hope their enthusiasm lasts!\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

The school watches its students closely – as the budding riflemen hone their skills, their suitability to use the Gunnery School’s latest advancements is assessed.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

The Gunnery School’s cadets are both students and test subjects, granted the latest contraptions to trial and error in battle with pride and distinction.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

As the guns and artillery fire volley after volley at the Empire’s enemies, their successes and failures are observed, recorded and learned from.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

Access to easily-forged components of any size, shape or density enables the school to construct weapon prototypes far ahead of their time.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

The more experienced the cadets, the greater the number of enhancements and modifications they are trusted to equip themselves with.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

The application of magic to military engineering makes for much more destructive capabilities, but the added unpredictability has required greater scrutiny of developments tested in the field.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

Through a secret extracurricular program, a select group of Ironsides have successfully been trained in 'non-traditional' munitions and equipment usage.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

A masterful display of destructive ordnance powered by forces beyond the understanding of the professorship has demonstrated the value of less conventional sources of knowledge.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}
The campus at Nuln is the jewel in the Gunnery School's crown, and a beacon of the Empire's military supremacy.\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

The ever-growing list of cutting-edge equipment and techniques developed by the Gunnery School continues to strengthen the pedigree of the Empire’s gunnery and artillery troops. \n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

Our enemies now heed the horror of our rocket-powered destruction delivered from afar, fuelled by the Amethyst Armoury!\n\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_gunnery_school_panel_more_information}}

localised_title: Ulrika Magdova: Slaughter on the Steppes
localised_description: {{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_chaos_dwf_ulrika_stage_1}}
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_chaos_dwf_ulrika_stage_2}}

News spreads like wildfire throughout the land, as the panicked voices of the local populace recount their flight from the forces of Chaos. The armies of Ruin descend from the north, ransacking nearby towns and leaving the streets awash with blood. With enough haste, some of their victims may yet still be rescued from the jaws of death, yet for every life brutally snuffed out, the Winds of Shyish blow ever stronger. Perhaps this attack could also serve as a morbid opportunity? Lay waste to the forces of Chaos that terrorise the Empire, for their suffering will empower the Death's Timekeeper artefact and pave the way to unlocking the mysteries of time and death itself!

If Nurgle is to gain supremacy across the realm, His most important heralds must work tirelessly to perpetuate the cycle of life and death. Leading by example, Epidemius brooks no idleness or distraction from such serious matters, endlessly taking his plagued cavalcade to wherever wars can be waged and victims can be made, all the while irritably scratching his quill to keep his records up to date.

It is the duty of the seven Proctors of Pestilence to respond vehemently to Nurgle’s whims, demanding close observation of specific diseases and prognoses to ensure every detail is recorded in ink. No location is off-limits for such a preeminent task – not even Ulthuan itself. At the gates of the White Tower of Hoeth, a Plague-stricken High Elf host awaits the arrival of a meddling Prophetess of Bretonnia intent on purifying the Asur of their glorious pestilence. Epidemius cannot allow this outcome – the diseased High Elves must die, and more than that, their deaths must be observed in proximity before being prevented by the Bretonnians’ cure!

Rumours spoken in the Dark Tongue claim that any who survive a night in a lonely and haunted forest during Hexensnacht will be blessed with the aid of the wild magic of the mountains. None of Chaos' champions have lived to corroborate the tale, and so Tamurkhan deigns to set up his camp in the darkest part of the old forest as the sun sets. It will be no easy feat. Whichever beasts lurk in the shadows will soon make themselves known, and a river of blood will be spilled before the sun rises once more!

Marching through the Dark Lands, Tamurkhan stumbles upon a towering monster animated from rock, magically manipulated by a mischievous Greenskin Shaman. As it lurches to life, the creature begins a rampage of mass destruction, slaughtering a crowd of Chaos Dwarf warriors in a violent, blood-soaked frenzy. Their misfortune proves the opportunity Tamurkhan needs to strengthen a powerful alliance. Should he slaughter the Greenskin Shaman controlling this rogue idol, the grateful Dark Dwarfs will have no choice but to bow before the Master of Hosts.

Wandering through the Chaos Wastes, Tamurkhan's great horde encounters the roving warband of a sworn enemy of {{tr:land_units_onscreen_name_wh3_dlc25_nur_cha_exalted_hero_chieftain}}. As is the way of Ruin, mutual annihilation is inevitable, for one must bow to the other or die slowly at their feet. Pride will not allow either to willingly subjugate themselves, leaving only one path to dominance: all-out slaughter. Only when the nemesis of {{tr:land_units_onscreen_name_wh3_dlc25_nur_cha_exalted_hero_chieftain}} lies broken can Tamurkhan stand victorious, earning undying fealty with this latest conquest.

Tamurkhan sleeps fitfully, for his dreams are plagued with visions of horror in the garden of Nurgle. Unnatural monsters corrupt Grandfather's putrid realm, and dark powers dare to mar its beauteous corruptions. In the depths of slumber, Tamurkhan hears a being of great power calling for him to wake in the land of bewitched dreaming. As the interlopers descend, only the Fimir Balefiend Ketzak Fimdirach stands beside Tamurkhan, ready to banish the invading scum from the precious realms of Decay. The screeching hordes must be put to death, before their presence alone taints Nurgle's foetid garden!

Fatsod, Great Unclean One, Lord of Stench and Bile, the Burping Enormity and Most Rotund of the Host, has been recently blessed by Nurgle with enormous proportions. Unfortunately its insatiable appetites have also grown exponentially, and it has taken to snacking on the mortal warriors of Nurgle's Warband! Gloriously unholy or not, Fatsod must be dealt with. The most zealous followers of Chaos may see their devouring as a blessing, but the Chieftains cannot accept such losses if Nurgle's rot is ever to be spread across the land!

The Jabberslythe, Skraelsbane, devourer of Mournhowl's kin, has drunk deeply of the arcane Winds. Corrupted and insane, the creature has developed a taste for the Skin Wolves of Norsca. Eager to prove his superiority over the beast, Tamurkhan marches in defence of Mournhowl’s homeland, only to find Mournhowl’s kinsmen held captive by the beast and awaiting their imminent end within its jaws. It seems a new alliance lies just beyond the horizon, as the Maggot Lord leads his host into battle to aid Mournhowl's beleaguered warriors. Together, they may crush Skraelsbane decisively under their heels!

Not even the hardiest of Dwarfs dare meet the gaze of the War-mourner, Garagrim Ironfist, son of the great Slayer King Ungrim Ironfist. In spite of his noble birth, Garagrim is a Slayer, and has taken their bloody oath to the core of his steely Dwarfen heart. Nevertheless, this Dawi prince has warriors to spare under his command, drilled and barracked at the Dwarfhold of Karak Kadrin. Recruiting some of these units into your army may tempt him back to the battlefield once more, where the glorious death sought by all Slayers can surely be found.

Though the Slayer's Oath demands a valiant demise, great warriors chasing death and glory serve the Dawi little while the great Holds still lie vulnerable. And now there is cause to unleash your full engineering prowess upon those with Dwarf blood on their talons. If there is any hope of bringing down a Dragon, however, every Cannon must first be optimised and calibrated to the finest specifications. Perhaps it's time to take your latest artillery line out for a field test or two…

One Dragon's forays now warrant swift retribution for the devastation left at the sites of the former Holds of Dwarf refugees. The beast is likely to be protected by the Elven Dragon Princes, who ride the mighty steeds of Caledor in lieu of their elusive Draconic mounts. Thus, avid enemy horsemen must be sought on the field of battle; what is learned firing your great guns at one cavalry force can be used should the Dragon Princes get in your way.

A Dragon has made a new enemy in the Dwarfs, yet the mountainous ridges the airborne monsters of its kind call home are a treacherous landscape for any battle. To face the beast in its rocky lair, every warrior destined to do battle against it must be nimble and sure-footed. Engage in battle across such regions by blood and rifle – the perilous landscape will serve as a test for the greater dangers to come.

In light of recent terrible events, the throng is buoyed by the addition of the latest batch of brand-new artillery pieces. Quite frankly, there’s nothing better than a fresh batch of Cannons! Except perhaps having a decent drinking establishment nearby, which ironically is crucial to ease recruitment into the cannoneers’ ranks. A wholesome stein of Bugman’s doesn’t only help with the tinnitus, but also does wonders for the sanity of Dwarfs who spend so much time around constantly exploding gunpowder.

The Dragon Princes of Caledor once left the world in shadow, as their Draconic mounts blotted out the sun, wreaking devastation upon the helpless. Yet it is one Dragon's transgression against the innocent Dawi that will be remembered in the annals of history as the reason it was condemned to die. Complicit to the attacks, the Elven Dragonriders and indeed any of the Asur who protect the monster must also pay back the debt of spilt Dawi blood.

The entirety of Dwarfkind has been shaken by one monster’s destructive whims. Though the tragedy of Dwarf lives cut short by the despicable Dragon is still fresh in your mind, another crisis is brewing that will soon require your attention. The upheaval of Dwarfs from so many Holds threatens to plunge your kind into full-blown crisis, so must be managed tactfully.

With the Cannons tinkered with to near perfection, a battle of legend awaits, a chance to avenge Dawi blood spilled by a rampant Dragon. Nestled at the base of a towering rockface lies a yawning cave entrance uncovered by the keen eyes of your adventuring party, who have also spotted Elven Dragonriders rallying nearby. A thunderous roar echoes from the cave's depths, and bones litter the passageway into the dark. Every clue points to one dangerous truth: the Dragon lurks within!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_dragon_hunters_narrative_battle}}

A detestable Sorcerer-Prophet of the Chaos Dwarfs wreaks havoc across the land. Dreadquake war machines ensnare ever more captives destined for the factories of the Dark Lands. Your newly-assigned Gyrocopters could make short work of the loathsome contraptions, but the pilots are still fresh out of training and must be put through their paces with live combat. This will also serve as a field test for their new vessels, allowing the gathering of enough information to make some much needed upgrades.

To the puzzlement of your troops, the hunted Sorcerer-Prophet flits and raids elusively throughout the land as details on his main base of operations remain sparse. It appears a surgical operation, with smaller convoys reportedly replenishing his war supplies – or perhaps they are a ploy to distract pursuers from the main target’s grievous aims? One such resupply convoy has been spotted – decoy or not, if the twisted Dawi-Zharr wish to enslave innocents, each and every one of them shall pay the price.

The evil figure at the helm of the Dreadquake raiding party has come far in search of captives for his noxious mines and factories. The Chaos Dwarfs' home is a wasteland of smog and desolation, stifling the lungs of all but its wretched inhabitants. Only those with experience in similarly brutal climates might hope to match the strength of those that live there. Immerse yourself among the vile wastelands that plague the world, until the Dark Lands' toxic haze feels like a welcome reprieve.

Kislev will leave no stone unturned to avenge its losses from the Sorcerer-Prophet's raids – that much is certain – while the other great power in Old World always has its beady Imperial eyes cast everywhere. Establishing trade links with either Kislev or Cathay may prove beneficial for much more than fiscal reasons. Even from beyond your countless feats of engineering genius, the Dawi have much to offer, should either nation have any valuable information to exchange about recent events…

Your shared origins with the Chaos Dwarfs mean they are as cunning as you, the intellect of the hunted raider making him as dangerous as his own Dreadquakes. One pursuing force had recently been led through a chokepoint that soon became awash with their blood in a vicious ambush orchestrated by the Sorcerer-Prophet. The Dark Dwarfs’ ways of war are too much of a mystery to risk an immediate attack against a proven battlefield master such as this. His lesser brethren, on the other hand...

Gyrocopter squadrons have always been important to the Dawi throngs lucky enough to have them, providing invaluable air support for ground troops. Yet under your command they will not only fly in support of the warriors, but also to run aerial interference around the Spirit of Grungni as it flies to war. The Gyrocopters must be a day-to-day presence around the legendary Airship, allowing them opportunities to be routinely drilled as part of its battle protocols.

The Sorcerer-Prophet’s location and movements are finally being tracked from the air, leaving him nowhere to hide. Investing your time into the Gyrocopters has been worthwhile – they have turned the tide in this search, and will hopefully make the difference in the battle to come. Take the Spirit of Grungni and its Gyrocopter squadron to the skies to rain fire down on the Hashut-worshipping fiend; prove our war machines are superior to any of that monster's foul creations or magic!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_dreadquake_destruction_narrative_battle}}

The vile thralls of Khorne gather beneath the banner of an Exalted Bloodthirster – just the enemy you have been seeking! Many a Bloodthirster Daemon has found its way into the Book of Grudges, and a good Daemon-slaying is certainly long overdue. With enough calibration and field testing, your new batch of Organ Guns should make quick work of the fiend and, more importantly, show Gotrek that even a great Slayer such as he will never be able to match your kill-count!

Ruin infuses the very air that surrounds the Khornate scourge recently appearing across the land; it is difficult to imagine that your Dwarf warriors will survive a Daemon encounter without experience fending off Chaos' malevolent energies. It may be worth seeking battle and adventure in a Wasteland steeped in Chaos – only then will your warriors understand its wretched taint, and feel prepared to fight through the darkness.

It is of little doubt that your tinkering will have the Organ Guns battle-ready when the time comes to face the Daemon. Any failures in the coming battles will certainly not be down to the firearms themselves, but the throng is still rather wet around the ears when it comes to artillery warfare. The new gun crews are in dire need of battlefield drilling, with the blood they spill now no doubt earning the Bloodthirster's attention later.

The Exalted Bloodthirster responsible for the recent Chaos upsurge will prove a deadly foe, capable of crushing the skulls of any brave enough to face it. If there is anything to be learned from the slaughter in the Holds left in the creature's wake, its that more than mere courage will be required to best it. Gather your strength and sharpen your mind, for this challenge demands the deadliest of inventions, wielded by a champion at the height of their power.

The Daemons of Khorne revel in the destruction left in their wake. Yet entities of the Chaos Realm are notoriously hard to track, with the ability to manifest portals which can swallow their entire hosts in the blink of an eye, only to have them later appear elsewhere on the mortal plane. Such rifts have attracted other opportunistic visitors from the other side, meaning that when it rains Daemons, it pours!

Your new Organ Guns cannot be brought to their full destructive potential a moment too soon! A recent sighting of a Herald of Khorne demands more serious attention than being another opportunity for showing Gotrek up, for this is a Daemon existing solely to fuel others with an irresistible hunger for prolonged war. The Bloodthirster and the rest of the Khorne cannon-fodder will be weaker once it is dead, if only from giving the throng a taste of the greater Daemon-slaying feat to come.

Weeks of tinkering with the war machines and drilling the warriors to fight alongside the Organ Guns has you primed for the bloodiest of battles! The Bloodthirster's ravaging army threatens all with its insatiable lust for all-out slaughter. But once Khorne's wretched pet falls to the barrage of your artillery, many age-old grudges borne of the Bloodthirster's past massacres will also finally be struck from the Dammaz Kron. And not only that – Gotrek will see that you are as great a Slayer as he!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_exalted_bloodthirster_narrative_battle}}

On a serendipitously clear day, a report is received of a flare fired into the sky from an unknown source in the distance. After the area it originated from was reconnoitred, it was discovered that the flare was a rudimentary but effective device built by a young Dwarf Engineer – unexpectedly, a member of a lost Dwarf regiment thought to have been wiped out many weeks prior! While being held captive with his force by the Dark Elves, the tinkerer had managed to cobble together a makeshift distress-flare using scrap metal and ignitable ore. Such ingenuity certainly deserves rescue, but aside from that, there are innocent Dwarf and manling lives at stake! All who toil under the Naggarothi do not stay alive for long.
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_fellow_engineer}}

Tales of trees uprooting themselves and coming alive are typically the stuff of fables, but the current path of indiscriminate murder by the animated boughs and branches of the Forest Spirits makes their horror all too real for many of the Empire’s citizens. At the centre of the awakenings are the Treemen, beings saturated with magic that rouses others of their kind. One's gnarled and lumbering form has been spotted, it must be brought down before its host grows!

As tempting as it may be, one does not simply just waltz into the forest with Flame Cannons set to 'maximum incineration' without first carrying out some reconnaissance and interrogation of the locals. The pesky forest Elves must know something about the mysterious awakening, or perhaps are culpable for it in some way themselves. Diplomacy is rarely the option with the isolationist Fey – it is time to poke the wasp’s nest and see what is revealed.

It is thought that the forest magic that twists the trees into violent spirits of bark and branch comes from the same source of arcane energy that rouses the bloodlust of the beasts and monsters that live there. Facing such creatures in their own habitat requires no small amount of practice and understanding of the threats faced when waging war in the wilderness. Put your host’s monster-slaying skills to the test; ready the warriors for the worst the forest might throw at them.

The malevolent Treemen devastating the Empire provide a glorious opportunity for doom, but you must resist throwing yourself at the monsters for now. With the Empire invoking age-old oaths to ask for your help, you should first ascertain precisely what it is you are up against – at the very least, to know how much black powder and munitions to bring to the fight. The nobles who saw their lands ravaged by the twisted creatures would be a good place to start.

A dark and sinister force has spread across the forests of the Old World, awakening angry tree spirits that have claimed countless human lives. The most powerful of the Treemen has been located, deemed to be at the epicentre of the awakenings, and now your oath to defend your human allies must be fulfilled. March out and introduce its host to your latest Flame Cannon upgrades; time to reduce these rampaging spirits to cinders!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_malevolent_tree_spirits_narrative_battle}}

A dark and sinister force has spread across the forests of the Old World, awakening angry tree spirits that have claimed countless human lives. The most powerful of the Treemen has been located, deemed to be at the epicentre of the awakenings, and now your oath to defend your human allies must be fulfilled. March out and introduce its host to your latest Flame Cannon upgrades; time to reduce these rampaging spirits to cinders!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_malevolent_tree_spirits_narrative_battle}}

Slaying an Arachnarok Queen will be a valiant feat worthy of legend, with the likelihood of encountering the scores of Goblins that seek the monster nigh on guaranteed. The grobi masses are nothing to fear, but you know better than to charge into any war without being fully prepared for all outcomes. Be it at a few ragtag tribes or a full-blown gobbo Waaagh!, the Goblin Hewer’s gears need greasing and weathering for the worst of worst-case scenarios!

If your Goblin Hewer's axes are ever to tear through the flesh of both Greenskins and Giant Spiders in a single skirmish, the machine needs to generate the necessary power for its unorthodox projectiles to pierce the hides of all manner of thick-carapaced monsters and beasts. Search out hordes of the grotesques that plague the land and take every opportunity to optimise the mechanisms of the Hewer, for such adjustments will surely prove vital for entering the Spider Queen’s lair.

It seems the existence of the legendary Arachnarok Queen is no mystery to most Goblins you've had the pleasure of capturing and interrogating. But so far, none of them seem to have any idea where the information originated from, or who it is that knows the monster's  location for certain. Perhaps perseverance is the key here – if you beat enough grobi into submission, one of them might reveal something eventually!

Your scouts report a notorious Night Goblin on the prowl, a well-known Hatchling herder who is thought to have supplied many a Spider Mount for his Goblin kin. He too covets the Arachnarok Queen’s eggs, no doubt to bolster the ranks of some Warboss' next wretched Waaagh! Wiping him and his search party from the map would certainly be doing the civilised world a favour, and give the Goblin Hewer its most notable kill yet!

It is little wonder that Goblins are fearless (or stupid) enough to want to enter the inhospitable lair of the Arachnarok Queen. Most of them originate from the notorious Badlands, a landscape of diverse dangers harboured in mist-covered swamps, unnavigable dunes, and trackless rocky barrenness, a habitat not too different from the caverns where the monster will be hunted. To brave this task, you should first familiarise the throng with similar environmental perils to harden them for the challenge ahead.

You want nothing but the toughest Dwarfs operating your beloved brainchild, the famed Goblin Hewer, but the tougher your warriors are the harder pressed they are to be removed from the front lines. Luckily, the well-known dangers of operating your machines means it has not been that difficult to find a cohort of fellow Slayers willing to brave the Hewer's perils. Their only caveat: expand your Slayer numbers so the crew can take turns to attempt seeking their doom on the front lines.

News reaches you that the Goblin Clans have finally discovered the Arachnarok Queen’s lair where she fiercely guards her nest and coveted brood. Eager to wrangle Hatchlings and pilfer Giant Spider eggs, the grobi masses have mobilised their hordes towards the Queen’s cavern, where danger and possible doom await you. Adventure into the depths of the earth and ensure the name Malakai Makaisson and the infamous Goblin Hewer are etched into legend!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_spider_swarm_narrative_battle}}

A Vampire and his necromantic thralls cavort with an army of the dead, raising more and more of the world’s deceased into their battle ranks from the sacred rest of their tombs. With complete incineration being the only surefire way to annihilate an Undead puppet, a precise recipe of incendiary compounds must be used to utterly consume the husks in Gyrobomber flame. Thus much fielding testing will be required to ensure the fleet’s readiness for the much-more-flammable payloads.

The Undead walk the earth as unnatural fiends, suffused with dark and perilous magics. Any experience in dealing with the darkest arts of the arcane will be vital in fulfilling your oath to end this recent scourge. Lead your adventuring army against any sorcerous villain that threatens our kin or allies; the knowledge gained from such a battle could be used to perfect your Gyrobomber tactics for the coming skirmishes.

The walking dead are an abominable enemy that attacks in vast waves, quickly overwhelming the unprepared with sheer numbers. Yet they are easily defeated by striking down the puppet masters who control them; sniveling, malevolent individuals who are weak once you deprive them of their wretched party trick of conjuring life into the lifeless. Up to now, your retinue has been mostly spared from the horrors of the necromantically inclined, but in time must learn all the tricks of such a foe .

The Vampiric scourge and their Undead thralls inhabit the darkest corners of the world, lands teeming with Vampiric corruption. An expedition into the heart of their wicked abode will be fraught with danger, leaving our warriors susceptible to the ravages of their malevolent energies. It would be wise to immerse yourself in lands steeped in such corruption sooner rather than later, lest its dark taint prove too much in the heat of battle.

Your scouts who shadow the growing Undead horde bring dire news: two splinter groups have split off from the shambing masses led by two thralls of the Vampire Lord responsible for this Undead awakening, but whose own hosts also grow in power. The squadrons have their new directives; a Master Necromancer and Strigoi Ghoul King are now on your hit-list.

Gyrobomber squadrons have always been important to the Dawi throngs lucky enough to have them, providing invaluable air support for ground troops. Yet under your command they will not only fly in support of the warriors, but also to run aerial interference around the Spirit of Grungni as it flies to war. The Gyrobombers must be a day-to-day presence around the legendary Airship, allowing them opportunities to be routinely drilled as part of its battle protocols.

The Vampire Lord's power still grows with each passing hour, as scores of the shambling undead still clamber from their tombs. With the creature and his husks now located, the conclusion of this adventure now looms near. It is time for the Gyrobombers to take to the clouds to rain fire down upon his deathly horde and send them to oblivion! For only when the fiend has been destroyed will the Undead stench be truly wiped clean from the land.
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_undead_empowered_narrative_battle}}

The Skaven attack against the Dwarf trading hub may not be out of character, but for them to stick around and not scurry back into their holes is a worrying sign indeed. A major scheme must be brewing, and one best dealt with using the most defensible mobile vantage points you can provide. Your new Thunderbarge class of Airships are ready, now only needing a little field testing to prove that their killing prowess sufficiently exceeds their likelihood to crash!

The worrying situation at the Dwarf trading hub is starting to be felt across the Dwarfholds. The trade route that serves the hub is one that maintains the fragile cordial relations between the Dawi and other races but is now cut off, with long-term repercussions potentially leading to diplomatic consequences as well. It will not be long before a problem arises that needs dealing with...

From the Dwarfs' experience, the Skaven are creatures of low cunning on the open battlefield for the most part, with their diabolical weaponry used primarily to make them a deadly threat at range. Though the danger they pose is miniscule next to the booming might of a Thunderbarge, there would be no harm in familiarising the throng with their uniquely twisted warmongering ways. To any Dwarf who has never fought them, it is a rite of passage to do so!

It is clear that the Skaven blockading the mountain trading hub are waiting for reinforcements, but is that all they are waiting for? There is no time to find out, with a second Skaven force already scouted and moving up into the mountain passes. Curiously, it is led by a wretched Raki donned in hissing, clanking contraptions, indicating he is a Warlock of sorts. And where the most devious minds of the Skaven go, destruction usually follows!

Though the might of your flying machines is a wonder to behold, the Skaven are far too numerous for the Spirit of Grungni to hold back alone. Yet the lofty mountainous location of the blockade means an aerial threat is still the right tactic. Having instructed your hangar workshops to work around the clock, your latest designs for new Airship parts are in production for final assembly. No cost should be spared to get the fully operational Thunderbarges into the air!

Ever since its construction, your flagship Thunderbarge has had the Raki in its sights. Assembled following the Skaven invasion of Nuln, the legendary Spirit of Grungni even suffered an attack by them before it was completed, but fortunately even when partially completed it still had more than enough ability to thwart them. The Skaven must know the Spirit takes to the skies again – the mere possibility that it may appear on the battlefield will dampen any resolve in their craven hearts.

The scheme has been revealed! The filthy rats’ blockade had been a distraction while a dreaded Warpstone bomb was being planted in the mountain high above the trading hub, where its detonation would surely cause a devastating avalanche and a permanent end to this crucial trade route. For the sake of Dawi prosperity and the innocent Dwarfs who would perish there, you can wait no longer. An intervention of this magnitude will be a bold step towards your redemption!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_warpstone_bomb_narrative_battle}}

Nuln is known to many as the “Jewel of the Empire”, and not without good reason. As the Empire’s industrial as well as cultural heartland, this sprawling city contains many manufactories providing heavy weapons, munitions and ordnance, in addition to the Imperial Gunnery School, whose role is it to train the Emperor’s artillerists in the ways of modern, mechanised warfare. There are some, however, who believe that only a fraction of Nuln’s potential is currently being exploited. The rulers of the Empire have demanded the development of a new cavalry doctrine, so Theodore Bruckner may join Imperial armies in the field. View this as an opportunity for Nuln to further earn its already-well-deserved title of “Bastion of the South”.

The theoretical tacticians at the Imperial Gunnery School may well have developed a new, game-changing model for cavalry warfare, but Countess Emmanuelle and Bruckner, her champion, remain unconvinced. What they really need to see is the method proved in combat, against the Emperor’s foes, and as soon as is humanly possible! Only then will they be satisfied that a man of Bruckner's singular talents will be put to best use on the battlefield.

The Night Goblin's army wreaks havoc across the land, spreading the Nemesis Crown's wicked and corrupting influence. Dominated armies fall into line at the Crown-bearer's command, with nothing but conquest and destruction on their minds.\n\nThe Empire cannot fall victim to this vile onslaught – the Night Goblins have already shed more than enough innocent blood. Defeat this ravaging band of scum and cast the Crown back into the dark once more!

As Elspeth reaches the location of her visions, she is dismayed to find she is too late! The Nemesis Crown has already been claimed by a vile horde of Greenskins, whose leader has made off with the artefact. One of his straggling armies remains, with cackles of “da Boss is da King now, ee’s got da Crown!” echoing throughout the surrounding mountains. The Dark Lady must confront the remnants of the green horde head-on and find out where this “king” might be.

A lumbering Orc by the name of Luggn Biggagit has been summoned by the Crown-bearer, and with him follows an overwhelming force of hideous Trolls and monsters. Should they reach their destination, our fight to snatch the Nemesis Crown from the Night Goblin who wields it could prove insurmountable. Yet if some terrible tragedy should befall Luggn on his journey...\n\n[[col:green]]Succeeding in this mission will remove Luggn from the Nemesis Crown final battle, weakening the enemy forces.[[/col]]

The Night Goblin fanatic Icky da Nosepicka obeys the call of the Nemesis Crown, marching his forces with haste to join the Crown-bearer on the field of battle. If we ever hope to seize the Crown from the vile grip in which is resides, this union cannot be allowed! Ride out to meet this Night Goblin horde and slay their misguided leader; we cannot waste an opportunity to weaken our foes!\n\n[[col:green]]Succeeding in this mission will remove Icky from the Nemesis Crown final battle, weakening the enemy forces.[[/col]]

Gnashrak Spiderclaw marches to battle at the head of an army of arachnids. Soon, his spiderlings will join the Crown-bearer's forces, strengthening his army immeasurably. Perhaps it would be wise to stop them creeping any closer. Squash this wretched Shaman and his many-legged army at once, before they can unite with our foul enemy!\n\n[[col:green]]Succeeding in this mission will remove Gnashrak from the Nemesis Crown final battle, weakening the enemy forces.[[/col]]

As his decaying forces ooze and lactate their way across the countryside seemingly unopposed, Tamurkhan’s trail of putrid slime taints what lush flora that remained, pleasing the Urfather greatly. Now, Tamurkhan sets his sights on the great Imperial city of Nuln, his gift to Nurgle and a crucial step on his terrible journey to Daemonhood. This will be no easy task, however, as the garrison at Nuln is prepared for the coming incursion. From the Empire’s finest to the common smallfolk, all are ready to lay down their lives – nay, their very souls – in defence of the homeland, in a haze of blackpowder and artillery smoke. Tamurkhan scoffs at such futile resistance, for all *will* be crushed before him, and the city *will* embrace its new, foetid patron soon enough!
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_dlc25_qb_gotrek_felix_chaos_katarin}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Geheimnistag, or the Floating Holiday as it is known among citizens of the Empire, marks that rarest of occasions: when both the twin moons of Morrslieb and Mannslieb are risen and bright in the night, thinning the veil that separates the mortal realm from the other planes of existence. It is no coincidence that on one such Geheimnisnacht Eve, the hallowed Dwarf Slayer Gotrek and his mannish companion and chronicler Felix Jaeger detected and defeated a Slaaneshi cult, only to find themselves transported to the Realm of Chaos to face more horrors at the whim of the insidious Prince of Pleasure. His gamesmaster – a Keeper of Secrets – must be found and killed for Slaanesh’s foul game to finally end.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

The enemy has collected four Daemon Prince souls and attempts to assail the Forge of Souls before you! They will stage close to the Forge, preparing to cross the void. Intercept and defeat the imposters or they will challenge Be’lakor in contention for the prize. Stop them or be cast into irrelevance – your campaign LOST!

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: {{tr:hp_campaign_description_compass}}\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_compass_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Uzkulak was nothing more than a tiny slum when last Kislevites held  Fort Dorznye-Vort, but over the centuries it has grown to be the dominant settlement in this region. Occupying it will let the Greenskins and others know there is a new power here.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Kislev once claimed this entire region and should do so again under the rule of Boris Ursus! Take the other settlements in this [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] and own it all.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Orcs in this region resent your presence. The ignorant creatures are unaware that the Kislev Tzardom reached through High Pass and claimed these lands. Let us remind them!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
Send word to Fort Dorznye-Vort that more warriors are needed. Start recruiting at once!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

From the ruins of Doomkeep a new power rises. Minions of the Dark Powers have been tasked to build you a mighty fortress and it is now all but ready. Claim it.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Nordlanders occupy the Bay of Blades. Allowing them to exist there weakens the Dark Powers' influence in this region. It will be considered a great boon if you purge the settlement of mortal filth.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

For now the Chaos Gods are capricious. You will quickly fall from their favour if you cannot dominate your home [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]. Dominate the Ice Tooth Mountains!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

Nordland has sent armies into the north. Hoping to halt invasions into their own territory. One such army thinks to cut you off from your new fortress. Show them no mercy.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

You will need a larger army for the battles to come. Now that Doomkeep is under your dominion, recruit more warriors into your host and the victories will soon follow.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

You will need a larger army for the battles to come. Now that Doomkeep is under your dominion, recruit more warriors into your host and the victories will soon follow.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

You will need a larger army for the battles to come. Now that Doomkeep is under your dominion, recruit more warriors into your host and the victories will soon follow.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

You will need a larger army for the battles to come. Now that Doomkeep is under your dominion, recruit more warriors into your host and the victories will soon follow.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

The tribes have forgotten why you have acquired so many titles and ruled for so long. They need a 'reminder', and that means some killing and eating. Start with Grimtop!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

The Ivory Road spans from Grand Cathay to the Old World, but a good part of the route crosses through the Mountains of Mourn. Goldtooth's territory. Take it back from traitors and foes!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Bear-God's roar has driven unrest throughout the Ogre Kingdoms. Tribes that were once loyal or at least content, now hunger for power. An army approaches thinking to take you on. Show them how foolish such greedy ambition is!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
There will be many big fights to come. Best to swell your hoard with some fresh meat. Get recruiting!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

We require Bloodwind Keep to facilitate the invasion of [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]], but taking it by force is not the only option. You might instead use your [[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Tzeentchian cunning[[/sl]] to coax the inhabitants to our cause.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement_tzeentch}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: You must own the rest of the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] to establish a power base from which to launch your invasion through the Great Bastion and into Cathay's interior. Occupy the remaining settlements and claim this province!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

Your machinations have borne fruit. Through manipulation, the Imperial Wardens have wandered far from their normal patrols of the Great Bastion. They are now within striking distance. Kill them and weaken Cathay’s defences!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

Even the most manipulative and far-sighted of lords will still require a power force to back up threats and even act, when direct action is required. Recruit more warriors to expand your force.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

The Vanaheimlings squat in Gerslev, their bitterness and hatred to you only further enflamed by the defeat of Gulbrandsen's horde. They cannot be left to fester – as queen of the Motherland, you must expel them without mercy!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

If you are to rescue the Bear-God, Ursun, from the Realm of Chaos, then Kislev must be united! Gerslev is but the first step on this journey, now bring the rest of this oblast under your rule. Claim all settlements in this [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] through might or diplomacy.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province_kislev}}

Displaced by the maelstrom, worshippers of the Dark Gods scour the Motherland. A horde of Dolgan even dares encroach upon the capital. A strong monarch cannot let this stand... Destroy them!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

Kislevites always flock to strong rulers. Your recent victory will ensure there are plenty of Kossars eager to fight under your banner. Which is well, as you will need a larger army to reclaim towns stolen by the Vanaheimlings.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

Stanitsas this far north that have not wholly conformed to Great Orthodoxy strictures are a threat to the Kislevite people and their immortal souls. By cleansing Leblya of unbelievers we ensure the Dark Powers cannot inveigle their way into the minds of heathens.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

For centuries, Troll Country has been an area shunned by the Tzars, allowing the tribes and creatures of Chaos to fester. But no longer! The Cult of Ursun shall show its strength despite the silence of its god, and deliver this region into the dominion of the Great Orthodoxy!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Ungol Kindreds have always resisted the teachings of the Great Orthodoxy, preferring heathen rites - the words of hags and witches over the sanctioned sermons. There is no time to correct such heresy through teaching, we must face them in battle!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

Kislevites always flock to strong rulers. Your recent victory will ensure there are plenty of Kossars eager to fight under your banner. Recruit willing supplicants to the cause.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

Owning a port on the Frozen Sea will allow for rapid infestation, ensuring your poxes travel far. The Ogres currently claim it, but they are not worthy of such a prize, take it from them!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Claim this [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] and infest it with your power. From this many fresh drones and servants shall gestate and your forces and influence shall quickly spread across the world.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Ogres have taken Glut-port and seek to expand on your new capital. They are an annoyance that needs taking care of before we can expand our own burgeoning realm. Slay the interlopers!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

To ferment further epidemics then a sizable horde of plague-carriers is needed. Swell your Daemonic host with more drudges and festerlings to bring the greatest of gifts to those that fight upon the mortal plane.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units_nurgle}}

The Mines of Nan-Yang are held by Rebel Lords, under the sway of Chi'an Chi. Their continued existence defiles Cathay and risks further sedition in the region. They must be eliminated.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Gunpowder Road is a major throughfare of the northern [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]], allowing the artificers of Nan-Gau to transport their wares and weapons across the Empire. No part of this region should remain under rebel control!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

Under the malign influence of Chi'an Chi, rebels from the Mines of Nan-Yang approach with hostile hearts. They are Fateweaver's puppets to ensure strife as he attacks through the Great Bastion. Not that this exonerates such disobedience. They must face the Dragon's wrath!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Send messengers to Nan-Gau that you require more warriors as you continue to purge Grand Cathay of rebellious taint.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

The Palace of Princes was created by a Slaaneshi troupe as a venue for the Masque. But now it is in the hands of Khorne's servants. See it is returned back into the loins of Slaanesh's attendants.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Uniting the Shard Lands under one dominatrix will not only rid you of the immediate threat from Khorne, but give a strong powerbase from which to launch southwards, where the richest quarry lies.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Blood God[[/sl]] has always hated [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] above his other kin. His servants approach the Palace of Ruin, now is the time to strike out or risk destruction.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
Swell your host with fresh warriors. All will be required to inflict both pleasure and pain upon the enemy. Start recruiting.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

We must be ready for the travails to come. If our [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] goes through the [[sl:campaign_chaos_rifts]]rifts[[/sl]] then our homelands will be undefended. Muster another army.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_raising_forces_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description:
Additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] may be recruited into an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Unit Recruitment panel[[/sl]]. Recruitment takes [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] and costs [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]]. Once recruited, units cost {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} to maintain each turn.

Recruitment is cheapest when the army is in home territory.

Learn more about unit recruitment [[url:script_link_campaign_unit_recruitment]]here[[/url]].

The Brass Glacier has been the site of many murders in your father's name. The mortals within think to summon Daemons to aid their cause. Well, they have indirectly summoned you, but not to aid them…\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement_khorne}}

The Gharhar tribe have tried to conquer all of the Bloodfire Falls, and perhaps they would have managed it if you had not been lurking under the volcano. But now they have raised your anger…\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province_khorne}}
A Chaos Lord and his retinue seeks to make a name for himself and draw the eye of the Gods. The only thing he is good for is fodder! Slaughter them!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

Skarbrand needs no help. Skarbrand can kill anyone… but old man says is best to summon more Bloodletters! Skarbrand will comply… then Skarbrand will RAGE!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

The vaults of the Dwarfen Karaks are famous for their hoarded wealth. Such riches should be yours, and while gold sustains many Ogres the rest can feast on bearded meat! Break it open and take the good stuff within.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Once you have rid these mountains of Dwarfs, you can then establish a powerful base to launch attacks against the human nations. Just think of all that meat!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

Guided by the Great Maw you have travelled far from the Ogre Kingdoms, and into the Grey Mountains. The trouble is, it's full of Dwarfs. One of their throngs approaches. See them off!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
There will be many big fights to come. Best to swell your hoard with some fresh meat. Get recruiting!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Xen Wu was a thriving town of loyal Cathayans not long ago, and now it is ruins. Abandoned… or is it? Occupy the settlement and find out what happened to your people.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

To become master of Shang-Yang once more you must do so from a place of strength. Ruling over the Wastelands of Jinshen will give you resources and martial might needed to placate other regions.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_complete_province}}

The Skaven have always lurked in the Warpstone Desert but they have been emboldened of late, and now directly challenge you. Exterminate these pests!\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}
Send messengers to Hanyu Port that you require more warriors as you require a grander legion to fight in the battles to come.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_recruit_units}}

For so long have you exalted the pantheon of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] with your deeds that the Ruinous Powers now vie with one another to secure your fealty. Dedicate yourself to the service of a particular god of Chaos, or as an Undivided champion of all.

{{tr:hp_campaign_description_dedication}}

Dedications can be made on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_glory_panel]]Daemonic Glory panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Learn more about Dedications [[url:script_link_campaign_dedication]]here[[/url]].

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: A [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cult[[/sl]] has been established in [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]]'s name! Rage and hate begin to spread amongst the local population.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_construct_chaos_cult_building}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_title: A Tribute to the Skull Throne
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Spread word of the glory of Khorne beyond your borders to gain His favour, unlocking more [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] and making it more likely that the Blood God will become ascendant in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]].\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_spread_chaos_corruption}}

localised_description: Despite not being involved in the struggle for [[sl:campaign_supporters_track]]Support[[/sl]] taking place between The Ice Court and The Great Orthodoxy, other powers within [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]] ruling classes may draw strength from performing Invocations of the Motherland. See to it that the Kislev people receive ample blessings from their gods.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_motherland_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: A [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cult[[/sl]] has been established in service to [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]]! Mysterious diseases begin to circulate amongst the local population already.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_construct_chaos_cult_building}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: {{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_nurgle}} Take steps to increase the amount of Nurgle corruption present in controlled provinces to ensure that [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth is high.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_nurgle_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Spread the pestilent corruption of Grandfather Nurgle to gain His favour, unlocking more [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] and making it more likely that He will become ascendant in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]].\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_spread_chaos_corruption}}

Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: {{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_ogre_camps}}\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_ogre_camps_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Continue to develop your [[sl:campaign_camps]]Ogre camps[[/sl]], for they are the bedrock of [[sl:campaign_ogres]]Ogre[[/sl]] power. {{tr:hp_campaign_ogre_camps_add_01}}\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_ogre_camps_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: While fighting against your master’s rivals furthers the [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]Great Game[[/sl]], the true prizes lie south – the fertile lands and souls of mankind. Send your armies to destroy and despoil!\n\nSack or [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] settlements belonging to any [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]] faction.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] Gods crave souls above all else. Head south into the so-called civilised lands and reap their pitiful lives. ‘Conquer your Daemons’ – we’ll put that phrase to the test!\n\nDefeat [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] from any [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]] factions in the field.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Rather than using the rifts as ingress, close this gateway lest the Daemons – frenzied by the maelstrom – burst forth and lay your domains in Ruin!\n\nLearn more about Chaos Rifts [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_rifts]]here[[/url]].
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: {{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_1}} {{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_provinces}}\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].

You control one province, but more land must be acquired if you are to fund a successful war machine. Send out your armies to seize more territory from your enemies.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].

It is only through conquest that true power may be achieved. Build your forces, take the fight to your enemies and capture their settlements for yourself. The additional facilities and income brought under your banner will afford you yet greater power to wage war.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] can research technologies over time, which bring a variety of civic and military benefits.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_research_technology}}
Our enemies gather to strike against us! Attack first, and deny them the opportunity to reach full strength.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_attack_enemy}}

Ungrateful miscreants in this [[sl:campaign_provinces]]settlement[[/sl]] seek to rebel against your rule. Crush this uprising, before it threatens your hold over the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]!\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_revolts_learn_more}}
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.
Word has reached you that your [[sl:campaign_heroes]]hero's[[/sl]] mission was a success. Excellent!
Word has reached you that your [[sl:campaign_heroes]]hero's[[/sl]] mission was a success. Excellent!

localised_description:
Each [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] maintains a central {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury. The current {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury]]treasury value[[/sl_tooltip]] and overall {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] are shown at the top of the screen.

Additional income can be gained from [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] and other sources.

Learn more about {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} [[url:script_link_campaign_money]]here[[/url]].

Great wealth leads to great power. Leverage the tools at your disposal to gain a substantial income from [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] and other sources. Success against your adversaries depends on being able to afford to keep [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] in the field.\n\nLearn more about {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} [[url:script_link_campaign_money]]here[[/url]].

localised_description: Your attention is split on many fronts: the time is surely nigh to raise a second [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]]. Seek to raise an additional force as soon as you can afford it.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_raising_forces_learn_more}}

A [[sl:campaign_heroes]]hero[[/sl]] has been recruited, and stands ready to serve your cause.

localised_description:
Wars rage the length and breadth of this land. In such times, only the strong can hope to survive. Build your forces in order to meet the threats that face you.

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] cost money to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] and also to maintain through unit upkeep. Be sure to keep watch on your finances as you grow your forces.

Learn more about unit recruitment [[url:script_link_campaign_unit_recruitment]]here[[/url]].

Recruited units cost [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to maintain each [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]]. This upkeep can be ruinous if too many units are recruited. Units may be [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merged or disbanded[[/sl]] to reduce upkeep costs.

The upkeep of each [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is shown on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]army panel[[/sl]] when that army is selected.

Learn more about unit upkeep [[url:script_link_campaign_income]]here[[/url]].

Each [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] maintains a central {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury. The current {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury]]treasury value[[/sl_tooltip]] and overall {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] are shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.

Additional income can be gained from certain buildings, [[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]], sacking enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and other methods.

Learn more about {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} [[url:script_link_campaign_money]]here[[/url]].

Improvements to your [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction's[[/sl]] knowledge and practices are key to gaining dominance over your rivals. Technological research can unlock access to new [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]] and more, or provide improvements to existing assets.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_technology_learn_more}}

Look to develop your [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] into great war leaders by performing acts of bravery in campaign and battle.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_character_skills_learn_more}}

A [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] embedded within an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will fight with that army in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], gaining [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience[[/sl]] and abilities as they do so. With sufficient victories under their belt, any [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero has the potential to become a truly formidable warrior.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_heroes_add_03}}
localised_mission_completed_text: A [[sl:campaign_heroes]]hero[[/sl]] within your retinue is widely famed for their victories in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Your reputation is lifted by the standard of those who serve you.

Already, hedonistic tendencies begin to spread amongst the local population.\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_construct_chaos_cult_building}}

localised_description: Devotion affords the servants of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] many powers unavailable to inferior [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]]. Great [[sl:campaign_disciple_armies]]Disciple Armies[[/sl]] may be raised from amongst the willing, [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]] may be spread across the world, and the weak and venal races of men and Elves may be [[sl:campaign_seductive_influence]]subjugated[[/sl]] through Devotees.\n\n{{tr:hp_campaign_devotees_learn_more}}
