The local population begin to practice their amateur attempts at manipulating the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]].\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_construct_chaos_cult_building}}

Seed the mystic and conspiratorial whisperings of Tzeentch in the minds of the weak and foolish beyond your borders to gain His favour, unlocking more [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] and making it more likely that the Changer of Ways will become ascendant in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]].\n\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_spread_chaos_corruption}}

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The armies of the east encroach on the territory of our grand Holds, and Dawi blood has been spilled in defending them. This cannot be allowed to stand! A grudge has been recorded – now we must see it wiped out.

Many throngs of Dawi have been lost to the Daemonic scourge, before the eyes of our vengeful Ancestor Gods. For every terror they have inflicted, we will inflict one twice as great in return. Hunt their army down and crush them, and settle this grudge once and for all.
Before the downcast eyes of Grimnir, our warriors have fallen to an army of Kislev, and a grudge has been recorded in their names. Avenge their deaths, and erase this shame from the Dammaz Kron!

Grungni surely strikes his anvil in anger, to see the savage armies of the Ogres defile the bodies our brothers to fill their stomachs. Such vile insult cannot go unpunished. Their grotesque misdeeds against the Dawi have been recorded in the Dammaz Kron, and it is long past time we exacted retribution!
The Ancestors must rage to see these umgi of the east raiding our Holds. Halt them in their tracks and erase this grudge as an offering to Grimnir, through the strength and steel of the Dawi!

Grungni rages as the loathsome hordes of Chaos raid our lands, defiling our territory with their foul presence. Strike this grudge from the Dammaz Kron, for their deaths will surely please the Ancestors!
The foul manlings of Kislev dare to raid our lands, in the sight of our Ancestor Gods! We cannot tolerate such blatant disrespect. Track them down and wipe them out, our vengeance cannot wait!
Our ancestors watch with a furious glare as the Ogri scum raid our territory. Mark this grudge in the Dammaz Kron at once; this score will only be settled once their savage army is destroyed!

The Goddess of Home and Hearth surely weeps to see our glorious Holds desecrated by the umgi of Cathay. This insult has been added to the Dammaz Kron. Find the manlings responsible, and ensure they pay for their crimes with blood!

Under Valaya's sorrowful gaze, the scum of Chaos have sacked one of our great Holds. Their filth and perversion must be answered for with blood! Find their army in the name of the Ancestor Gods – every one of these Daemons must be punished!

The northern manlings dare to sack one of our Holds! Every stout-hearted Dawi who fell in its defence must be avenged. With Grimnir as witness, this grudge must be resolved – crush their army and make those cravens pay!

Valaya watches on in sorrow as the wicked ogri army lay waste to one of our Holds. We must show them that the Dawi do not forget, nor do we forgive. Our people lost enough to these kruti scum at Karak Azorn. We must show that history will not be repeated and destroy this detestable army at once!

The most devastating betrayals transcend even death, lurking forever in the memory as the hurt it left behind is passed from generation to generation. Such was the treachery of the Lord Malekith, whose sworn oath of friendship to the Dawi king Snorri Whitebeard was broken a hundred times over! The White Dwarf Grombrindal has sworn to right this wrong. The treacherous Dark Elves must pay for their deceit, for only then will the most grievous of betrayals finally be avenged!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: These Cathayan umgi have taken our territory, right under the eyes of the Ancestors! This cannot be allowed to stand. Record this trespass in the book of grudges and bring that land back into Dawi hands!

Ruinous filth reside in our Dwarfhold, defiling our great halls and desecrating our homes. Their vile stench cannot be allowed to taint our lands a moment longer! Take back our Hold and visit our revenge upon these abominable scum-suckers!

By the eyes of the Ancestors, our Hold has fallen to the manlings of Kislev, who now reside in our rightful place! Our brave Dawi warriors must rectify this at once. Take back our home, and strike this grudge from the Dammaz Kron!

An army of vile Ogri have snatched a Dwarfhold out from under us, slaying its Dawi defenders and making a boiling broth from their bones! This is as vile a transgression as ever recorded in the Dammaz Kron. Our vengeance must be absolute; return this hold to our people, and reap bloody retribution in the name of our fallen brothers!

This keepsake once belonged to a mighty warrior who sought to eradicate defilers of the dead in the name of the Lord of Underearth, Gazul himself. Its loss has been a subject of great shame said to be felt even by the Ancestors, whose souls will not be appeased until it is back in Dawi hands.

By Morgrim's teachings, the craftsmanship displayed with these sacred gears, legendary paradigms of Dwarfen engineering, are of the highest echelons. The knowledge set by their standard is sacred, so the revered instruments must be recovered and preserved for future generations of Dawi.

In his time, Raton proposed dangerous and radical ideas to gain control over primitive beasts. With the help of the Engineers' Guild, he developed a prototype collar that apparently worked, but was slain while binding it to a beast subject. Now long lost, this item’s efficacy could further prove Dwarf engineering’s supremacy over magic.

It is no doubt that Smednir’s smelting techniques made us the most renowned metalworkers in the world. Many of his most important formulae were lost during the many upheavals of the Dwarfen dynasties, likely stolen by those without understanding of what they took. Without Smednir’s lost secrets, the Dawi can never be as great as they are destined to be!

Thungni’s Tongs were utilised by some of the first Runesmiths under his tutelage, serving them well in crafting the most potent rune-weapons ever made. These powerful armaments were crucial in many of the great victories of our kin – such weapons could be forged again, but not without the tongs that gave them their power, long lost in the mists of time.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

Bordeleaux is a dukedom with long-standing maritime traditions, having a strong relationship with the sea and the sustenance it provides. Yet across the oceans of the Old World and beyond, trouble brews. Seaborne bandits ply the straits in ships of war, preying on those foolish enough to sail with unsuitably defended cargo. Sometimes it is not even wealth that the bloodthirsty pirates desire, with many Undead commanders simply hellbent on acquiring more dead to raise into their zombie pirate crews. Renowned for his personal courage and astounding self-discipline, Duke Alberic refuses to allow his people’s livelihoods to be put at risk without taking action. There is no better place to begin cleansing the oceans than Sartosa, the City of Pirates.

Alberic dreams of a life spent questing, but endless royal responsibility keeps him from it. Opportunity arises in the form of dire tidings – the ancestral tomb of the Bordeleaux dukes has been ransacked! Amongst the items stolen is the Trident of Manann, a relic of the God of the Sea himself. It only takes an indelicate conversation with a few barflies to reveal that the thieves had been employed by a renegade Bretonnian duke who, having grown envious of Alberic’s station, sought to purloin his tools of office. With the ruse uncovered, the rival duke throws a gauntlet harshly to the ground, challenging the 'weak and ineffectual' Alberic to face him on the field of battle.

Dark and prophetic visions that have long plagued the Fay Enchantress have at last come to pass. Dark clouds gather off the northern coast of Bretonnia as a mighty fleet of Chaos Warriors approaches with numbers beyond counting, like a great cloak reaching across the ocean. Panic grips the people, but the Enchantress remains calm. Upon the shore, she grasps the Chalice of Potions and channels its power in the name of the Lady, conjuring a vicious storm to send the coming assailants to a watery demise. When it is done, most of the fleet is consigned to oblivion. Yet despite it all, a sizeable force survives, continuing its approach to Bretonnia and intent on seeing the land burn.

As the Fay Enchantress travels between sacred groves, she draws to her side young children who harbour latent powers, destined to return to serve Bretonnia as Damsels. One such girl particularly favoured by the Lady of the Lake had gifted the Enchantress a most resplendent hand mirror, said to have inexplicable magical properties born of the child’s own power. Such is the artefact’s potency that the Enchantress always takes it to the battlefield whenever forced into violent confrontation. Yet now the power of Morgiana’s Mirror wanes, its power closely tied to the purity of the Bretonnian soil. The only way to restore the mirror to its full potency is to transmit her powers of warding across Carcassonne to help remove all signs of corruption festering across the land.

A piece of armour bearing the heraldry of a legendary warrior has been discovered during a holy quest, and is brought before King Louen. Agilulf was once a great Grail Knight who had slain thousands of the world’s foulest monsters by his sword, blinding his foes in combat with his armour’s wondrous sheen. No-one knows what became of him after his last quest, but years of the equipment’s disuse are evident in its dullness. The magical link between the armour's sheen and durability wanes, leaving it brittle – the only way to restore it is to employ a master craftsman to melt it down and reforge it back to its prior brilliance.

A great mist descends across Bretonnia that even the light of the sun cannot pierce. Beyond it, the distant shouting and smashing of Greenskin hordes, inciting panic across the land. Though many bravely fight back against their incursions, few dare enter the mist save for one elder warrior – a noble Questing Knight – rumoured to be stalking the gloom alone, pledging to purge its evil. The king and his retinue ride to the warrior’s aid, first heading to where he was last sighted. After days of searching, the hero's corpse is found with a journal containing the location of the evil’s source. A place that emanates with the chilling sound of a vast Orc warcamp…

Repanse has felt the Lady’s influence once again, ever guiding her towards the annihilation of the unholy evils of the world. Deep in the desert, beyond the Great Mortis Delta, priests of the dead have already started to ceremonially circumambulate the malevolent ebony symbol known as the Black Pyramid. Repanse regards the structure as no mere temple, but the very beating heart of the evil that blights these sand-strewn lands. The Tomb Kings’ purpose for it is unclear, but her gut instinct tells her that whatever the ritual being enacted, they must all be cut down.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Just off the coast of Repanse’s beloved home dukedom of Lyonesse, the Undead pirates of the sea gather and lurk. The most infamous eldritch admirals of the world have long been enticed to plunder the hoarded wealth of the Land of Chivalry, now consolidating their fleets to mount a massive invasion. There are two things the foul flotilla of creatures did not count on, however – the depth of Repanse’s unwavering piety, and her undeniable favour from the Lady, which shall surely propel her to victory once again!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Following in the footsteps of the old Questing Knight who previously wielded her mighty sword, Repanse journeys to a desert far from home. Like the Knight before her, she comes to aid an honourable throng of Dwarfs in their fight against unholy forces. Though they have managed to survive against the Undead hordes for generations – even amongst the hardships of the desert – word had been received that they are now in trouble. While tracking them she encounters an oasis, beside which grows a lily akin to the Fleur de Lys that grows abundantly in Bretonnia. A reassuring sign that even here, the Lady watches over Repanse and will smile upon her champion’s actions this day.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Finally, the beast-paths to the Heart of the Dark are revealed! Taurox had marauded mercilessly through the world, the promise of further gifts of Chaos fuelling his never-ending stampede. His Masters’ true goal, however, had always been to usher the Daemons of Chaos into the world, and only a pilgrimage of sacrifice and Ruin, ending at the Heart of the Dark, would make it so.\n\nIt appears others have made the journey also – some with different intentions – but with the final rite within his grasp the Brass Bull will not be denied the Gods’ favour!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The curses of man are many, and now they think to purge the forests of the warherds! Boris Todbringer, Elector Count of Middenland has been sending armies from Middenheim to rid the Drakwald of Gors, slaying bray-kin in vast numbers. He must be made to pay, but his city sits high on the Ulricsberg plateau, making a brute force attack futile. No... a more cunning approach will be needed if the Children of Chaos are to raze his city to ash and ruin. Knowing that the Elector Count is an honourable fool, Khazrak gives the order to spill Middenheimer blood in smaller attacks, using guerrilla tactics to draw him out. Predictably, Todbringer takes the bait.

This is Khazrak's time, for he embodies the primal force of the forest! He grows tired of rival Beastlord Graktar’s rule, self-proclaimed by his donning of a certain enchanted blackened chainmail. A lame animal should be put out of its misery, even if the deluded creature fails to realise it’s for the best. Having gained wind of Khazrak’s challenge, Graktar is camped near the mannish towns of Kelp and Koldust, gathering his loyal Gors to him, ready to fight back! Using his bestial cunning, the One-Eye sends forces to surround Graktar’s warherd, trapping him in place. The time to strike is now; Graktar is no match, and his Dark Mail will be claimed by the true Beastlord of the Drakwald!

It is not without reason that Malagor is depicted as the arch-foe of Sigmar in tales and wood carvings throughout the Empire. He is the Dark Omen, despiser of all gods in opposition to his Ruinous Masters. The Dark Gods themselves bless Malagor's brayherd, constantly whispering and muttering to him of the work still to do. They send the Dark Omen a vision of a burning temple in Grunberg... ruins of civilisation strewn across Averland... and finally, a smoking, festering carcass of a Griffon. All but the final act of defilement are fulfilled with ease, leaving Malagor with one final target. Upon the destruction of the Knights Griffon will the Crowfather’s foul fetishes be elevated to blasphemous icons of vilification!

Wherever the Shadowgave treads, a dark tide of ravening madness and mutagenic power corrupts and changes all those around him, whether friend or foe. Containing the essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal means, and even to Morghur himself. No, to harness this power requires rituals with totems made from laboriously obtained materials – Orc spines, Dwarfen skulls, and most burdensome of all, a stolen Waystone of the Asrai. Morghur’s travels had seen him cross paths with such items, thus he needs only to return to his lair to begin his foul ritual. The insidious Elves, however, have not taken kindly to his pilfering and are never far behind.

Taurox has recently been afflicted by yet another blood-soaked vision. While in a momentary trance he bears witness to tall, slender beings ripping still-beating hearts from the chests of victims dragged screaming in terror onto altars awash with blood, against a cacophony of manic drumming and shrill pipes. Coming to his senses, he realises the slender beings of his vision were Dark Elves, or more specifically Witch Elves, who once a year descend on the streets of their own cities in an unbridled celebration of violent murder of their own kin known as Death Night. With the knowledge of what his visions mean, Taurox’s bloodthirst is stronger than ever – he will traverse the Beastpaths to Naggaroth to take part in the bloodshed, where there will be no discerning the Elven murderers from their targets!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Realm of Chaos plays fast and loose with the concept of time... Once a devout Templar Priest of Sigmar, Archaon searched ancient texts for the means to destroy Chaos but was exposed to a terrible truth. Rejecting his former gods, he swore himself to the service of the Dark Masters instead. He had also discovered scrolls detailing several artefacts of power and a great warrior who used them to gain the blessing of [[i]]all[[/i]] the Ruinous Powers. Archaon vowed to become this man. Thus he must travel to a monolith in the Chaos Wastes raised to the glory of a Chaos Champion, where the twisted ground is littered with skulls from whence screams of malice arise –  “A challenger comes!”.

The earth groans before the might of Archaon. Having gained the favour of all the Chaos Gods, he stands on the brink of destiny. The Winds of Magic howl from the uttermost north where the gates between worlds strain and then burst asunder, admitting a single diabolical form. A Daemonic champion, a Lord of Change, comes to offer a final test to the man who would unite all of the forces of Chaos into an unholy horde bent on subjugating the entire mortal world.

Archaon has seen his own destiny, revealed to him in the heretical manuscripts of Necrodomo the Insane, who tore out his own eyes after having a vision of the destruction of the world at Archaon’s hands. And now, another vision howled to him by a Sorcerer under his thrall – of mountains twisted into fantastical shapes with gaping maws jutting out of cliff faces, bellowing to be fed the flesh of mortals. Before it, a bloodstained plain bordered by a forest of trees contorted into blackened skeletons, straining their branches towards warm-blooded creatures. In the tumultuous skies overhead, winged death swoops. A once-noble ruler of the skies, now corrupt with Change, a two-headed Dragon of Chaos trumpets its challenge.

As Archaon rides onward, many challenge him, but none can stand before his might. Sparing those who swear fealty, he slays the rest, claiming their warbands as his own by right of conquest. Now he receives word of another challenger, one who will not bend the knee. A mighty Chaos Sorcerer Lord defies him, daring to offer battle with a horde of warriors under his command. The sorcerer wields the wild energies of entropy itself, reshaping reality to better serve his whims and those of his dark masters. A word and a gesture from him can strip the flesh from a man’s bones, or cause a regiment of soldiers to burst into flames. Archaon makes his final preparations to pit the martial might of his troops against the raw magical power of his adversary.

Far to the north, deep in the roots of the mountains, Kholek Suneater had slept for generations. Hundreds of Northmen knelt in the pelting hail and snow, chanting sonorously as tribute after screaming tribute was hurled down into his cavernous lair, until a mighty crash of thunder and scintillating display of lightning brought Kholek forth. Yet since that day his rage had not quelled, for Starcrusher, his gigantic arcane hammer, had gone missing. Word now reaches him that it lies in the ruins of Todtheim, an ancient city being fought over by its winged Undead residents and Orcs. Kholek is the greater threat by far, and when he comes to reclaim Starcrusher, the thieves will know the true meaning of annihilation.

Prince Sigvald is not happy. The field of battle is his playground, where his dark father can revel in his son’s cruel deeds. But it is also a place of squalor, of mud, blood and ordure. In every battle, Sigvald is inconvenienced by the need to clean some vile taint from his otherwise spotless battle gear, be it dirt or the lifeblood of his latest victim. Serendipitously, Sigvald has located a Chaos Lord who dons a shining baroque armour of ensorcelled gold, forever untarnished by age or the tiniest fleck of dirt and surrounded by warm perfumed air. The Geld-Prince knows he must achieve this perfection in both form and function as he blesses the battlefield with new depths of cruelty.

Jealousy – an ugly word to some, sinful even. Yet what man or woman fortunate enough to behold the scion of Slaanesh can help but harbour a kernel of envy at his cruel perfection? Flanked by scores of devoted admirers wherever he goes, a callous and deadly Lord of battle, and spoiled by his indulgent adoptive father Slaanesh, the Geld-Prince’s every wildly excessive wish is made manifest. But such renown has its price. All devotees of Chaos are forever searching for more power and the chance to attract the eye of the Gods. Now a rival challenges Prince Sigvald the Magnificent, driven by envy and a lust for power, and with an army of hideous beasts repellent to the Geld-Prince.

A band of Norscan raiders have declared war upon Manann himself in the name of their Chaos Gods, slaughtering innocent creatures of the sea. The raiding parties are under orders from their Skjold chieftain, who claims that the Queen of Tides is his daughter who he’d thought dead. He had thrown Aranessa into the ocean as a baby, believing she would attract the ire of the Dark Gods due to the mutations she bore. The Skjold chieftain mobilised his fleet as soon as he learned that Aranessa was still alive, believing that by murdering as many sea creatures as possible, he could prove his rejection of Aranessa before the Gods. The Queen of Tides, favoured by Manann, will ensure both she and the Sea-God have their revenge!

A self-obsessed singer needs a doting audience, and Cylostra is technically still well overdue for a high-profile performance before the High Elves of Ulthuan. Many years ago, the Lamprey succumbed to a storm in the Eastern Straits of the Great Ocean during an important diplomatic voyage to take Cylostra to sing before the Phoenix King. A treaty of great import was reliant on his pleasure in her performance, for the Elves believe good art – music in particular – to be as valuable as gems and gold. It was an important engagement, so surely the High Elves will still be waiting for her?

The powerful species of Lizardmen known as the Slann are known to use many enchanted totems and trinkets of gold to serve their indecipherable purposes. The best chance for Luthor to find one for his own ends is to search the ruins of long-abandoned cities and towns of Lustria and beyond, where they were most likely to have left their mark. He hears of a hoard of gold recently stolen back from an expeditionary force in an unprecedented attack – a hoard likely of great importance to the Lizardmen due to the force used to take it back. Luthor can see his goal clearly now, his mind yearning to be repaired. He needs to gather his minions and attack these cold-blooded freaks!

Captain Roth, leader of the Grand Alliance, was known for being Noctilus’ one-time arch-rival, after one of Noctilus’ midnight raids led to the demise of Roth’s entire family. This led the anguished captain to lead a fleet directly to the Galleon’s Graveyard, a navigational feat only made possible with his magical moondial. Neither Noctilus or Roth were defeated outright in the immense sea battle that followed, but both suffered extensive casualties. The horrors Roth’s crew witnessed there pushed many to desert following the battle. During the confusion, his moondial was opportunistically stolen, ensuring that the graveyard could never easily be found again. Until now…

Khaine is pleased by the endless killing orchestrated by the Blood Queen. It is no secret though that the greatest of the Bloody-handed God's gifts has not yet been secured. It is time for Hellebron to gather her most vicious sisters and thralls, and occupy the Shrine of Khaine. Only then will the Amulet of Dark Fire ignite.

The twin weapons of the Blood Queen have severed one head too many. Their cruel steel has dulled after years of bloodletting, for the secrets of their endurance and renewal are jealously guarded by Morathi, First of the Hag Queens. It is she who also denies Crone Hellebron the gift of life eternal. The time has come for Hellebron to learn both rites... If it’s war the whore queen wants, it’s war she will get. In glorious, bloody battle, the Deathsword and the Cursed Blade will sing again. Then, at long last, the Murderess of Khaine will tear the secrets of eternal youth and beauty from her hated opposite.

Lokhir’s famed dual swords, the Red Blades, have slain many foes for the Corsair King. However, the power imbued within them, drawn from the Ind God Gilgadresh’s statue, is failing. The only way to restore the blades to their former state is to regularly gorge them with blood – but not just any blood, for only the blood of the most anguished victims will sate them. For Lokhir, Karond Kar is an obvious target of conquest for these ends – also known as ‘Slaver’s Gate’, it is home to many slaves living the final minutes, hours, or days of their pitiful lives as miserable drudges. The readily available blood of these thralls, downtrodden then sacrificed, shall be more than enough to slake the Red Blades once again!

Driven by an insatiable hatred, Malekith hungers for the vicious savagery of war. The High Elves, with their haughty and superior manner, are in dire need of reminding just how strong the Witch King of Naggaroth truly is. Their fear will be a delightful tonic indeed! Even were it not so, the methods of science and sorcery push him to battle regardless, for new runes decorate the metal encasing Malekith's burned and twisted flesh. It is said that only blood will activate their power, turning his metal prison into an even greater armour of unfathomable resistance. What better way then, to access such power, than to anoint the runed plates of meteoric iron in the blood of his most hated foes?

The Great Vortex is in flux! He who strikes fast enough might harness its immeasurable energies – and wrest the power of Chaos from the gods themselves. This is an opportunity the Witch King cannot refuse. After brutally coaxing the secrets of safe passage through the Vortex from Khaine's Death Hags, Malekith journeys far north, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness. This shrine of pure Chaos can imbue his ancient Circlet of Iron with enough might to subjugate even the Ruinous Powers. But the Dark Gods have foreseen his outrageous intent…

Vaul, Maker-God of the Elves, has long refused to honour Malekith’s masterful forging of the dread blade Destroyer. This snub can stand no longer. If god will not come to the Witch King, the Witch King will come to god – and present to him a blade slaked with Asur blood. Countless fall to the Destroyer on Ulthuan’s shores, but ahead lies the greatest of tests. On to Vaul’s Anvil, into the very heart of the volcano, and then an audience with the god. Of course, there will be guardians to first contend with…

The Witch King has gained and lost countless arcane artefacts over his long centuries of tyranny. Though Malekith rarely mourns these losses (all such trinkets are merely means to a greater end), he cannot abide another to possess them. Thus he pays rare attention when he discovers that his long-misplaced Supreme Spellshield is now in the taloned hands of the Cold Ones. To the depths of the Mosquito Swamps, then, where a Slann Mage-Priest will be made to part with Malekith’s lost artefact…

Malus feels the power of his Warpsword of Khaine waning. The hilt is cold, where once it radiated warmth like the hottest Dwarf furnace. The blade is dull, no longer cutting through steel as though it were butter, no longer guiding Malus' strikes with the deadly precision with which he was once gifted. The blade hungers for blood, and feeding it will be the only way to bring it back to its former power. Bloodshed cannot be avoided then – Malus must return to the Chaos Wastes and face the followers of Chaos in person. It is there, where he first took up the Warpsword of Khaine, that the ravenous blade will have its fill and, finally, fully renew its deadly power.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: My lady, the cult has determined the process for extracting a mighty amulet from the heart of the Petrified Forest. They require more helpers from the Dark Convent to proceed!

The bond between mother and son frays! The Witch King has banished Morathi from his sight, angered by some perceived slight. The Hag Sorceress churlishly casts aside her wicked spear, Heartrender, and its sister blade, the Darksword, incensed by the mere sight of these once-prized gifts from her child. Countless souls know torment as the Druchii Sorceress wages a campaign of sadistic terror across the land. Yet still the Witch King pays no heed. The absolute destruction of the High Elf colony of Arnheim, a stubborn canker on the Black Coast, would surely win back her son’s eternal love. Then, Morathi can once more take cruel pleasure in employing Heartrender and the Darksword as her chosen tools of torture.
Kharaidon demands sacrifice, a bloodletting to slake its thirst before it can again grant you its power!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description:
Word reaches you of a most peculiar thing: the upstart Imperials, no doubt in imitation of your own collection, have amassed quite the array of monstrous creatures in their capital of Altdorf. This ‘zoo’ – what an absurd word! – is said to contain some rather delectable specimens, including a fully-grown Dragon, the personal mount of the so-called Emperor of Men.

The very audacity of it! A human on a Dragon! Such a mockery cannot be left unanswered. It is your duty as Beastmaster to tear down the city walls and liberate this magnificent creature...

…and then use terrible and twisted magics to dominate it and force it to serve your will!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Rakarth's Black Ark returns from the tropical shores of Lustria, filled to the brim with all manner of monstrosities to add to the Beastmaster's collection. As it docks, an ominous fog creeps towards the port of Albion, the stirrings of magic engulfing the Ark in its heavy mist. Figures move in the dark, appearing and disappearing as the sound of chains being broken carries across the tension in the air. The Lizardmen, many report, led by the ancient Kroxigor Nakai, have come to free the Lustrian beasts. If Rakarth is to keep his treasures, then there is reptilian blood to be spilled, and the fury of rabid beasts to be unleashed. To the victor shall go the spoils of Lustria, and Rakarth is not one to let his prizes slip so easily from his grasp.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

An Orc Warboss has taken Dawi he had found imprisoned deep under Black Crag and all but forgotten by their jailer, Gorfang Rotgut. The Warboss stole away the Dwarf captives and, under enslavement, forced them to dig new passages within the Underway, secret to all but his own rabble of filthy Orcs. Belegar is outraged! He at once recognises the captive Dawi as kin – fine folk taken from Karak Azul in a raid years past. This is a fell deed that demands vengeance! However, Ironhammer knows it is not a grudge he can right on its own; King Kazador of Karak Azul still broods on this outrage and so must be informed at once. Belegar doesn't hesitate and sends his shield as his oath.

A group of Rangers make contact with the White Dwarf to relay a message – that none other than the greatest Brewmaster himself, Josef Bugman, is in need of the White Dwarf's aid. After Grombrindal makes the long journey to the legendary brewery, Bugman recounts to him a tale of woe and fell magicks that has all the hallmarks of the Ruinous Powers. It seems a Chaos Lord is loose in the Reikwald, performing fell rituals that corrupt Beastmen tribes to his will and saturate the Cloven Ones in Dark Magic, making them an even greater threat than normal. So far the umgi of Sigmar have proven no match for these corrupted warherds. It is time for the Dawi to take matters into their own hands.

A dread host of Chaos – one that has hounded the Norse Dwarfs – is deploying for a fight. They wish to spill Dawi blood upon the snow, no doubt in tribute to the vile God of rage and murder. However, the Dwarfs shall not lie meekly in the frost and ice – they are led by the White Dwarf, who has placed an oath upon his axe. Only when this legion of the damned is slaughtered will the many entwined runes upon Grombrindal's weapon burn with power again!

An Undead host has been discovered making its way into the roots of the mountains. The creatures were moving under a devious magical veil that left even Valaya blind to their whereabouts, so she tasked the White Dwarf with adding a new rune to Her cloak to pierce this deceit! The rune is now in place and the location of the Undead has been revealed. Although the cloak has been drained of its usual properties, they will no doubt return when this grudge has been settled! The White Dwarf must purge this Undead incursion into the Karaz Ankor at once!

Several Dwarfholds fall under attack from a particularly belligerent Waaagh!, and the Dawi feel hard-pressed. The White Dwarf appears at the forefront of such struggles, as he has done throughout history. His Rune Helm – forged in the glorious forges of Zhufbar – glows, replenishing lost Dwarfen courage, a commodity that is rarely lacking in the first place, of course. With the help of none other than Gotrek Gurnisson, the Waaagh! finds itself isolated by Grombrindal’s throng, unable to sustain itself. Grombrindal lures the beleaguered Orcs to a battlefield of his choosing, using a simple bait and switch manoeuvre with volunteers from Karak Azul. And so it is that Rune Helm will glow bright once more, instilling Dwarfs with heart and courage at Thundering Falls!

At long last, the location of the Lost Vault is revealed! After so long scouring the land, uncovering fragments of Relics once lost to the ages, the end is ultimately in sight. With the powerful Artefacts of the Ancestors in his possession, the path to the vault is revealed to Thorek, as the one finally worthy of claiming its prize. No Skaven pest shall stand in his way now, try as they might!

For such a long time has Thorek smashed his way through the dense jungles of Lustria that the powerful runes embedded within his mighty hammer have slowly begun to fade. For truly powerful replacement runes to be forged, however, they must be made in the old way, with ancient, powerful reagents. And there is one clear way to get them: hunt down the biggest, meanest creature in all of Lustria! Thorek's expedition crashes eagerly through the jungle in pursuit of the monstrous creature they call "The Big One", knowing that the beast's inflated bladder will make a fine bellows, and any runes quenched in its antediluvian blood will add mettle to the iron of Klad Brakak. The party finally closes in for the kill, yet as triumph beckons, something else stirs within the jungle.

These strange new lands teem with unfamiliar foes, yet Thorek remains undaunted. Rushing to judgement in a fit of panic is the purview of the inexperienced fool. Instead, the Runelord will assess the threat first-hand. When the dangers of this world prove themselves deadly enough to warrant Thorek’s intervention, only then will he finally don his mighty Rune Armour of War and be ready to stand against them.

An emissary from Kraka Drak brings word that Troll Country, a malign wilderness in south-eastern Norsca, has seen a steady rise in the numbers of hideous creatures stalking its ice-wracked forests and tundra. Countless numbers of Trolls and Giants, displaced by the increased competition for food and territory, are a threat to Kraka Drak, whilst others encroach into the World's Edge Mountains and other civilised lands. It is time for a cull, and whenever there is a foul monster in need of vanquishing, there you will find the Slayers: death-sworn followers of the Slayer Cult, and therefore ever in search of the most dangerous adversaries upon which to unleash their mighty axe-craft.

Recent test flights of new Gyrocopters have been fruitful, revealing a large gathering of Greenskins around a location in the Badlands known as the Pillar of Bone. The High King's scout reports the presence of numerous Orc and Goblin warriors engaged in some sort of ritual activity which appears to be centred around several Shamans. Given that the Pillar of Bone is known to be a nexus of arcane power, Thorgrim is determined to disrupt the ritual and orders the battle horns sounded.

A dark cloud has descended over Sylvania, and in the midst of its gloom Thorgrim’s scouts stumble upon several sacked caravans, surrounded with the broken detritus of a desperate fight. Though there are no corpses, a freezing dread pervades the area. Shambling figures emerge from the fog – the dead walk Sylvania’s benighted land once more, bands of the Undead lurching northwards toward the vile fog-enshrouded marshes of Hel Fenn! Sprinkling sand on the fresh ink with which he has recorded all of this, Thorgrim slams shut the Book of Grudges, ordering the horns to be sounded and the throng armed. Evil stalks Sylvania and the axes of the Dwarfs will oppose it, and as of old, they will face it at Hel Fenn.

There are dire tidings from the south. Rangers report that a brutal Orc Warboss has arisen and that hordes of Greenskins are flocking to fight under his leadership. A mighty Waaagh! is forming and seems to be heading north toward the gateway to the Empire’s southern border: the fabled Black Fire Pass. This route through the mountains has witnessed countless titanic struggles over the centuries, many of them pivotal to the survival of the Old World, where Dwarfs and men stood together to hold back disaster, and will again.

In his last battle, a reverie came upon Ungrim again. Whilst in the midst of slaying, he felt a discordant note amongst the otherwise perfect rhythm of battle. The Guild’s council suspect that in revealing its song to Ungrim, his axe was attempting to make itself whole once more, a feat only possible in a high place closer to the Ancestor Gods, and against an adversary of great skill in battlecraft. Thus, the Slayer King must march upon a great Ruinous host entrenched in the mountains beneath the dread banner of a mighty Lord of Chaos. As the throng travels north, the symphony rises to a crescendo and Ungrim’s axe pulses in his hands…

A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one, with well over half detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but the dim-witted Greenskins will surely take the bait.

Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister, black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King must act to protect his people. Ungrim's throng tracks the Undead armies down to an entrance to a great cave, where a pale figure in a black cloak stands with arms upraised, a pale nimbus of liche-light surrounding him. Eerie words of summoning drift upon the chill wind. Though the Vampire Lord seems absorbed with his rite, the dead who serve him are not.

A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late. Tombs have been desecrated and libraries have been broken into. The Emperor's spies report that the intrusions are connected to a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. Gelt's investigations eventually lead him to a location in distant Estalia. As he leads his men beneath a rough stone lintel of an ancient barrow mound, shadows crowd in upon him, dimming even the light emanating from his raised staff. Ominous sounds echo in the gloom – bone on stone, pitted blade on rusted scabbard. It seems that the loyalty of this buried king's ancient retainers remains firm even in death.

Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets, and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation – the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. His research reveals the process of transmutation to be dangerously unpredictable, but recent first-hand experiences of the forces involved gives him an insight into an artefact that may reduce the risk. Further investigation leads him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity...

Every eight years, a Wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. The competition even to become a candidate is white hot. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. After procuring a valuable lodestone at the southern tip of the World’s Edge Mountains, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that it will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas.

Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. The Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr that portend doom for the Empire. Triangulating the source of the threat, it is revealed that a great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black Mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. Whilst messengers are dispatched to alert the Dwarfs, Karl Franz prepares to face the Greenskin onslaught, aware that this is the greatest test that he has yet faced in his reign as Emperor.

With a massive Norscan force en route to Nordland's shores, the Emperor must show that his reign is one of military strength; that none should doubt the power of the Emperor. He must drive the Norscan army back into the Sea of Claws!

The vaults deep below the palace of Altdorf have been breached and the powerful Silver Seal artefact stolen! Wards that should not open for anyone but the Grand Theogonist or the Emperor have been cracked – this is no mundane thief. A mysterious woman was seen fleeing to the east of Altdorf upon a steed of bone with a fell green glow about it, indicating she must be an agent of the Undead. Thus the hunt is directed to the historical centre of Undead activity in the area: Sylvania. After days spent tracking the Vampiress (for such she seems to be), she is brought to bay near a shrine of ill omen, where she raises an army of corpses with which to defend herself.

The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon – a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself – went missing. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity, but Mannfred von Carstein's Undead hordes have somehow unearthed the Jade Griffon first, Sigmar damn them! Word soon reaches Volkmar that his Witch Hunter has picked up the trail and has divined that they are heading for Hel Fenn...

The office of the Grand Theogonist has always attracted enemies, from both within and without. Recently, wary villagers in Reikland have spoken of priests of the Wolf God, Ulric, besmirching Volkmar's name. Tensions between the cults of Sigmar and Ulric are often fraught, but cordial. However, ever since Volkmar and his Arch Lectors voted against the Ar-Ulric's candidate in the election for Emperor, relations have been strained. Now, the Staff of Command – the symbol of the Grand Theogonist's office – has been reluctantly taken and locked away by the Holy Order of Sigmar, such is the feeling stoked against Volkmar. The Grand Theogonist is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters must be answered.

Markus Wulfhart’s chosen path is one of hardship and protection. He fights the difficult battles so that the people of the Empire might know safety and peace. Following the recent sacking of several New World colonies and the murder of countless innocents at the hands of the Lizard-beasts, the Huntsmarshal sets out to hunt down the perpetrators in the name of the slain. With his men champing at the bit to right the wrongs perpetrated against their kin, the expedition is soon in full march, full of vim and vigour and a desire to see the Lizardmen pay a heavy price for their crimes. Markus and his band will see this vile threat well and truly dealt with once and for all!

As Azhag's mob picks over the corpse-strewn scene of their latest victory, his Shaman suddenly goes rigid, his eyes bulging and glassy as he enters another trance. In a dreamy voice he says that Gork an' Mork are pleased that Azhag has "stopped muckin' about and got stuck in ta da fightin'". They'll overlook his wearing of the humie Necromancer's crown for now. The Shaman declares that Azhag just needs one final bloodbath, one more bout of carnage, and the Great Green will enter his armour and make it properly 'Ard! Down in Bretonnia, those stoopid humies prance about on their ponies on the burial mound of Grudsnik. No wonder the gods ain't 'appy, dat's 'allowed ground. Go give 'em a big slap...

The Greenskin tribes in the far north fight choppa-and-claw over the few spoils offered by the hostile, barren lands. But it was there that Azhag found his ancient crown, steeped in Dark Magic. Ever since, the crown has provided him with dark powers and useful, if occasionally confusing, advice, allowing Azhag to seize control of the mighty fortress of Red Eye Mountain. Now the crown whispers for further power, for it is missing a piece that was left behind when Azhag first snatched the crown from the underground ruins of the ancient ‘umie city of Todtheim. The Chaos Wastes are a weird and dangerous place, but the faint whispering voice of ancient evil within Azhag’s head grows ever louder. The crown yearns to be whole again!

Azhag really wants to go south. Not all that unusual for an Orc brought up in Troll Country, after all, the squishiest humies and shiniest loot is in the Empire. But Azhag's top Bosses know, that's not why he wants to go south – something else is pushing him to go that way. He is prone to bouts of staring into space or arguing with his magical crown, but when he snaps out of this he is the old Azhag, intent on "fightin' and lootin'". In the Southern Badlands, the primitive Savage Orcs gather to hinder Azhag’s horde. The Slaughterer needs to dominate these tribes, so forces the Savage Orcs, led by some git called ‘Slagga’, to acknowledge him!

For his corpulent majesty and his ravenous Broken Axe tribe, Tor Yvresse is not just another place to go for a good fight. When lolling about following his grand meals, Grom would frequently daydream and relive the joyful furor of defacing the city’s slender columns and shiny buildings, polluting the glistening fountains with blood and muck, and ripping the heads and limbs off the great statues of pointy-‘eads (and real pointy-‘eads too). To the Goblin King, Tor Yvresse represents the pinnacle of all the Greenskins’ ambitions for conquest and ruination – truly, “da biggest prize”.\n\nThe first time around, the prophecies of the Shaman ol’ Blacktoof had fortuitously landed Grom right on Yvresse’s shores, but this time it had been a much less easy feat. Finally, however, he is strong enough to penetrate the bothersome mists floating around the place. It is time to mobilise his Waaagh! once more; this time, Grom will see Tor Yvresse’s destruction through to the end!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: A Goblin scout brings word that an unusual number of Gyrocopters had been seen travelling back and forth between various Dwarf Holds and the northerly World's Edge Mountains. Something is clearly brewing. Anything that might bring the stunties out from behind the doors of their mountain fastnesses has got to be good news. It turns out that a force of Chaos Warriors is approaching High Pass in the northern World's Edge Mountains. They are clearly returning north from the Dark Lands where they are known to trade with the wicked Chaos Dwarfs for items of power, angering the other stunties. With the scent of battle in his nostrils, Grimgor marches over the reporting scout, heading north.

Another Orc Warboss was said to have found a powerful axe and headed north in search of some humies to try it out on, but the silly git met a powerful Empire force at Black Fire Pass and was defeated. Presumably, the magic choppa remains with his corpse. All indications are that the humies remain in the pass, preparing to march back up north, but they might be persuaded to stay long enough for Grimgor to have a crack at them. The Black Orc Warboss orders his mob to march on the pass, and to announce their approach by burning everything en route. The humie scum will have no choice but to stay and face a far deadlier threat than that 'pretenda' that now lies rotting in the pass!

After feeling less “murdery” than usual, Grom found out that a rival called Git Guzzler falsely rumoured to be a contender to his vast size had been accused of stealing his favourite chopper, Elf-Biter. Grom swiftly sought him out and, disappointed at the meek appearance of his adversary, demanded the return of his axe so he could promptly chop the git to bits with it for his impudent lies and thievery. The Night Goblin Warboss denied all knowledge of the theft, however, claiming that he was the victim of a slanderous set-up. His denials were convincing, but Grom had already gone to the effort of getting the boyz together and marching them over there, so Git Guzzler was going to get guzzled nonetheless.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Grom's banner-carrier, Niblet, seems out of sorts. His once-vigorous waving has become tired and listless, failing to inspire the boyz as it once did. If it were any other Goblin, they would find themselves crushed beneath Grom's rump as punishment – but Niblet had notably survived such an ordeal before, and has Grom's favour as a result.\n\nGrom decides instead to look for a way to restore Niblet's enthusiasm. And there's one thing that will raise the spirits of any Greenskin: a Waaagh!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Lately, the diminutive Goblin boss Skarsnik couldn’t help but brood – how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? This gives the Warlord an idea. He takes a wicked-lookin' halberd from his pile of shiny stuff which may have belonged to a humie wizard or one of them long-eared gits, planning to smear the new 'prodder' in the spent blood of stunties. News of a Dwarf treasure-seeking expedition quickly reaches him and a wicked plan begins to form within the chief gobbo’s mind.

Word has reached the Savage Orc Shaman that some gobbo in the south is claiming to be the new prophet, denouncing Wurrzag as an "air-a-tick" and "pretenda"! Now that is fightin’ talk! The gobbo even sends one of his followers to slay Wurzzag, but you don’t get to be Mork and Gork’s best mate if you could be so easily shiv'd! Wurrzag foils the attack with ease, but it turns out the would-be killer was merely a diversion! While the Shaman was dealing with the assassin, his mask – an important part of his mantle as da Great Green Prophet – is stolen. It is time to put an end to this gobbo’s sacrilege, get the mask back and show the git who the real Prophet of the Waaagh! is.

The crooked moon has appeared in the sky for many nights, its baleful grin seen clearly by the tribe. Is it Gork or Mork’s face in the green moon? Depends which tribe you ask. Some boyz want to query Wurrzag about it, but none dare enter his hovel. Da Prophet finally emerges from his ramshackle hut, revealing they must go to Black Fire Pass, where a defensive force of the Empire intends to trap them. Wurrzag is unperturbed, even when his spies inform him that a vanguard of the Empire's heroes have sworn to bring the Savage Orc Shaman’s head directly to Karl Franz. Wurrzag smiles his most crooked grin. Once they are dead, his staff of bone will be imbued with Mork’s breath. He knows this; he has already seen it!

Wurrzag is fond of his Squiggly Beast, in so much as an Orc can be affectionate towards anything. The beast was once a rival Shaman until magical energy arched from Wurrzag’s eyes and instantly transformed him into the Squiggly Beast that has been Da Prophet’s companion ever since. And so when Wurrzag woke from a deep trance to find the Squiggly Beast had gone missing, he was not at all pleased. It had been stolen by a Goblin Warboss known as Gashtoof, who is feeding stolen Squigs mushrooms that grow upon "glowy green rock", causing them to grow in size and become even more vicious! The Savage Orc Shaman orders his horde to move on Gashtooth’s forces – he wants his Squiggly Beast back!

Grimnir the Fearless is the patron of warriors. These exotic Beard Rings masterfully crafted in his name once belonged to one of his deadliest Slayer Clerics but have long been lost. Should they be recovered, the Slayers of the Brotherhood of Grimnir will be left with only the reason for their oaths of which to feel ashamed.

Grungni, the mighty Allfather of the Dawi, taught our Ancestors the very skills that have assured our survival for centuries. This pick is a holy relic crafted in his honour by the oldest of the Dawi, and the Longbeards will not be appeased until it is recovered.

Thungni’s Tongs were utilised by some of the first Runesmiths under his tutelage, serving them well in crafting the most potent rune-weapons ever made. These powerful armaments were crucial in many of the great victories of our kin – such weapons could be forged again, but not without the tongs that gave them their power, long lost in the mists of time.

A great stain is upon the land. Avelorn suffers, and so the light within the Shieldstone of Isha dims. For the first time in the gods' memory, the Druchii – the lost kin – have taken the Phoenix Gate. Finubar and Tyrion are rightly distracted by the momentous events of the Vortex, but Alarielle has never been a queen that merely perches upon a throne. She will act – the Phoenix Gate will return to Asur hands!

Alarielle’s heart is broken, for the Star of Avelorn – the jewel in the Everqueen’s crown – has succumbed to corruption, cursed by a once-loyal Handmaiden fallen into the wicked thrall of the Druchii Hag Hellebron. Catastrophe brews as Norscan brutes assault Ulthuan’s borders, drawn to the stone’s newly ruinous call! Desperate, Alarielle orders a Norscan raider captured and brought before her. None can tell falsehood in her presence, so when the savage speaks of ritual that can lift the curse, he is believed. Of course, truth can live within treachery. As wise on the battlefield as she is in her silken court, Alarielle knows full well this 'confession' is a trap set by the Dark Powers. But two can play at that game…

The only arrows fit for the Moonbow are those fletched with feathers soaked in Druchii blood. This is a task Alith Anar accepts with grim enthusiasm. The Dark Elves fear the Shadow King and the warriors of Nagarythe with good reason, but a reminder is always useful to sustain the legend. 

Such is the terror in the hearts of the Witch King’s legions that countless Druchii outposts are sacked and countless Moonbow feathers drenched in blood before they finally strike back. The Dark Elves arrange a battle any fool could see they would lose – the most obvious of snares. 

 Anar is undeterred, for his foes will soon learn that it is impossible to a trap a shadow.

With the Druchii holding most of Nagarythe, including the Shrine of Khaine, the king's campaign of vengeance is at risk. Anar must drive the enemy from his homeland and not let any being close to Widowmaker.

Brandishing the mighty blade known as Fangsword, an ancient relic of his ancestors, Eltharion repelled the last great Greenskin siege of Tor Yvresse, beheading the rotten but influential Orc Shaman known as Blacktoof and thus scattering the invaders. It has been many years since its time of glory, however, so if Eltharion is to wield the full power of his heirloom, he will have to show that he still has the fortitude to annihilate the Greenskin menace wherever he may find it.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Helm of Yvresse is the symbol of Eltharion's position as Warden. For its true power to be wielded, however, the entirety of Yvresse must be made secure. To achieve this, all its lands should be brought under his banner.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: A lone rider, bloodied and exhausted, has appeared at the gates of Tor Yvresse – a Loremaster and member of the secretive Keepers of the Stones, whose task it is to maintain the Waystones of Ulthuan. Before collapsing, he reveals the dire news that the foul forces of Chaos have somehow discovered the hidden Waystones and are set upon destroying them. The destruction of the Waystones would threaten not just the power of the Eltharion’s Talisman of Hoeth, the source of his magical abilities, but also the very fabric of reality. With the enemy’s next destination determined, Eltharion sets out to intercept them at the next Waystone being targeted, the Winds growing ever stronger as he draws close…
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description:
The inevitable is coming to pass – Grom the Paunch approaches!

Despite Eltharion’s past failings in eliminating the threat of the Greenskins from the world, he had persisted in his pre-emptive strikes against them. All the while, he worked tirelessly to bolster Tor Yvresse’s defences in any way he could, using Athel Tamarha's facilities to gain information and train special warriors that may prove crucial in the city’s defence. He simply could not sit idly by as the great green tide of war-crazed Orcs and Goblins swelled ever bigger out in the wider world as he knew it always would. But his efforts outside Tor Yvresse’s walls had not been enough, and it remains to be seen whether his efforts within them will be.

The Goblin King’s first invasion had easily overwhelmed the city’s defences to cause immense suffering to its inhabitants that still haunt them today. The destruction left in his wake had left the once-great city a soulless, hollow shell of the great metropolis it once was. Now he returns and wants nothing but an orgy of destruction in Tor Yvresse. Truly, individuals like Grom are a blight on civilisation who must not only be defeated, but utterly destroyed to end their grandiose ambitions.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

All the while, he worked tirelessly to bolster Tor Yvresse’s defences in any way he could, using Athel Tamarha's facilities to gain information and train special warriors that may prove crucial in the city’s defence.
