The destruction left in his wake had left the once-great city a soulless, hollow shell of the great metropolis it once was. Now he returns and wants nothing but an orgy of destruction in Tor Yvresse. Truly, individuals like Grom are a blight on civilisation who must not only be defeated, but utterly destroyed to end their grandiose ambitions.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: A Vampire of an ancient order known as the Blood Dragons has come into possession of an important artefact: the lost gauntlet of Caledor the Conqueror. Like his sire Abhorash, the Undead creature wants to overcome his cursed bloodthirst by drinking the blood of Dragons. Knowing the gauntlet’s significance, the fiend had obtained it as a means to get the Dragon Prince’s attention.\n\nThe Vampire offers to fight Imrik in honourable battle. Should Imrik win, it will willingly give up the gauntlet. If he loses, then the Blood Dragon will feed upon Imrik’s Dragons, as well as the Dragon Prince himself. Though it sounds much more like a threat than an offer, Imrik knows he has no choice in this matter, for the honour of his ancestors compels him to accept the challenge…
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Woven amongst the High Loremaster’s turbulent dreams is a vision to chill the blood of any faithful Asur – the Druchii Witch King stalks through Ulthuan once more. This dire warning from Lileath cannot be ignored. Teclis intuits that Malekith’s target is the shrine of Vaul, the Maker-God, which bodes ill for all Ulthuan. Raising a host, Teclis rides to Vaul’s Anvil, Caledor’s mightiest volcano. The Winds are on his side, and he arrives before Malekith’s siege begins. He unsheathes his sword – a weapon fashioned by Vaul himself. Where lately its steel had turn cold and dim, now it glows with the power of the Maker-God’s blessing. This is the battle the ancient blade was forged for…

The War Crown of Saphery has been stolen! Loremaster Teclis had sent for the sacred circlet to aid his bitter campaign in distant Lustria, but the Great Eagles who bore it from Ulthuan have vanished during their long journey across the Great Ocean. Invoking the ritual of Isha, the Loremaster is shown that the eagles were brought down over the Spine of Sotek. Isha’s light guides Teclis and his host to a bone-strewn cavern in the north of mountain chain. On entering the cave, the High Elves are met by a marrow-freezing screech. Towering over the ravaged carcasses of two Great Eagles is the hunter that tore them from the sky – a gargantuan Undead bat. And it is not alone. Deep in darkness, row upon row of malevolent eyes glint...

Tyrion rides forth, bringing ruin upon the trespassing Druchii in skirmish after bitter skirmish. Though his resolve never weakens, alas his fabled Dragon Armour of Aenarion does. A lucky strike, perhaps? Or perhaps this was the Witch King’s intent? In any event, the armour must be taken to Vaul’s Anvil, the place of its ancient forging, for repair. The smiths of the great volcano have barely begun their work when the battle horn is sounded. The Druchii legions have followed Tyrion to Vaul’s shrine, believing him trapped, helpless – and armourless. Tyrion prepares his host for war; though he is bereft of his usual protection, he will face the hated foe without fear.

My liege, as you are all too aware, without the fortress gates in the north of Ulthuan, the Druchii would have scoured the Inner Kingdoms long ago, hollowing out our homeland. And now the Phoenix Gate comes under sustained attack. Our Dark Elf-kin hope the failing Vortex will keep us distracted long enough for them to breach it, but Avelorn lies beyond and the Everqueen herself may be put in harm's reach. She and the Inner Kingdoms must be protected – the Fortress Gate has to hold!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Tyrion’s legend wanes upon poison rumour that his prowess is an illusion and due only to Sunfang, the enchanted blade he took as his own. Tyrion could ignore such bunkum, but pride prevents it. The crusade that follows is bloody and feverish, but in its wake, none can contest his skill. Back in court, the conniving princes behind the feigned scandal share wicked smiles, for Tyrion has played into their hands. The conspiring courtiers convince the mages of Hoeth that there is only one explanation for his recent aggression – he is a puppet of the Druchii. With remorse, the Loremasters array against him. The Defender of Ulthuan regrets taking arms against fellow Asur, but the scheming princes will pay the blood price for their envy.

Ikit Claw understands very well that direct confrontation with the Lizardmen is not viable, but wiping those tiresome toads from the face of the world always remains a priority. In an effort to weaken them before drawing them into battle, he had set into motion a plan to corrupt their 'blessed' spawning pools by using a Warpstone Tractor Beam to blast the Chaos Moon, raining down fragments and supplying him with bountiful deposits of Warpstone to fuel further experiments. Irritatingly, the ever-watchful Slann Astromancers spotted the falling Warpstone on Ikit’s approach so are fully battle-ready, with additional Lizardmen reinforcements already on their way. Collecting some of the pure, fallen Warpstone from the field, Ikit repairs his deadly Warp-lightning thrower, Storm Daemon, and steels himself for the fray.

Skarbrand's patience, such as it is, is wearing thin. The plan was to await the encroaching Nurgle horde and then for the three Khornate forces to slaughter them in glorious carnage before the Brazen Altar. Plans! What weakness! The farmer plans for the harvest. The maiden plans her wedding. Skarbrand does not scheme! What use plans when there is rage and slaughter? The Wrathful Reaper clashes his axes together and glares at the Bloodthirsters in command of the other Khornate forces. This is their blasphemous folly, this planning and waiting. If Nurgle won't oblige, then Khorne will yet have his due. Blood for the Blood God!

This famous armour, said to have been bathed in the breath of the Bear God, has been claimed by Boris Ursus, yet remains inert. The patriarchs of Ursun's Cult say that to rouse the armour's blessed power its true owner must wear it while defending the Motherland from its many enemies and securing the nation's borders from any who would see its populace harmed.\n\nAs the Red Tzar stands fearless and resolute against Kislev's foes, then surely it cannot be long before the Armour of Ursun will prove its quality and the folk of the Motherland will find succour and safety in the wake of Boris Bokha's wrath!

Carved from Norscan glaciers, and said to hold a permanent hoarfrost about its form that can cut flesh and bone better than Elven steel, the Shard Blade is a deadly polearm once wielded by the Red Tzar. It was recovered along with Boris Ursus, who was found in the ice and saved by the Motherland herself. However, the Shard Blade's latent power seems to have been affected by the Tzar's enforced hibernation. The patriarchs of the Great Orthodoxy, have studied the weapon and declared that its might will return once Radii Bokha has regained the power, influence and love of his people that he had before the fall at the River Lynsk.

Tzeentch seeks to weaken Kislev by strengthening the affinity between crystal and ice, thus creating a link between his realm and the Motherland. To do this, he requires the Crystal Cloak. In the confusion of Boris’ death, agents of the Changer stole the Crystal Cloak from the Bokha Palace and now it resides in the centre of the Fractal Maze – a great Tzeentchian labyrinth structured to unravel the cloak and so reveal its power.\n\nSoon after her coronation, Katarin sent her own spies to locate the cloak. Their intelligence has led the Ice Queen to the Fractal Maze, and a reckoning with the thieves.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Frost Fang was forged during the reign of Miska. As the blade was hammered into shape, Ice Witches cooled it with their magic, imbuing the blade with magical properties. While the sword has been held in the Bokha arsenal for generations, it is said the true power of the blade can only be invoked when used by a Khan-Queen. Now that Katarin has ascended to the throne, ready and eager to wield it in battle, it is surely but a matter of time before the Frost Fang's true power stirs?\n\nThe Ice Queen can awaken the blade by dominating her ancestral lands just as the first Khan-Queen did long ago.

Kostaltyn tours outlying Kislev provinces. Vast congregations of the simple folk turn out to witness the blessings, the Supreme Patriarch's fiery rhetoric filling their hearts with a rekindled determination to protect the Motherland at all costs. But this increased defiance coupled with the remote and therefore sparsely-defended locations makes these ceremonies an attractive target for Kislev's enemies.\n\nIn a coastal village, north of Erengrad, the peasants listen to the words of the Supreme Patriarch as he harangues their weakness and ingratitude, urging them to set aside their own petty concerns and join his crusade against the spreading influence of the Dark Powers in the Tzarina's Ice Court. Out at sea, a storm gathers, the clouds rolling toward the shore. Under their cover, dark shapes move. The Dark Elves have come, eager to slaughter and fill their holds with slaves from amongst the seemingly helpless peasantry. Above even the rising thunder, the shrieking voice of the Supreme Patriarch calls the congregation to give up their lives in defence of the Motherland. These invaders will be thrown back into the waves from whence they came!

When a summons comes from Mazdamundi, the oldest and most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, even mighty Kroq-Gar is duty-bound to answer. The ruler of Hexoatl lately questions the ancient Saurus’ adherence to The Great Plan, and demands a brutal demonstration of loyalty. Warm-blooded Elves infect Lustria, and even now interfere with the Fallen Gates, stellar portal of the Old Ones. Who knows what blasphemies their witless tinkering might summon forth? The trespassing Asur must be met with claw and fang, and Kroq-Gar must faithfully serve Mazdamundi’s singular interpretation of The Great Plan – that lesser beings deserve only extermination.

Since the forked-tongue comet was seen in the heavens, the power of Kroq-Gar’s Revered Spear of Tlanxla has waned. This ancient Old One weapon must be restored to its former glory, no matter the cost. Soon enough, the spear is bathed in the blood of untold foes, and the Last Defender is duly rewarded with a waking vision. Within the distant Well of Time, Tlanxla reaches though the barrier of eons, ready to touch his spear and reignite its faded flame. But others have heard the call of time’s sundering. Dark Elf invaders, curse their warm hearts, surround the Well, thirsty to harness its boundless temporal power. They must be annihilated, so that the Spear may be reborn.

Lokhir Fellheart's infamous helm has gained a tarnish, and so – some loose-tongued sailors say – does the Krakenlord lose his power! After a mystery that spans the Great Ocean, Fellheart learns that a curse has been placed upon the Helm of the Kraken and the only way to lift it is to slay the caster of this abominable hex. Lokhir returns to his base of operations, from which he can scry his foe's whereabouts.

The legend of the Bloodbeast is true! The bull-headed fiend of brass rampages at the head of a mile-long column of armoured Minotaurs. His course has been plotted – you must travel ahead of him to the foul place referred to as the Heart of the Dark. Approach with caution, for he possesses Chaos-gifted strength, but remember there is little difference between him and all the Daemons you have vanquished before. Use the element of surprise that has served you so well and destroy him!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Once again, the time has come for the Great White Lizard to rid the sacred jungles of Lustria of those degenerate elements that are not part of the Old Ones' Great Plan. Itza is currently under siege from Luthor Harkon's Undead pirate crews and his army of vermin mercenaries – truly the foulest examples of the exceptionally foul Skaven race that the Great White Lizard has ever set eyes upon! As is to be expected from a hardened seaborne pirate, Harkon's force is strong in artillery and has already created several breaches in Itza's ancient walls. Now, Gor-Rok's only option is to prepare for the inevitable assault and trust that Nakai the Wanderer will arrive in time to lift the siege!

Lord Mazdamundi, greatest of Mage-Priests, senses that the Great Plan is failing. The certain cause is the vile proliferation of warmbloods within his realm. There must come a purge! Yet in this he is thwarted, for since his awakening he is without his fabled Cobra Mace. The semi-sentient weapon of legend was long ago left to regain its fading power from the sacred rocks of the Isle of the Crimson Skull. For the purge to proceed, it must be reclaimed forthwith. Yet darker news awaits. Accursed Skaven swarm across the hallowed isle, covetous of its sorcerous stones. This outrage must be repaid – and only absolute extinction will suffice.

Lord Mazdamundi scours ancient texts for guidance on how the Great Plan might be served, and learns that Chotec, the Old One who first warmed this world, possessed a star-hot rage akin to his own. A bond shared across time! Perhaps invoking the Ritual of Ferocity could summon the Sun-Lord’s essence, and imbue it within the City of the Sun. The chants begin – and so too do the sacrifices. Chotec’s radiance shall surely arise from the Fallen Gates of Hexoatl, the Old Ones’ cosmic bridge to this realm. The Ruinous Powers cannot permit the wisdom of their ancient enemy to return, however, and send the savage slaves of Chaos to avert it. Mazdamundi must now make his stand – or betray the Great Plan.

Nakai the Wanderer is encamped in the jungle when his Skink attendants bring news of a disaster threatening the very beating heart of Lustria. That seemingly-irrepressible, utterly insane Vampire Admiral, Luthor Harkon, leader of the Zombie Pirates, is besieging Itza with a full assault on its outer walls. Always plotting, always scheming – like every last one of their nasty little race – his experienced Skaven mercenary contingent are assisting his efforts, using all the perfidious tricks at their disposal. Nakai knows all too well that if the First City is to be preserved – if the Old Ones' Great Plan is to remain undiverted – then swift, direct action is required, without further delay!

The all-knowing, seemingly ever-living Slann have revealed the location of several ancient structures, in locations right across the World Pond, which prevent the forces of Chaos from spilling out into our dimension and marauding across the Old and New Worlds. But it has also come to light that one such 'shard' was now under direct threat from the very faction it was designed to repel. If just a single one falls, the bonds which hold back Chaos would be broken, and all hell would undoubtedly break loose. Nakai’s scouting party reports that the Chaos army have brought their Norscan puppets along for the fray too, but they will be mere fodder for his lightning-fast talons – he will strike fast and weaken their resolve.

Oxyotl recently sensed a growing taint of Chaos on the maniacal Northmen, far greater than the sickness they typically exude. Upon investigation, he learnt of a Chaos-saturated artefact being passed through the Norscan tribes, and no doubt the source of the heightened taint he had detected. The relic originated from a group of Dark Elf slave traders of northernmost Naggaroth, a place of fell magic in close proximity to the Chaos Wastes. Using his mysterious senses, Oxyotl must travel ahead of the Chaos-worshipping Norscans returning to the Dark Elf trading post where the original transaction was made, where an ambush shall be set to bring about the end of this most recent infection of Chaos once and for all.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Prophet has enjoyed many victories over the Skaven, and with each pathetic ratman slaughtered and crushed, Sotek’s worldly power grows stronger and his following – the Cult of Sotek – grows greater. With Sotek’s arrival finally at hand, Tehenhauin lays an elaborate trap for the Skaven that he knows still dwell beneath the jungle floors of noble Lustria. If everything goes according to plan, the remaining Skaven host will be driven back and then herded to Gwakmol Crater, where they will be unable to escape their certain fate. Though the Skaven outnumber the Lizardmen many times over, the Prophet’s ever-growing force is empowered by their leader’s undeniable vigour, and they feel assured of victory despite the seemingly insurmountable odds.
The astromancers have spoken – the signs show that the Mace of Ulumak has been taken deep underground by the foul ratkin. Chase them down into their dens and wrest your rightful tool back!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Having felt the power of his Mask of Heavens fading, Tiktaq’to had an inkling that something was amiss. Soaring above the vast and immense jungles, he caught the distinct stench of the ratmen’s fear-musk still hanging in the humid air. A large Skaven presence is causing damage to the Geomantic Web through the desecration of temple ruins in the area – likely whilst searching for the damnable Warpstone deposits, in turn explaining the weakening of the blessings upon Tiktaq’to’s Mask of Heavens. There is little else to be done but head to their last known location and slaughter every last one of the blasphemous Skaven-spawn with extreme prejudice!

Throgg recently became infuriated that he was missing his prized Wintertooth Crown, so headed southward into civilised lands, tearing through the villages and towns in search of it. He had heard of a vast Dwarf convoy travelling from Karak Kadrin, seen moving towards Peak Pass with one particular Runelord in its ranks known to be an infamous hoarder of treasures. Throgg’s scouts tell him that the thieving Runelord does in fact have Throgg’s crown in his possession! Frothing at the mouth in both anger and excitement, Throgg sputters a war cry at his horde to move out, and swiftly. He will eat this thief slowly and painfully, piece by piece, and take back what is rightfully his!

Recently, the Gods sent Wulfrik a vision of a great and lauded Bretonnian hero atop a mighty charger. The horseman was drenched in blood, a sign that he was the next quarry. Thus Wulfrik led his army southward, viciously raiding the lands of Bretonnia's capital in an effort to draw the hero out, but he did not appear. He then learnt of a small keep in Lyonesse which contains holy relics, precious treasures, and stately heirlooms, all of which are of great importance to the Bretonnian Kingdom. Seeing the opportunity, Wulfrik has called upon his warband to immediately march south towards the venerated keep to attack it. The hero is yet to show himself, but Wulfrik will get his duel one way or another!

Ku'gath's past dealings with the Dwarfs have not gone well. The diminutive cave-dwellers have an iron constitution which stubbornly resists Nurgle's blessings, in spite of the Plaguefather's endless experiments. What is needed is a large quantity of test subjects so that Ku'gath can divine what lies at the root of this resistance. Once this is isolated, he can formulate a new wave of plagues of such virulence that even the Dwarfs' senseless recalcitrance will crumble.

Greasus is determined to stamp his authority as Overtyrant on all of the Ogre Tribes. So when the most powerful Black Orc Warboss of the Mountains of Mourn launches a Waaagh! deep into Ogre territory, Goldtooth moves to bring him to battle on the slopes of the sacred Fire Mouth volcano. Once this usurper has been trodden into the dirt, then Greasus may wear his basin-sized crown with unassailable pride.

Greasus' mighty sceptre was fashioned by the Sky-Titans, who granted its wielder their strength. Of late, its power has waned; the spells that imbue the sceptre dull, leached of their previous power. The Overtyrant's personal Butcher has taken a good look at the sceptre, and – after trying a few practice swings at some nearby Gnoblars – has declared that the item needs to be boiled in a cauldron of fresh blood to rejuvenate its power.\n\nGreasus must set to work gathering the blood he needs by finding fresh prey. Only then, once the sceptre has been prepared in the unfortunates' blood and cooking juices, will the Sceptre of the Titans be restored to its full power!

As the Gore Harvester, Skrag is ever on the lookout for fresh meat for his cauldron. Long days spent wandering the under-caves taught the Prophet of the Great Maw to observe the Gorgers which haunt his every step, for their feral senses allow them to root out fresh quarry to satisfy their gnawing hunger. When the Gorger's nostrils flare and their famished eyes gleam red, Skrag knows that slaughter is close at hand, and he has learned to gauge the scale of the potential feast by the Gorgers' silent eagerness. On this day, the Gorgers have spent some time sniffing eagerly beyond the caverns, heading up out of the darkness and into the peaks with saliva stringing from their hideous teeth. Skrag's instinct is that they are on to something big and he follows them, determined that his cauldron will have the greatest share of the flesh glut.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Treachery! Dwarf Gouger, greatest of Clan Mors’ weapons, has been stolen from under Queek Headtaker’s nose. Countless loyal Skaven perish as the right-claw of Lord Gnawdwell lashes out in blind fury, outraged by useless theory after useless theory as to the culprit. It is only when one follower fearfully proposes that the deceitful Clan Eshin are surely to blame that Queek stays his gore-drenched paw. The suspicion appears proven by reports that an Eshin agent has recently been sighted making for Dwarf territory. Ratkin in league with beard-things? An outrage! High in his tower, Lord Gnawdwell smiles a vicious smile and pats Dwarf Gouger with mock affection. His protégé has taken the bait: what an entertaining test of Queek’s deadly skill this shall be.

The tempestuous chief enforcer of Clan Mors has never let an insult lie. When a rival clan’s Warlord makes the outrageous claim that he possesses Warpstone armour far superior to Queek’s, the entire Mors war effort is instantly dedicated to ripping out his lying tongue. Any advisor who dares attempt to deter Queek from his self-absorbed path meets a messy end. After countless wasteful skirmishes all across the land, and a stream of further taunts, the vermin braggart is eventually cornered deep below an ancient ruin. At last the Headtaker will prove that there is no more lethal a rat than he – and help himself to some shiny new armour into the bargain.

Foolish though man-things may be, luring an Empire host of them into the cavernous Mortuary of Tzulaqua was a test of even Skrolk’s legendary cunning. Tempted in by the promise of worthless trinkets, countless perished as Skrolk cackled with glee. But the greatest reward came when one of the few to reach the pyramid’s heart dared lift the cover of the Liber Bubonicus, sprouting a thousand plague-flies and infecting all those they did not strip to the bone with pox and egg alike. Lord Skrolk’s scheme had been an unqualified success – the Council would surely reward him for this most devious of cullings. First, however, he must himself descend into the Mortuary and reclaim his pestilent prize. But, deep in the dead depths, something now stirs…

Where Skrolk was once the pre-eminent disciple of Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, of late his pestilent prowess has been thrown into doubt. Skrolk blames a weakening of his noxious Rod of Corruption, which, though it still effortlessly sloughs flesh from bone, can no longer reduce armour and blade to rust. Perhaps the solution lies with the coldbloods of Lustria who guard the strange wisdom of long-dead races? It is said that one of these is a unique red mineral, able to eat effortlessly through iron and steel. The only source of this substance is the titular relic of the Island of the Crimson Skull. Naturally, the reptiles would willingly die in their droves before parting with it. Plaguelord Skrolk is only too happy to oblige.

The Cloak of Shadows has been stolen, treachery which risks putting Snikch’s reputation at stake if the news was to reach other clans. An ambitious (and foolish) ratling must have been getting help from an unknown source to do this without drawing the attention of the Thirteen. Yet disloyalty begets further disloyalty; a deserter scurries back, telling Snikch exactly what he needs to know. He warns that the traitor has called upon some powerful allies and will soon head out to meet them. This would be a good opportunity to ambush them, then meet and eliminate their new ally!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Ensure that Snikch's personal Weeping Blades are sharpened – that they are literally up to scratch, and stab, preferably!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Throt’s legendary things-catcher – Creature-Killer – is on the fritz! As he attempted to throttle a Rat Ogre to drag into his wretched Flesh Laboratory, one of the prongs on the apparatus’ business end snapped loose, becoming entirely detached. "Uurgh! Mechanical tinker-fixing is for Skryre dregs! Stupid-boring!" Throt lamented out loud as he shoved a Warpstone-laced energy bar into his mouth. He had always been suspicious of Skryre engineers, which he considered "small-brained" for being so obsessed with machinery, when tinkering with natural (and unnatural) anatomy was so much more interesting. But Warlock Engineers have the knowledge and means to restore his legendary weapon, and regardless of his cynicism for the tinker-rats, his beasts weren’t going to throttle themselves.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Lately there had been numerous complaints from Rat Lords yet to receive their regular shipments of Rat Ogres and assorted abominations. Throt’s underlings back in Hell Pit had clearly lost control of the murderous creations housed within its unspeakable breeding pits – or so he thought. Throt returned expecting to find the city's nine circles overrun by escaped and rampaging abominations, but the truth was far more infuriating: the raging hordes of Chaos blockade Hell Pit's iron and bone gates. No doubt these Ruinous whelps are seeking retribution for their previous, foiled attempt to invade Clan Moulder's carrion-adorned stronghold. Now as then, Throt will drive the spiky-things out – but not before harvesting the choicest morsels for his ghastly experiments (and equally ghastly appetite).
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Today, as on any other day, came another attempt on Tretch’s life. But as he prepares to coldly dispatch the Eshin assassin whose lurking reflection he glimpsed in the eye of a passing Clanrat, he notices an unusual detail. An amulet, clearly of Greenskin origin, strung around the rat’s neck... The interrogation is as short as it is horrific, and yields potent reward. A high-ranking rat of a competing Clan is indeed in cahoots with the green-things, a horde of whom intend to decimate Clan Rictus upon Tretch’s death. Protocol prevents direct retaliation against the rival Skaven Lord, but Tretch’s agents soon locate the burrow in which the Greenskins muster. They await orders from their paymasters, quite unaware that Tretch plans to land the mortal blow first...

During his onslaught against the descendants of Aenarion centuries ago, N'Kari was driven into the Sea of Dreams by the combined might of Tyrion and Teclis. In his headlong flight, he dropped his favoured Daemonic blade at the bottom of the ocean floor, and since that time he has plotted to retrieve it. Judging that the eyes of the High Elves are now elsewhere, N'Kari makes his move, but unbeknownst to him, Elven Mages set wards to scry the area and are alerted to his reappearance. As the Arch-tempter searches the seabed, he discovers an Elven host barring his path, protected from the tides by their accursed Mages.

Though eternally loyal to Nagash, Arkhan would slay a legion to wield even a fraction of his master’s power. The Liche King believes in one such way to achieve this – to find the long-lost Staff of Nagash, a weapon of boundless arcane might. However, it now rests in the Unliving hand of Settra the Imperishable, the false king, whose newly-empowered bone legions march upon Arkhan’s Black Tower even now. Rallying to the infernal spire’s defence, Arkhan's concern soon grows to mounting horror as rank after rank of Skaven warriors marches into view – a veritable Vermintide! Its warlord holds aloft the Staff of Nagash and laughs a repellent laugh. A subterfuge, then... This is Settra's doing! Arkhan's horror turns to dark rage. Vengeance awaits.

Arkhan grows obsessed with Alcadizaar, the unsung ‘hero’ of Khemri who somehow slew Nagash, Supreme Lord of Undeath. How could a mortal achieve such a feat? If Arkhan could bind that ancient king’s soul into his Tomb Blade, he could learn his secrets – and gain his power. The Liche King travels to the distant land reputed to house Alcadizaar’s lost grave, where he is met by a familiar stench – Necromancy! The reptiles of this region must have uncovered its secrets, and mean to raise Alcadizaar themselves. In order that Arkhan can harvest the Priest-King’s soul and unlock the Tomb Blade’s full potential, they must be eradicated...

The divine poisons in the Khalida’s vein flow sluggishly, and her Venom Staff withers. Has she lost the favour of Asaph, the Asp-Goddess? Perhaps Asaph’s blessing can be invoked once more, with the correct incantations. Sure enough, her captivating voice whispers into the Warrior-Queen’s mind. Though Khalida is reassured that Asaph has not forsaken her, there is dire revelation. The cursed Lahmians have desecrated the snake-goddess’ shrine at the Springs of Eternal Life. No wonder the Staff falters so... Though the holy waters can be purified by a rite, the loathsome Vampires are now bound for the Ash River, clearly meaning to spread their Necromantic corruption further. They must be intercepted – and granted their final death.

Grand Hierophant Khatep remains loyal, despite his banishment by King Settra. In his tireless quest to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, he has journeyed to the New World. Having heard rumour that the Dark Elves dabble in the art of resurrection, he follows a trail of whispers to a clandestine Druchii library. There, among the array of magical texts, one tome hums with an even stranger power. Within, its pages offer the impossible – a rite to bind a soul to a living host. A way to renew Settra and his fleshless followers… this would restore Khatep’s honour and station. The liturgy is to first be practiced deep within the Pits of Zardok – surely that way Settra will be safe from any unexpected complications…

Settra the Imperishable demands a statue be raised in his own image – an effigy of pure magnificence. Naturally, it must be built from only the finest materials, and should hold in its colossal hand a recreation of the Blessed Blade of Ptra. Suddenly infuriated by this marble testament to the forgotten glories of his youth, the Eternal Sovereign becomes desirous to wield the white-hot sword of legend once more. As Settra draws near to its reliquary in the Charnel Valley, his scouts report activity. A glory-hunting alliance of Dwarfs and men is here in force! The fires of fury are stoked within Settra's withered heart. They dare defile this place! Settra will send a mighty tribute to the Realm of Souls this day!

Settra surveys the world around him and finds it wanting. All will submit to his rule; all will serve the King of Kings. But a king requires a crown, and his has been stolen by tomb-defiling Northmen as he slept away the ages. It must be recovered! His agents bring word of a place deep in the distant Ice Tooth Mountain, where Norscan savages brazenly display wit and wealth far above their barbaric station. Though they know they harbour a relic of great significance, they cannot begin to understand its true import. The Ruler of the Four Horizons will teach them – though, in death, they will not remember his merciless lesson…

Kairos' contemplation of the Well of Eternity has given him an insight which bodes ill for his master's schemes. The Staff of Tomorrow cannot exist in multiple points across the weave of fate, it will create a paradox that could blind Kairos and hamper Tzeentch's plans for the Great Game. In the moment of comprehension of this fact, the Fateweaver's two heads turn to face each other, and as their eyes meet he is drawn into a plane of existence that is not the present, yet one which lies between past and future. He must defeat both his past and future selves in order to reconfigure events.

Kemmler’s forces have intercepted several warbands of Chaos Raiders, their presence suggesting some hidden purpose. He traces their movements onto a glacier in the high peaks. Lost memories return, as he recalls tales of a great Champion of Chaos slain by the hand of Sigmar himself in battle. Could this be the tomb of Krell?

King Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire, sacrificing himself to save the man who would unite the tribes of men. Such greatness of spirit is a noble thing for most, but to Kemmler it represents only a potential source of power waiting to be tapped. He receives word of a likely location for Marbad’s tomb in southern Middenland. Its innate power has drawn others to it, and the agent reports that a local tribe of Forest Goblins uses its summit for their rituals. However, no challenge is sufficiently daunting to deny the Lichemaster an opportunity to paw through a trove of ancient grave goods in his unending search for power.

The abbey at La Maisontaal in northern Bretonnia has long held Heinrich Kemmler’s interest. It is a major centre of worship for the Nature-God, Taal, and is therefore worthy of destruction in Kemmler’s eyes. More significantly, it serves as a repository for several powerful artefacts. Unfortunately, the abbey is well defended by the forces of the local duke, meaning that any straightforward attack upon it would prove costly. Fortunately the Lichemaster has put into motion a plan of pleasingly wicked deviousness.

Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus – a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica. Alas, the Cult of Sigmar have caught wind of Ghorst's search and seek to thwart his efforts, tracking the pages to a site where centuries ago a Lahmian cult placed them in a sealed casket and cast them into a deep gorge to keep them out of Nagash's necrotic hands. Following their lead, Helman arrives to see them already excavating the site. The Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

While on one of her forays of bloodletting, Isabella happens upon an unrivalled prize. Torn from one of the corpses of a recently slaughtered Beastman is a horn thick with pestilent blood, emanating a ghastly aura. A Ruinous Gift from the Chaos Gods themselves! To simply drink deep of its blighted fluids would surely end Isabella’s Unlife. Fortunately, a rite can purge the blood of its lethal taint, rendering the dark powers of Chaos hers to consume, but requires the defilement of a legendary warrior’s resting place. Who better than Marbad, first of the Elector Counts, ancient hero to the fools of the Empire? The innumerable zealots who guard it are all that stand between the Countess of Sylvania and power beyond all imagining.

During his studies amongst the scrolls of skin in the ancient city of Lahmia, Count Mannfred uncovers several references to a suit of mail imbued with great power. In ages past, the armour’s original owner, a king of Nehekhara, fell in battle. Upon dragging the reluctant spirit of the dead Nehekharan king back to the surface, Mannfred learns that he was slain by a horde of Greenskins whose Warboss, Grudsnik, stripped his corpse of the magnificent armour. Mannfred’s scouts send word that Grudsnik’s mound lies to the east of Castle Carcassonne whose duke commands a powerful garrison. Doubtless this puny mortal will try to interfere with Mannfred's plans, but no matter, for his corpse will serve the Count as well as that of any other man.

Delving within the ancient flayed skin covers of a fell tome that had come into his possession, the Count discovers an examination of binding, funnelling Dark Magic into ancient physical artefacts. When a great quantity of spirit essence is released, it can be harnessed and bound into an item through the use of magical power. Mannfred knows of such a locus, an Arcane Fulcrum of bone deep in the Badlands, where Greenskins gather to conduct their pathetic shamanic rites. Even now, they gather in great numbers around the Pillar of Bone and their Shamans are engaged in one of their primitive rituals to their gods, Gork and Mork. Mannfred fingers his sword thoughtfully then calls to his Wight King captains to ready the army.

Blood Drinker thirsts. The sword has lain dormant for centuries, and so the blade has dulled – its once-golden pommel tarnished. The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood – only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again. The sword's one true owner, Vlad von Carstein, sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Shaken into action, mankind are mustering forces and preparing to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. Vlad is pleased – they muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered!

The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. However, the resurrection of Vlad, first of the Vampire Counts, has proved difficult. The power of the ring now fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. For this, he will need Warpstone mined from a seam deep in the Desolation of Nagash. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the land with more than enough of the Chaos-infused rock for Vlad's needs. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach – anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

Within Athel Loren, Drycha’s association with the vengeful Treeman Elder known as Coeddil is no secret. His great betrayal of the Asrai has not been forgotten, and the forests whisper that his wrath will never be subdued. He has roamed imprisoned in the Wildwood with his Dryad handmaidens for several centuries, while Drycha’s wargrove has determinedly carried out his malevolent decrees in the outside world. But the time of his liberation is finally at hand. Coeddil will have his freedom – Drycha needs only to topple two of the Waystones that form the fence around his forest prison, thus freeing the great Ancient once and for all!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: The Glade Scouts of Athel Loren pitch themselves desperately against hordes of Undead, who rive and shift at them in seemingly endless waves. Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student is behind the Undead horde. The damp and pallid hallmarks of Kemmler are all over his protégé's work as he advances on the forest with his desiccated horde in tow. The forest must be protected, and Durthu will give no quarter in its defence. Let these dark and twisted fiends feel the full wrath of the Deepwood, with the wrathful Ancient as its instrument of war!

The Cloak of Isha, much revered relic of the goddess herself, has been stolen. The Elves speak of dark omens, and even Ariel herself feels the changing of the forest as surely as she feels the shifting of the season. Orion is incensed to find out that the relic is to be secretly given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. A Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late! The forest watches with fearful anticipation; the Night Glens seem to grow darker as the hour of battle approaches.

Dark news reaches the court of Athel Loren; shadows loom on the outskirts of the forest, and the Waystone fence is threatened. Reports reach the king that a herd of Beastmen slipped through the perimeter and defiled another Waystone before slinking back into the undergrowth. Orion and his scouts detect the foul and pestilent aura of Dark Magic at the site of the Beastman raid – an aura that could belong to only one Beastman that Orion knows of: Morghur. Rallying the Wood Elves to his side, he pushes onwards to find the enemy and sate his bloodlust. As the Elves edge forward, the path closes in around them and the moment of battle draws near...

Winter grows ever closer, and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages and to renewal. Yet there are forces of darkness that would see this path curtailed all too quickly. Having infiltrated the Oak of Ages, Anath Raema – Goddess of the Savage Hunt – plans to supplant Ariel and ascend to an Athel Loren shaped by her malicious desires. Athel Loren is in uproar; fear sets in like a deep chill, which shatters into panic when a rebel force reveals itself, advancing on the Oak of Ages. Orion's final act must be to destroy this force and put Anath Raema's destructive desires to the sword once and for all.

The enigmatic Sisters of Twilight are masters of the wild beasts, an advantage they use with frightening effect when fighting upon the loyal flying mounts which carry them through war-torn skies: Gwindalor, the wise and even-tempered Great Eagle and Ceithin-Har, the fearless and hot-blooded Forest Dragon. To Naestra’s concern and Arahan’s seething anger, Ceithin-Har had not responded to their latest calls – the Dark Elves had captured it, but were then ambushed by some Beastmen who took the Dragon for themselves. The sisters know of one obvious place to look for the Children of Chaos; in the nearby forest enclave of Witchwood Hollow, their scouts had spotted their foul Herdstones – the only reliable evidence of a Beastmen presence.
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

To approach the Brass Citadel, Khorne must be appeased. Kill the many foes drawn from across the mortal plane that now stand in your way. Only when you reach a certain amount of bloodshed will the Blood God entertain your approach!
For too long has this one stood between us and endless riches. They must hear death's briny song.
Raise the sails! Strike fear into their hearts! Let them know that conquest is upon them!
In death, their followers will abandon them, shrieking and terrified as their lifeblood spills.
On the battlefield, they will face a vision of horror, and know the salty kiss of death.
To war! Unleash the waterlogged legion of the dead upon them!
They shall not take our plunder! They shall not seize our riches! Attack, and show no mercy!
A march of conquest! Let cold, dead hands overflow with stolen plunder!
Wreck them! Rob them! Terrorise them! Make them forever fear the fleet of the damned!

Let us call upon the House of Secrets to provide Cathay with sorcerous might.
The Jade Legion has need of one the Celestial Emperor's finest Sorcerers.
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}

Our Ruinous crusade requires a vision of Slaaneshi power and decadence. We must seduce an Alluress to our dread cause.
Khornate might will surely advance our cataclysmic cause. Recruit this powerhouse of Daemon destruction to our dark legion.
We must wield devastating magic if we are to bring this mortal world to its knees. One of the Raven God's more potent Sorcerers will suffice.
Disease can fell the foes our blades and talons cannot reach. We must recruit one of the Urfather's most pestilent servants into our legion of darkness.
This fool believes themselves unstoppable. It is high time they learned why we are called the Dark Ones.
Their lands are ours by right, a glorious inheritance to seize and despoil as we see fit.
Grant woe and destruction to this wretch, and strike terror into the hearts of all who follow them.
Eradicate this underling! Let their cowering masters know that now is the hour of the Druchii!
Attack! Make them grovel! Make them beg! Show them the true meaning of cruelty!
Ludicrous! They believe they can bestow suffering upon us! Teach them the error of their ways...
Lands to raid and lands to ravage! Rain terror and death upon them!
Break them! Ruin them! Let them know that none can stand against the children of Naggaroth!

This skulking villain must meet their end. Every Asur demands it!
Ulthuan must expand. Stand against the twilight! A new dawn comes!
We must cut our foe off at the knees. For the chosen of Asuryan to thrive, this wretch must be destroyed.
Remove this whelp from play and their master will surely follow.
For sake of all this world, the Eldest Race must go to war once more.
Repel these villains from our borders! They shall know Ulthuan's righteous wrath!
We may seize all that we need without remorse, for we are the heirs to the world.
Break their walls, and break their will! Show them that Ulthuan's light is undimmed!
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_engage_force_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raid_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}
The blood legion requires a killer of uncommon ferocity. Lure one of Chaos' most remorseless fiends to your cause.
Khorne demands worship! Enlist a mortal who will give themselves to Him, scarred body and murderous soul.
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_engage_force_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raid_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}
A show of sorcery will stoke courage in proud Kislev hearts. The Ice Court must send its finest.
Great faith breeds great discipline. A Patriarch will teach our people purity and strength.
This one is an obstacle to the Great Plan. Their candle-short life must be snuffed out.
Reclaim these lands for the Children of the Gods! Take back what was ours so long ago! Only then can there be order!
These ones have no place in the Great Plan. Purge their leader, and their followers will understand the inevitability of their doom.
Sotek demands a sacrifice. Let our blades slice through the neck of this ignorant whelp.
They need not know our reasons. They need only die. Such is the will of the Old Ones.
Do not allow these lesser beings to despoil our sacred temple-cities and befoul our ancient lands. Rise up!
Seize their wealth, for we are the blessed servants of the Old Ones, and all the world belongs to us!
Make these upstarts understand that their civilisation will rise and fall in a heartbeat, as so many have before them.
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_engage_force_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raid_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}
We require a mortal devotee of decay to help spread our Grandfather's joyful word and necrotic touch. See who you can rustle up, eh?
The Tallymen are faithful children, but to really come into their own they require a leader with a little more zing.
Fool-thing big problem! Fool-thing must die-die! Fool-thing feed worm-worms!
Must seize-take land-place! Help clan-clan grow-thrive, yes?
Crush-smash fool-thing boss-lord! Then rest of fool-things run-flee, yes-yes?
Underling-thing die-die now-now! Make fool-fool boss-lord tremble-shiver!
No more wait-wait! Time for big fight-fight, yes? Make fool-things dead-dead! Hee!
Fool-things not take Clan land-place! Rip-tear faces! Bite-gnaw legs! Make leave-go, now-now!
Surge-sweep over land-place! Take-grab shinies! Break-smash rest-rest! Hee!
Bring doom-doom to city-place! Smash walls good-good! Blood in street-roads, yes?
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_engage_force_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raid_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}
There are those who prove somehow resistant to our Daemonettes' monstrous allure. This is, of course, intolerable. Thus, we must lure a sister of unspeakable and terrible beauty to our cause.
Slaanesh desires that a mortal willingly give themselves body and soul to Him, a deviant beyond compare who can withstand unspeakable suffering and reach untold heights of ecstasy.
This infuriating adversary must be slain – granted the final death, never to live again.
Nehekhara must do more than endure. We must rule once more, in death as we did in life.
They and all their kind are a threat to Nehekhara's immortal glory. Defeat them, and send them to Usirian for judgement!
Vengeance upon they who dare disturb our rest! Show them that we are the rightful rulers of all, for now and forever!
They covet our power. They covet our wealth. They shall have neither.
Damnation awaits those who disturb us. Banish them to the lowest reaches of the Realm of Souls!
Ravage their lands! Seize their wealth! We must reclaim our lost glory!
Shatter their walls! Plunder their homes! Rise in eternal conquest!
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_assassinate_character_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_capture_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_eliminate_character_in_battle_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_engage_force_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raid_region_description}}
{{tr:wh3_main_mis_gen_diplomatic_raze_sack_settlement_description}}
Tzeeneth requests a mannish puppet of Change, all the better to spread His shifting word across these mortal lands.
Though our Horrors serve faithfully, they are a capering, giggling rabble in need of organisation. Let us summon one with more acumen into corporeality.
The beasties 'ave their 'erdstone squatting their camp. It's valuable. Get it.
The pretty boys have a right good castle. 'Borrow it' there's money for ya if you do.
Go get that Cathayan slum – bet we got treasure in dere.
Not much meat on Elves but they got a good set of sharp knives – go collect them 'ere.
Dwarfs make their holds nice 'an full of gold. Best get it, mind yer 'ead – low ceilings.
A place over dere called Somefing-dorf or wotever – go squat and find loot.
There's gold an' meat in there - go get it!
I got a comissi'n for yer. Boot out those Orcs, take dat camp for the Maw.
Elf-towns are so clean – perfect places to go and take a large dump. Hope yer bellies are full.
Go claim the place which makes our blood boil, where the red Daemons lurk.
Those humie places with onion roofs, dat's yer next mission. Go get one of those.
The ruins of the Lizardmen have got loads of shiny gold hidden in them – go and take one.
There guys worship da Bad Gods, but that shouldn't stop us takin' their camp!
This place stinks like when that Tyrant got the galloping squits. Hold ya nose, lads, and take for us.
I want yoo to take that camp off dat rival tribe. Pay is good if ya do it.
Do you like a bit of roast rat? The tail's the best bit! Know where there's a nest? Go get some nosh.
Got a commissi'n to go and take that big purple tent over 'ere where all the screamin' is.
Got a map with a cross on, bet its treasure. Start by taking that crypt-place.
That place where the pink balls hangout and the talking birdie-bloke lurks… might be worth a visit.
Like the smell of fish? These dead ones keep a lot of it around. You can find it all here.
Old meat is rancid, need strong guts to eat it. Been told you 'ave the strongest, best get dis place under yer control.
Go to the Bad God Place – big contract if you take it for the tribe.
Got a mission for yer – go and capture that tree-Elf place. Hope you're good at climbin'!
This beast-tyrant got a right big horn, swingin' it about like he owns the place. Go chop it off!
There's a price on that one's 'head. Pull 'im out of his armour. Or is the girlie? If so, get 'er!
Yum, this Easter'n meat will taste good. Go get this git an' put 'im in a stew.
Got a live one 'ere. Bounty on their 'ead. Go kill 'em and collect the reward.
Bloody shouty beardy git. Go stomp it for a nice little reward!
There's a contract on a humie, want some dosh and a big name – be a Maneater? Then go get 'em.
Take this git's head and grind their bones. Reward if yoo do.
Orcs an' Goblins are gristly – still, we got one mouthing off. He needs taking down.
Elf bones make perfect tooth picks… speakin' of which there's one near you that needs killin'.
Go get a big red angry bat thing. You'll be rich!
Time for some humie-stew. Got a contract for yer to kill one of them Bear-lovin' ones.
Reptiles. Difficult to get into… too many scales. Still, I've got a contract on one of 'em.
Got a git 'ere, finks he's big man… Let's show 'im wot a real big man is!
There's a green Daemon with a bigger gut that yoo! Can't have that, go and take 'im out.
Another Ogre 'as made some waves, some ripples in da bellies of others. Needs takin' down a peg or three.
Contract 'ere for some furry critter. Make 'im dead. If you eat 'im then make sure you fry the eyes.
Go get that weird freak. Far too thin, so not much meat on 'em. Still, it needs to die.
We da true kings! Yet this dead one thinks he's betta than us. Go grind 'is bones to dust!
This squawkin' bird-magician is worth something dead – best kill it, and get some drumsticks!
Got a pirate, one made of rancid meat, that needs takin' down. You up for it?
We like a good goblet of blood, but so does dis git. Best slap 'im about a bit, let 'im know who's best.
Challenge Stone or not, don't care – go find this champion and slap 'im up good!
We want dat Elf dead. Go and grind 'is bones. Big reward for yer when you do it!
Take their tents – burn and render the Beastman pens. Treasure if you do.
The Bretonnian tower is fallin' down, fallin' down…
We need ya, to go to that humie place, take the plunder then break it.
These Elves like pain. Show 'em some proper pain and break everyfing: walls, doors, tables… legs, arms…
These little beards think the mountains are 'dere's – let's show 'em who really rulez the peaks!
Hunt out the man-flesh at dis place… you'll feast and da Empire'll burn.
Burn it! Raze it! Break it! Get paid.
Greenskin rubble might have some shiny things in. See wot you can take.
Elves like everything perfect – ugh! – go spoil it and take yer fill.
Take the Daemon place for our own. Then fight an' eat till sated.
Yer want some loot? Go find one of those cold towns the Kislev humies live in. Sack it.
Plenty of Lizardman ruins about. Make some more.
Make a fire, use that Norse camp for firewood. Let it burn nice an' bright.
Best get over there, and light that fart – the stink gas will ensure it goes up good!
Got some gold for ya, all yer 'ave to do is go and burn that other camp to da ground.
Too many rats about, we 'ave standards! Time for a cull!
Apparently this lot like pain – best go and burn their hovel down then. Reward for ya if you do it.
Find da treasure in those dusty chambers and then bury it in sand. Not like there's any meet on those bones!
Tzee Zeeee-nt-ch - 'owever yoo spell it! Go find where dey live and clear 'em out!
Rumour 'as it plenty of gold there. Once you nab the baubles, best to get a Firebelly to sort it.
The nobs of the Vampires have lots of gold and precious fings from their families. Find and take it!
The Great Maw yearns. Lots of special stuff can be found here. Get it!
Get yer axe nice and sharp. We wanna see some trees topplin'.

The Northern Oblast is the critical land between all three of Kislev’s major cities. Time is short, if the oblast is not reclaimed by Kislev’s heroes, then the rot will set in forever and the Motherland fall!

Control settlements to earn Victory Points (VP) and win the game. Each settlement owned will generate 1 VP per turn.  The first player to earn 40 VP wins.

If no player has earned 40 VP by turn 30, then the player with most points is victorious.

In the event of a tie, play will continue until one player starts their turn with more VP than any other player.

The eyes of the Chaos Gods glare down on Kislev. In this moment of the Great Game, Kislev is the board in which the Dark Powers make their sinister plays. However, the nation is now without protectors. The Motherland imbues her champions, both past and present, and they will readily come to her aid. The rot must be cut out, and the nation cleansed!
No being survives approaching the Plague God’s manse – the most toxic and diseased place in all existence! You will need to get immunity before you can reach Nurgle’s stronghold.

Skarbrand's patience, such as it is, is wearing thin. The plan was to await the encroaching Nurgle horde and then for the three Khornate forces to slaughter them in glorious carnage before the Brazen Altar. Plans! What weakness! The farmer plans for the harvest. The maiden plans her wedding. Skarbrand does not scheme! What use plans when there is rage and slaughter? The Wrathful Reaper clashes his axes together and glares at the Bloodthirsters in command of the other Khornate forces. This is their blasphemous folly, this planning and waiting. If Nurgle won't oblige, then Khorne will yet have his due. Blood for the Blood God!

Boris the Red was thought dead, lost to Kislev and last seen fighting Chaos on the banks of a river deep in Troll Country. And so he fell, and Kislev looked to his daughter to lead them.

Yet, with the Bear-God's last, pained roar, something has changed – the Red Tzar stirs. The God of Change senses the awakening of Kislev's lost sovereign, and seeks to profit. A horde including three Tzeentchian sorcerers descend on Boris' location, creating an arcane spell to wrest him from the ice!

All is not lost, for the Motherland has intervened, sending a message of Tzar's imperilled return by the rustle of branches and the chirps of birds to the hags of the forest, and from there word reaches the city of Kislev.

Tzeentch seeks to weaken Kislev by strengthening the affinity between crystal and ice, thus creating a link between his realm and the Motherland. To do this, he requires the Crystal Cloak. In the confusion of Boris’ death, agents of the Changer stole the Crystal Cloak from the Bokha Palace and now it resides in the centre of the Fractal Maze – a great Tzeentchian labyrinth structured to unravel the cloak and so reveal its power.\n\nSoon after her coronation, Katarin sent her own spies to locate the cloak. Their intelligence has led the Ice Queen to the Fractal Maze, and a reckoning with the thieves.

Boris the Red was thought dead, lost to Kislev and last seen fighting Chaos on the banks of a river deep in Troll Country. And so he fell, and Kislev looked to his daughter to lead them.

Yet, with the Bear-God's last, pained roar, something has changed – the Red Tzar stirs. The God of Change senses the awakening of Kislev's lost sovereign, and seeks to profit. A horde including three Tzeentchian sorcerers descend on Boris' location, creating an arcane spell to wrest him from the ice!

All is not lost, for the Motherland has intervened, sending a message of Tzar's imperilled return by the rustle of branches and the chirps of birds to the hags of the forest, and from there word reaches the city of Kislev.

Kostaltyn tours outlying Kislev provinces. Vast congregations of the simple folk turn out to witness the blessings, the Supreme Patriarch's fiery rhetoric filling their hearts with a rekindled determination to protect the Motherland at all costs. But this increased defiance coupled with the remote and therefore sparsely-defended locations makes these ceremonies an attractive target for Kislev's enemies.\n\nIn a coastal village, north of Erengrad, the peasants listen to the words of the Supreme Patriarch as he harangues their weakness and ingratitude, urging them to set aside their own petty concerns and join his crusade against the spreading influence of the Dark Powers in the Tzarina's Ice Court. Out at sea, a storm gathers, the clouds rolling toward the shore. Under their cover, dark shapes move. The Dark Elves have come, eager to slaughter and fill their holds with slaves from amongst the seemingly helpless peasantry. Above even the rising thunder, the shrieking voice of the Supreme Patriarch calls the congregation to give up their lives in defence of the Motherland. These invaders will be thrown back into the waves from whence they came!

Ku'gath's past dealings with the Dwarfs have not gone well. The diminutive cave-dwellers have an iron constitution which stubbornly resists Nurgle's blessings, in spite of the Plaguefather's endless experiments. What is needed is a large quantity of test subjects so that Ku'gath can divine what lies at the root of this resistance. Once this is isolated, he can formulate a new wave of plagues of such virulence that even the Dwarfs' senseless recalcitrance will crumble.

Greasus is determined to stamp his authority as Overtyrant on all of the Ogre Tribes. So when the most powerful Black Orc Warboss of the Mountains of Mourn launches a Waaagh! deep into Ogre territory, Goldtooth moves to bring him to battle on the slopes of the sacred Fire Mouth volcano. Once this usurper has been trodden into the dirt, then Greasus may wear his basin-sized crown with unassailable pride.

As the Gore Harvester, Skrag is ever on the lookout for fresh meat for his cauldron. Long days spent wandering the under-caves taught the Prophet of the Great Maw to observe the Gorgers which haunt his every step, for their feral senses allow them to root out fresh quarry to satisfy their gnawing hunger. When the Gorger's nostrils flare and their famished eyes gleam red, Skrag knows that slaughter is close at hand, and he has learned to gauge the scale of the potential feast by the Gorgers' silent eagerness. On this day, the Gorgers have spent some time sniffing eagerly beyond the caverns, heading up out of the darkness and into the peaks with saliva stringing from their hideous teeth. Skrag's instinct is that they are on to something big and he follows them, determined that his cauldron will have the greatest share of the flesh glut.

During his onslaught against the descendants of Aenarion centuries ago, N'Kari was driven into the Sea of Dreams by the combined might of Tyrion and Teclis. In his headlong flight, he dropped his favoured Daemonic blade at the bottom of the ocean floor, and since that time he has plotted to retrieve it. Judging that the eyes of the High Elves are now elsewhere, N'Kari makes his move, but unbeknownst to him, Elven Mages set wards to scry the area and are alerted to his reappearance. As the Arch-tempter searches the seabed, he discovers an Elven host barring his path, protected from the tides by their accursed Mages.

Kairos' contemplation of the Well of Eternity has given him an insight which bodes ill for his master's schemes. The Staff of Tomorrow cannot exist in multiple points across the weave of fate, it will create a paradox that could blind Kairos and hamper Tzeentch's plans for the Great Game. In the moment of comprehension of this fact, the Fateweaver's two heads turn to face each other, and as their eyes meet he is drawn into a plane of existence that is not the present, yet one which lies between past and future. He must defeat both his past and future selves in order to reconfigure events.

localised_title: Travel Towards the Forge of Souls
localised_description: The rifts are open; permanent tears in the mortal plane. Use them once more to traverse towards the Forge of Souls, for Be’lakor seeks nothing less than Godhood! He will feast on what remains of Ursun, consume the Bear’s power and ascend to challenge the Ruinous Powers!\n\nNow you have collected the four twisted souls, unleash them within the Realm of Chaos to light the hidden path – a bridge of shadows to reach the Forge of Souls. Confront and defeat Be’lakor before he becomes a God!

You have momentarily earned the Blood God's respect and may approach the Brass Citadel to face His favoured Daemon Prince. But battle awaits you there, for this is Khorne's palace. Survive against waves of His thirstiest Daemons and slay the Gatekeeper – only then can its soul be captured.

The wars waged by Chaos have been the most terrible of all conflicts in history, their destruction unrivalled by anything else. But each war has been but a test, a sham, a preparation for a greater war that is yet to come, every battle a touch of the taloned hand of Chaos probing the defences of the mortal world. Soon the day will come when Chaos musters its true, horrifying strength, but first its acolytes must prove their military might with yet more bloodshed. In return, the Gods will pave the way to the end by sending forth their first forgotten champion…
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_pro12_mis_ie_kho_karanak_unlock_01}}
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_pro12_mis_ie_kho_karanak_unlock_01}}
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_pro12_mis_ie_kho_karanak_unlock_01}}
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_pro12_mis_ie_kho_karanak_unlock_01}}

To carry out the Lord of Murder’s bidding is to sate his endless appetite for violence – and now is the time to unleash his raw, unreasoning vengeance onto the mortal plane for your blood-soaked cause! Karanak, the three-headed hound, is a vicious and implacable Daemon, endlessly prowling his master’s throne room when not carrying out His murderous bidding. In fact, Khorne considers very few of His champions worthy of summoning Karanak. Unquestionably, any paragon of violence and destruction in this existence has much to gain should the chosen hunter of Khorne be weaponised for their own ends. As is the Blood God’s way, bloodshed shall beget bloodshed; to summon His prized hound, Khorne’s gaze must be turned…
{{tr:missions_localised_description_wh3_pro12_mis_ie_kho_karanak_unlock_01}}
A toll must be paid to pass through Khorne's realm. Become a killer to pass through the bloody lands.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Murderer.

localised_description: Ensure your powerful allies serve you. Use the Ice Maiden to disrupt your enemies.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Magic-Wielder.

localised_description: The Atamans of Kislev lead and administer their villages and towns. Build a safe haven amidst the wastes.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Ataman.

localised_description: To despoil and take is all that these savages understand, even those that worship Tzeentch in his more base forms.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Conqueror.

localised_description: Send the arcane armies of the Changer scattering before your might and this trial shall be fulfilled.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Subjugator.

localised_description: There is more than one way to bring a tribe to heel. Find common cause with them, for only together will you survive.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Supplicant.

localised_description: When Ursun's most devout servant is at your side, use him to further your own aspirations.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Fervent.

localised_description: The time has come to march on Dervingard and free our kin. If you do not strike swiftly, the Wolf will recover. End his reign of bloodshed.
localised_mission_completed_text: Once more the light of Kislev shines in the darkness of the Chaos Wastes. Dervingard is free from tyranny.

localised_description: Yuri, ready your warriors. Our sons and daughters cry out and flee in terror. The spilling of their blood must be prevented.
localised_mission_completed_text: The innocent are spared from the Wolf’s vicious pack. The Beacon is under our control – a sanctuary in the cold, harsh wastes – but this is not Dervingard. Kislev’s northern stronghold awaits.

localised_description: Yuri, you have led your kin through the mountain pass. The winds of the Chaos Wastes howl with unmatched fury. Journey north and seek respite.
localised_mission_completed_text: You have found respite. Together we can overcome the trials ahead. Our journey has just begun.

localised_description:
Yuri, your scent grows strong, saturated in the power you have gained. I am close, but I grow weak.

Confront the traitor Slavin Kurnz. Offer no mercy, only blood. Slay him and the Howling Citadel is yours. Together we will roar to melt the snows. Together we free Kislev of this winter.

Make war, Yuri, seek your true god.
localised_mission_completed_text: The traitor is slain. His followers flee. Find me, son of Kislev.

localised_description: The fears of lesser men must not sway you from the righteous path. You have shown courage. Now, be as brazen as the altar you seek. Enter the lands of Khorne, the Blood God, conquer them, and raid his shrine. Discover the name of the Bridge-Maker.
localised_mission_completed_text: You have defiled Khorne’s altar. The name of the Bridge-Maker is yours to claim. Summon him at the Screaming Chasm.

localised_description: The spirit of men is frail – so easily corrupted. The northern tribes worship the Dark Gods. The chief of the Gharhars, Skollden, hungers for Kislevite blood. While he lives, he will hinder your search and prey on our people. The Wolf must be tamed.
localised_mission_completed_text: The cur runs, yelping for his Dark Gods. He fears your strength and returns to Dervingard.

localised_description: Dervingard is reclaimed. Now we embark on a greater quest. Deep in the Chaos Wastes stands the "Citadel that howls". Within its halls lies a hidden portal that leads to my prison. The Citadel cannot be reached by mortal means – the Screaming Chasm prevents it. Journey to the Lucent Maze. Find the secret runes. They hold the knowledge you seek.
localised_mission_completed_text: The guardians of the Lucent Maze are defeated. Enter the labyrinth and discover the forbidden knowledge. I will guide you, protect you, from Tzeentch's tricks.

localised_description: It is not enough to merely slay the enemy, but ravage their lands. Turn raider and take anything of worth.
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the Raider.

localised_description: Some will never kneel. Then the only answer is to obliterate them utterly. Wipe out your foe – it matters not who, for this is a trial of war itself – the consequences be damned!
localised_mission_completed_text: The trial is fulfilled. You are the War-Monger.

localised_description: Shamed in Grimnir’s sight did the bestial horde attack from many different angles, breaking the established rules of war. Cheaters all, and they should be punished!
Within Smednir’s vengeful glare did the Gors raid Dawi lands. A foul trespass! Right this wrong!
Spied in the view of Grungni, the warherds of vile, skruff Beastmen pillage and despoil fine Dawi lands. Such a disgrace must be avenged!
Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.
This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.
This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.
This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.
This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.
This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.
This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.
This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.
This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.
It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.
We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.
Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.
Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, Lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.
Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.
A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!
A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.
A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!
A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!
A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.
A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!
This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!
This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.
This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.
This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!
This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.
This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!
This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.
This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!
This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!
This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!
