This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.
This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!
This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.
This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!
A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!
A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!
A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!
An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!
A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!
The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!
These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!
These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!
The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!
This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!
This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!
Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.
The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!
The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!
This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!
This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!
These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!
These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!
The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!
The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.
Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!
A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!
The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!
The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!
War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!
These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!
An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.
Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.
This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!
If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!

localised_title: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!
localised_description: Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.
The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!
On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!

The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!
localised_mission_completed_text: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

localised_description: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!

localised_title: The Ego of the Soil Servants Grudge
localised_description: Grimnir rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!

localised_title: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge
localised_description: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!
As spied by a wrathful Grimnir, did the tree-hugging elgi bastards come and take our settlement. What do these gits even want with rock and metal? Get them out!
This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!
What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!
The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!
The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!
The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.
What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.
What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!
The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!
Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!
Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!
These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!
This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!
Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.
Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.
Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!
Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.
If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.
Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.
The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.
Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.
This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!
Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!
This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!
The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.
As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.
With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!
This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!
This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!
For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!
This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.
No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!
Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.
For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.
No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!
Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!
What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!
Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!
The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!
This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!
These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!
Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!
The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!
This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!
No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.
These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.
The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!
No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!
Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!
The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?
The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!
Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!

localised_title: You Can't Take It With You
localised_description: The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!
Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!
What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!
What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!
The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!
They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…
Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.
The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!
The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.
The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!

localised_title: To Steed or Not to Steed…
localised_description: Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!
Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. However, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.
Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!

A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

Seen as an oath unfulfilled, and a sore point for all Dwarfs, the loss of Karak Eight Peaks was a low point for the Karaz Ankor. Since its fall many Dwarfs have tried, and failed, to reconquer it - Belegar is the latest of these who has dedicated his life to reclaiming this famous Hold. As a direct descendant of the last ruler of Karak Eight peaks, Belegar, and all those in Clan Angrund, consider its occupation their greatest grudge.

My lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!

Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?

The champion of the Hound, Vashnaar, has been summoned by his master. Scorned by your allegiance to another, they have sent their best against you. This tainted warrior is here for one reason, and one alone: your defeat. With an unquenchable thirst for battle and an unwavering commitment to obey his masters, he will be no easy Champion to best. The host of followers in his wake is immense too, and they share a thirst for bloodshed with their hallowed example.\n\nYou must overcome this Champion, show his master that your fate is not in his hands, and that no matter who is sent against you the triumph will be yours!

The champion of the Crow, Ludred, has been summoned by his master. Scorned by your allegiance to another, they have sent their best against you. This tainted warrior is here for one reason, and one alone: your defeat. With an unquenchable thirst for battle and an unwavering commitment to obey his masters, he will be no easy Champion to best. The host of followers in his wake is immense too, and they share a thirst for bloodshed with their hallowed example.\n\nYou must overcome this Champion, show his master that your fate is not in his hands, and that no matter who is sent against you the triumph will be yours!

The champion of the Serpent, Feytor, has been summoned by his master. Scorned by your allegiance to another, they have sent their best against you. This tainted warrior is here for one reason, and one alone: your defeat. With an unquenchable thirst for battle and an unwavering commitment to obey his masters, he will be no easy Champion to best. The host of followers in his wake is immense too, and they share a thirst for bloodshed with their hallowed example.\n\nYou must overcome this Champion, show his master that your fate is not in his hands, and that no matter who is sent against you the triumph will be yours!

The champion of the Eagle, Azrik, has been summoned by his master. Scorned by your allegiance to another, they have sent their best against you. This tainted warrior is here for one reason, and one alone: your defeat. With an unquenchable thirst for battle and an unwavering commitment to obey his masters, he will be no easy Champion to best. The host of followers in his wake is immense too, and they share a thirst for bloodshed with their hallowed example.\n\nYou must overcome this Champion, show his master that your fate is not in his hands, and that no matter who is sent against you the triumph will be yours!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description:
With the appearance of giant, winged monsters, Chaos Frost Dragons are thought to be a type of Chaos-mutated Dragon that dwells in the underground passageways of the Old World’s coldest climes. Amongst the northern tribes there are tales of one such monstrous specimen called Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void, which has terrorised the tundra for centuries. Witnesses say that when coming out of hibernation it emerges from the ground, in a heartbeat, to indiscriminately devour any unknowing passers-by that get too close to its territory, located somewhere at the frozen, northern end of Troll Country.

Recently, The Tower of Khrakk and the surrounding areas north of Troll Country have been inexplicably blanketed by freakishly bad snow storms. Word also reaches you that entire tribes have disappeared from the region without a trace, reportedly perishing in the extreme weather. This is highly unusual – it is not like the hardy Northmen to succumb to the freezing elements so easily. A more likely explanation is brought to you by a few survivors who managed to escape the storm – they say that it was not the icy weather that swallowed up their fellow tribesmen, but a giant, Dragonish shadow lurking in the blinding blizzard.

If there is even the slightest chance that the fabled Frigustrex is out of hibernation and on the prowl, then further investigation is warranted. This could end up being a bountiful hunt indeed!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description: There are few individuals as hardened and adept on the freezing tundra than the bloodthirsty Marauder Hunters. They are used to these climes, and will move swiftly and easily over the icy wastes to help your search. Hire them so that they may be sent out to scout these lands in aid of the hunt!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description: Although severely lacking in intelligence, Ice Trolls are infinitely more resilient in cold extremes than most creatures, and will be able to move through the icy wastes unscathed. Recruit them into your army so that they may be sent out to scout these lands in aid of the hunt!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description: Just as you start to think that you are losing the Chaos Frost Dragon’s trail, the extreme weather around the Tower of Khrakk mysteriously dies down. News then reaches you that the bad weather has now suddenly appeared in the region of Zoishenk, in Kislevite lands to the south. This can be no coincidence – you must make your way into old Troll Country!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description:
With the appearance of giant, winged monsters, Chaos Frost Dragons are thought to be a type of Chaos-mutated Dragon that dwells in the underground passageways of the Old World’s coldest climes. Amongst the northern tribes there are tales of one such monstrous Chaos Frost Dragon called Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void, that has terrorised the tundra for centuries. Witnesses say that when coming out of hibernation it emerges from the ground, in a heartbeat, to indiscriminately devour anything that gets too close to its territory, located somewhere at the frozen, northern end of Troll Country.

Recently, the Tower of Khrakk and the Kislevite lands to the south were inexplicably blanketed by freakishly bad snow storms, with entire tribes disappearing from the region without a trace. Witnesses are saying that it was not the icy weather that swallowed their fellow tribesmen up, but a giant Dragonish shadow lurking in the blinding blizzard.

If there is even the slightest chance that this shadow was the fabled Frigustrex itself, then it is worth investigating further. This could end up being a very bountiful hunt indeed! First you must travel through the Tower of Khrakk and deep into Kislevite lands to find the beast.

The Ruinous Masters have many worshippers across the Old World, amongst which the Beastmen are the most primitive. The influence of Chaos only enhances their bestial aspects, making the already-monstrous beasts larger and even more terrifying than they already are. One such pair of one-eyed abominations of the Beastmen are the gargantuan Cygor brothers known to men as The Salzenmund Soul-Eaters. These grotesque leviathans are not only bigger, stronger, and faster than their ordinary counterparts, but are feared even by Beastmen Bray-Shamans due to their ability to dampen the use of magic for others in their presence. To take on the mighty Soul-Eaters with limited use of magic certainly makes for a challenging hunt, but one which will potentially culminate in an impressive sacrifice to the Gods.\n\nFirst you must find the pair of monsters, who are always found together; a surprisingly difficult task considering their immense size. Being of the Beastmen, the Soul-Eaters dwell deep in the dark forests, navigable via the vast network of Beastpaths known only to the Beastmen themselves. The only way to safely explore them is to recruit some experienced hunters to search the woods thought to harbour Beastmen herds to hopefully find the Cygor brothers you seek as your bounty.

Your hunters send word that they have not been able to find any leads in the forests, but have caught wind of a pair of sieging Cygors terrorizing Middenland, hurling giant boulders that are turning castle walls to rubble. It’s as good a lead as any and surely the soft southerners are not going to last long anyway, so they could do with a plundering. Time to bring some real hunters to the lands of men!

You tear through Middenheim, leaving charred villages and slaughtered townspeople in your wake. Not only is there no sign of the Cygor brothers, but the soft fools of the Empire are surprisingly unknowledgeable about these monsters that are supposedly terrorizing their lands. But not all hope is lost – one of your Shamans comes to you, claiming to have a plan which will lead you to your bounty. He can put this plan into action for you, but only for a handsome price of course. You'll need to fill your coffers!

The Shaman returns and discloses his simple but deviously grim plan. Having communed with various godlings and daemons in his mysterious rituals, he now claims to know the location of the Soul-Eaters. He suggests you march your army to the edge of the Forest of Shadows, taking captive any men you can capture on the way – and keep them alive. This plan sounds like it is getting interesting...

The Ruinous Masters have many worshippers across the Old World, amongst which the Beastmen are the most primitive. The influence of Chaos only enhances their bestial aspects, making the already-monstrous beasts larger and even more terrifying than they already are. One such pair of one-eyed abominations of the Beastmen are the gargantuan Cygor brothers known to men as the Salzenmund Soul-Eaters. These grotesque leviathans are not only bigger, stronger, and faster than their ordinary counterparts, but are feared even by Beastmen Bray-Shamans due to their ability to dampen the use of magic for others in their presence. To take on the mighty Soul-Eaters with limited use of magic certainly makes for a challenging hunt, but one which will potentially culminate in an impressive sacrifice to the Gods. First you must find the pair of monsters, who are always found together; a surprisingly difficult task considering their immense size.\n\nYou have consulted one of your Shamans who has a plan which will lead you to your bounty. Having communed with various godlings and daemons in his mysterious rituals, he claims to know the location of the Soul-Eaters, and suggests you march your army to the edge of the Forest of Shadows, taking captive any men you can capture on the way – and keep them alive. This plan is getting interesting...

Dragon Ogres are living legends of carnage and destruction. Most of what the Norscans know of these god-like beasts of Chaos is from the ancient records kept by their Shamans, which has immortalised them in folklore. Amongst the more ancient tribes there survives tales of one exceptionally strong Dragon Ogre Shaggoth known as Traygard Mountain-Cleaver. His power is thought to be second only to Kholek Suneater himself, with the ability to call upon thousands of thunder bolts to rain down on his victims, striking from unpredictable arcs to maim and destroy on his whim. Traygard is indeed an excellent target for a hunt – to sacrifice such a powerful and ancient monster of Chaos would be seen very favourably by the Gods. However, the monstrous Shaggoth hasn’t been seen in centuries, or at least, nobody has witnessed him and lived to tell the tale in that time. 

News arrives of rumours that Traygard may be active again. A Norscan tribe to the north-east, very close to the Chaos Wastes, has been burnt to the ground with almost their entire enclave of warriors slaughtered in a single night. It is certainly true that many tribes of the north frequently perish at the hands of rival warring tribes, but on the night this tribe fell, it is said that a thunderstorm as bright as day lit up the night sky.

This is certainly worth investigation, but you first need more information, preferably from the survivors who actually witnessed the slaughter. With the majority of the tribe dead, this is easier said than done – the few surviving tribesmen are scattered as nomads throughout the region. The hunt is on.

These slave owners are trying to rip you off and need a lesson in Norscan business practices. Attempted robbery begets robbery – pillage their lands and take ownership of everything they own, including the slave you seek!
Time is short – you are on a hunt, after all. It is not worth engaging in conflict with a trivial merchant. Better to just pay the man’s high price. First you'll need to fill your coffers.

Once the slave is under your ownership, he reveals to you his sorry story. He is, in fact, a former Marauder Champion whose tribe was utterly devastated by the abominable Shaggoth they know was Traygard Mountain-Cleaver. He tells you that he experienced a single blow from the great monster which had caused him to lose his arm, then he was struck by one of the many bolts of lightning falling from the sky, which grazed the side of his head and burnt one of his eyes out of his very skull.\n\nThe legendary beast must exist, for the proof of it stands right there in front of you. But now you must see for yourself. The slave gives you the likely location of where the beast was headed after obliterating his tribe – the Chaos Wastes.

Dragon Ogres are living legends of carnage and destruction. Amongst the more ancient tribes there survives tales of one exceptionally strong Shaggoth known as Traygard Mountain-Cleaver. His power is thought to be second only to Kholek Suneater himself, with the ability to call upon thousands of thunder bolts to rain down on his victims, striking from unpredictable arcs to maim and destroy on his whim. Traygard is indeed an excellent target for a hunt – to sacrifice such a powerful and ancient monster of Chaos would be seen very favourably by the Gods.

Having heard that Traygard may be active again, you travelled to Goromadny Mountains to follow an interesting lead. A slave languishing in a thrall pen there was allegedly mumbling stories about a ruthless and powerful Shaggoth with frightening power who destroyed his former tribe and its stronghold. Although clearly gone insane, the pitiful man had obviously experienced a terrible encounter in battle, missing an eye and an arm. Upon speaking to him yourself, he revealed to you that he is actually a former Marauder Champion whose tribe was utterly devastated by the abominable Shaggoth they know was Traygard Mountain-Cleaver. A single blow from the great monster had caused him to lose his arm, then he was struck by one of the many bolts of lightning falling from the sky, which grazed the side of his head and burnt one of his eyes out.

The legendary beast must exist, for the proof of it stands right there in front of you. But now you must see for yourself. The slave gives you the likely location of where the beast was headed after obliterating his tribe – the Chaos Wastes.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul
localised_description: It is no exaggeration that very few things truly scare the Northmen and the other abominable inhabitants of the north – least of all, spiders. However, when they take the form of Venom Queens, gigantic in size and made up for in numbers by their hatchling swarms, most would prefer not to face one. The only real upside of encountering a Venom Queen is that there are rarely more than one in any one place at a time – killing just one is hard enough!\n\nRecently, harrowing stories have started circulating that gigantic Venom Queens are grouping into vast spider swarms in the lands to the south. The most recent spate of appearances have been in the Eastern Badlands, where they have taken over swathes of land, devouring any who come near. To most, this would be terrifying news. But to the hunter, this is a prime opportunity for a worthy sacrifice! Time to get more information.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul
localised_description: As you arrive in the Eastern Badlands, you immediately see that the rumours of the spider infestation are true. The land is blanketed in webs and cocoons, and the surface seems devoid of other life. You have also arrived at a time of conflict between the Dwarfs and the Greenskins, who are currently fighting a bitter subterranean war over the many underground strongholds protecting the lucrative mines in the area. You can hear the faint sound of cannons and warfare emanating from the ground beneath.\n\nYou have no interest in this silly war between the stunties and the grobi! Besides, the men and creatures of the north are not adept at digging and navigating tunnels, preferring to fight out in the open like real men. Fortunately, the Greenskins still have several camps on the surface where it should be possible to obtain more information about the Venom Queen infestation. There won't be time for diplomacy, however!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul
localised_description: While sacking a Greenskin camp, you manage to capture a spineless Goblin attempting to scurry away from the area unseen. The cowardly wretch says he’ll give up some information about the Venom Queen infestation for a little ‘compensation’. But there are cheaper ways to get information out of a greedy Goblin! Taking a full three seconds of a beating before spitting out the information, he reveals that Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed ‘Warlord of Eight Peaks’ had recently discovered this group of larger, poisonous Arachnaroks, and had been trying to herd them for use in his own malevolent schemes. However, he could not control the uncontrollable swarm and it had moved on, thought to have gone underground via a nearby tunnel.\n\nYou need to find the location of this tunnel entrance. To do so, the area around Karak Eight Peaks will need to be turned upside down.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul
localised_description: Recently, harrowing stories had started circulating that gigantic Venom Queens were grouping into vast spider swarms in the lands to the south. The most recent spate of appearances had been in the area around Karak Eight Peaks, where they had taken over swathes of land, devouring all who came near. Your spies tell you that this is undoubtedly the work of Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed ‘Warlord of Eight Peaks’, who had allegedly discovered the group of larger, poisonous Arachnaroks, and had been trying to herd them into the area for use in his own malevolent schemes.\n\nYou care not for some stupid Goblin’s ill-conceived plans, but the news of this bounty can only mean one thing to a Norscan hunter – a prime opportunity for a worthy sacrifice! To find the location of the giant spider cluster, the area around Karak Eight Peaks will need to be turned upside down to find their burrow.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description: The Greenskins are famous for having all manner of monstrosities in their despicable ranks, including the lumbering Giants that follow them to insatiably feast in battle. Killing one for sacrifice would bring great prestige and recognition from the Gods, for what can be more impressive than slaying a legendary descendant of the long-forgotten Sky-Titans?\n\nYou have heard of one very belligerent Giant called Blorgar the Mad Titan, who is lumbering around the Grey Mountains being more than just a minor nuisance to the locals there. Setting out to slay the leviathan, you expect that the locals having their lands indiscriminantly flattened will be quite happy to see you, but it matters little. You're not going there to kill it for their sake – the hunt is on!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description: Arriving in the Grey Mountains you find out that Blorgar is long gone, but the destruction left in his wake is evident. Buildings have been smashed to rubble, crops flattened, and people reduced to ground-smears. Although the Giant's movements are still unknown, the locals tell you of a Bretonnian herb collector who might know where the brute lives. The Bretonnian had allegedly made a fleeting appearance in the Grey Mountains shortly before the Giant arrived, claiming that he’d accidentally stumbled upon the Giant's underground lair while spelunking nearby to gather some cave mushrooms. Knowing that the Giant was approaching, he was gone almost as soon as he’d arrived, fearful of the carnage to come.\n\nYou must now travel to Bretonnia to search for this herb collector. There would also be no harm in indulging in a bit of raiding while you’re there, if not just to keep the troops happy!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description: The Bretonnian herb collector has the information you need, but you don't trust the backstabbing Gobbos to do any sort of financial deal. A spot of subterfuge, although perhaps cowardly from your perspective, may be needed instead in order for you to obtain the hostage. You must send one of your Heroes to infiltrate their camp and steal the Bretonnian right from under their noses.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description:
The Greenskins are famous for having all manner of monstrosities in their despicable ranks, including the lumbering Giants that follow them to feast in battle. Having heard of one very belligerent Giant called Blorgar the Mad Titan terrorising the Grey Mountains, you set out to slay the leviathan for a great sacrifice, for what can be more impressive than bringing down a legendary descendant of the long-forgotten Sky-Titans?

Once you’d arrived in the Grey Mountains, however, Blorgar was nowhere to be seen. The only chance of gaining any useful information of the Giant’s whereabouts lay with a Bretonnian herb collector who’d allegedly stumbled upon an underground lair while spelunking nearby. Unfortunately this Bretonnian had been taken hostage by some nasty Goblins on a recent raid. The importance of the information known to him is crucial to complete the hunt, so a Hero was sent into the gobboes' camp to steal him back.

Your servant dumps the hog-tied Bretonnian herb collector at your feet, along with some loot he managed to steal on his way out.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description: Your messengers tell you that the greedy Goblins are asking for a near-fortune to give the herb collector up. It seems they know he must have some considerable value to you. The thought of just killing them all crosses your mind, but then you would be running the risk of them fleeing, or executing the hostage. You need this man, and you need him alive, so you decide to raise the required funds.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
localised_description: Forest Dragons are truly remarkable creatures, dominating the forests as all dragons dominate their habitats. For most, stepping into the woods to find one to slay is either an act of extreme bravery or hopeless stupidity, such is the fiercely protective nature of the beings who dwell there. To some, the elusive Wood Elves are as dangerous as the unpredictable Beastmen, both of whom may attack unprovoked if you trespass into their woodland territories.\n\nSomewhere in the trees and thickets of Athel Loren lives Radixashen, also known as the Serpent of the World Roots. It is thought to be as ancient as the forest itself, and for that, it is a highly prized bounty for sacrifice. As with all dragons, it will be very difficult to track down and kill. The first thing you must do is to travel to the famous forest of the Wood Elves.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
localised_description: You have arrived at the forest and now must plan a way to draw the monster out of its hiding place. Knowing that there are often strong bonds between Forest Dragons and the Glade Lords of the Wood Elves, your next course of action seems clear. If you cause enough damage to the Wood Elves’ dwellings, their monstrous serpentine ally may show up to aid them. Even if it doesn’t, at least you will get the opportunity to pillage the dwellings of those estranged forest people!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
localised_description: It seems that Radixashen is not interested in coming to his ally's aid on this occasion. Perhaps it wrongly assumed that they were able enough to repel your attack, but in any case, further despoilment of the forest will be needed to bait the creature. You know that there is a great tree of immense spiritual importance to the forest, located right at its heart. Known as the Oak of Ages, not only is it considered the source of the forest’s power, but is also the annual birthplace of their King in the Woods. Surely, the Serpent of the World Roots cannot ignore the desecration of such a revered and important location. It is time to raise the raiding banners!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
localised_description:
Forest Dragons are truly remarkable creatures, dominating the forests as all Dragons dominate their habitats. For most, stepping into the woods to find one to slay is either an act of extreme bravery or hopeless stupidity, such is the fiercely protective nature of the beings who dwell there. To some, the Wood Elves are as dangerous as the unpredictable Beastmen, both of whom may attack unprovoked if you trespass into their woodland territories.

Somewhere in the trees and thickets of Athel Loren lives the Forest Dragon known as Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots. It is thought to be as ancient as the forest itself, and for that, it is a highly prized bounty for sacrifice. As with all Dragons, however, it is very elusive. Striding blindly into the forest to find it would be foolish and futile – the best course of action would be to make the beast come to you.

Knowing Radixashen to be one of the great protectors of the Elves’ forest, you can think of one target that will surely draw the Dragon out. The great tree known as the Oak of Ages, which is not only considered the source of the forest’s power, is also the annual birthplace of the Elven King in the Woods. Surely, the Serpent of the Worldroots will not be able to ignore the desecration of such a revered and important location. It is time to raise the raiding banners!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
localised_description: Mammoths are important tools of war for the northern tribes, and highly valued for sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Lately there have been sightings of some particularly impressive specimens around Norscan regions, rumoured to be members of a legendary herd of behemoths known as The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord. This herd is thought to graze on the icy slopes of the Mountains of Hel. These beasts shall be a great offering indeed – go there and seek out this herd for a dark sacrifice!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
localised_description: Arriving in the mountains of Hel, the elephantine beasts are nowhere to be found. Instead, it seems that there are several Dwarf warriors to the area, namely Slayers and Rangers. Clearly, they too are hunting this herd, but you can’t be sure of their motives. The nearest Dwarfholds are in the nearby Gianthome Mountains – go there and squeeze some information out of them!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
localised_description: You have gathered information that a large Dwarf expedition has just departed to hunt down the herd. The Dwarfs’ involvement is an interesting development, since they are not known to be avid monster hunters, nor are they known to use mammoths in their battle-ranks as the northern tribes do. There must be good a reason for them to have left the safety of their holds just to hunt down some belligerent beasts. They were last seen marching for Kislev, so some further reconnaissance will be needed.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
localised_description: Mammoths are important tools of war for the northern tribes, and highly valued for sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Lately there have been sightings of some particularly impressive specimens around Norscan regions, rumoured to be members of a legendary herd of behemoths known as the Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord. They are thought to graze on the icy slopes of the Mountains of Hel.\n\nSetting out to hunt the herd down for yourself, you catch wind that rather unusually for Dwarfs, a throng of Slayers and Rangers had also recently been in the Mountains of Hel to hunt the beasts. The Dwarfs’ involvement is interesting, since they are not known to be avid monster hunters, nor are they known to use mammoths in their battle-ranks as the northern tribes do. There must be good a reason for them to have left the safety of their holds just to hunt down some belligerent beasts. They were last seen marching for Kislev, so some further reconnaissance there is needed.

Soaring above the eldritch plains of Sylvania there exists a rare species of gargantuan bat-like monster that is as giant and powerful as the largest of Dragons. They are known as Terrorgheists, flying nocturnal beasts of rotten flesh and withered organs exposed to the night air. Although most are guided by the will of their evil masters, some Terrorgheists are more self-serving, drawing their power and evil intent from the very soil of their Undead homeland. It is said that to bring down such a beast takes the greatest of hunters. This sounds like just the kind of sacrifice that would be seen very favourably by the Gods!

There is one ancient Terrorgheist known to be more terrifying than all others, with a scream that is said to break the will of any man, and eyes like black holes that suck in all manner of magical energies and light. It is known as the Abyssal Shrieker, an abominable Terrorgheist spoken about only in nightmarish tales shrouded in myth, the fragments of truth of which are unknown to most.

It would certainly be foolish to enter into this hunt with no knowledge of the bounty, so before setting off to find the monster, you call upon one most likely to have knowledge of the Old World’s ancient beasts – a Shaman-Sorcerer.

Delving into his vast collection of tomes and scrolls, the Shaman reveals that any records which might have mentioned the Abyssal Shrieker were so ancient that they are lost in the streams of time. With no hint as to where the monster’s lair could be, its very existence is in question. At the very least the Shaman is able to tell you that he knows Terrorgheists to be deeply bound to necromancy in the Sylvanian lands, and one particular Sylvanian family is known to be frequently mentioned in some records as having hunted the terrible beasts in the past. It’s not much to go on, but it’s a start. You must search out any remnants of this family in the lands of Sylvania.

After a short stint of raiding around Sylvanian lands, you come across an old manor known to be the former home of the Sylvanian family you seek. The house is lifeless – the line of nobility that used to live there had long ended, leaving only howling ghosts of the past that scatter into the shadows as you arrive. Searching every room, you come across a study with an old skeleton sat at a desk, a quill still in its hand. On the table is a leather-bound notebook containing a written history of the family who once lived there.

According to the notebook, the former inhabitants of the house were once nobles of nearby Stirland, which was frequently haunted by The Abyssal Shrieker. The skeleton sat at the table was, in fact, a former Stirlander Lord, a renowned hunter who had once attempted to kill the exceptionally dangerous centuries-old monster himself. After a vicious battle, the great Lord failed to slay the beast and narrowly escaped with his life. Although he survived the encounter, he paid a terrible price for his defeat. The Terrorgheist absorbed almost all of his life-force and strength to make itself even more powerful, leaving the once-great hunter a sickly, weak individual, an affliction that infected his entire family and bloodline. Withered and disgraced, the noble and his kin exiled themselves to Sylvania where they eventually perished in shame.

Clearly, this pathetic Stirlander was nowhere near as great a hunter as you! He at least managed to record the location of his defeat, which you assume to be in the vicinity of the Abyssal Shrieker’s lair. All that remains to do is travel to Wurtbad to find it.

Soaring above the eldritch plains of Sylvania there exists flying nocturnal beasts of rotten flesh and withered organs exposed to the night air – the gargantuan bat-like monsters known as Terrorgheists. One such beast known as the Abyssal Shrieker is more terrifying than all others,with a scream that is said to break the will of any man, and eyes like black holes that suck in all magical energies and light. It is an abominable creature spoken about only in nightmarish tales shrouded in myth, the fragments of truth of which are unknown to most.

In your hunt for the Abyssal Shrieker you obtained a leather-bound notebook containing a written history of the last individual who had attempted to kill it. This long-dead hunter was once a noble of Stirland, which for a time was frequently haunted by the mysterious centuries-old monster, so he set out to kill it himself. According to the notebook, the great Lord failed to slay the beast after a vicious battle, from which he only narrowly escaped with his life. Although he survived the encounter, he paid a terrible price for his defeat. The Terrorgheist absorbed almost all of his lifeforce and strength to make itself even more powerful, leaving the once-great hunter a sickly, weak individual, an affliction suffered by his entire family and bloodline. Withered and disgraced, the noble and his kin exiled themselves to Sylvania where they all eventually perished in shame.

Clearly, this pathetic Stirlander was nowhere near as great a hunter as you! He at least managed to record the location of his defeat, which you assume to be in the vicinity of the Abyssal Shrieker’s lair. All that remains to do is travel to Wurtbad to find it.

The Hound God sits brooding upon a vast and ornately carved brass throne atop a great mountain of blood-stained bones, observing your progress with disdain. Although impressed by the slaughter – especially your dispatching of the other petty Gods’ champions – it is insulted that the killing was not done in its name, so sends its own challenger to defeat you…

The ancient Crow God is very established amongst the Norscan tribes, personified as a gigantic and massively bloated creature surrounded by dark clouds of tiny Daemonic insects. It is thought to be a ‘generous’ spirit, always interested in the plight of its mortal followers. Now, however, even the Crow’s generosity has worn thin. Observing your defeat of the other petty Gods’ champions, it is angry that the killing was not done in its name, so is sending a repulsive challenger to deliver punishment...

Those who worship the Serpent God do so for pleasure and personal gain, knowing that it is within its power to imbue followers with a portion of its radiant glory. The allure of the Serpent is highly addictive to most, but you have infuriated it by resisting the lure of its pride, arrogance, and excess. Having observed you obliterate the other petty Gods’ champions with interest, the Serpent God simultaneously writhes in disgust at your shunning. Now it sends a challenger, as charismatic as all its champions…

The inconstant Eagle God knows each trivial seed of hate in man’s heart, just as it knows the ultimate fate of every star in the cosmos. Its plans are convoluted and vast, spanning untold aeons, inexplicable and contradictory to mortal minds. Having observed you obliterate the other petty Gods’ champions with interest, it simultaneously writhes in disgust that you have shunned it, and so has set another one of its plans into motion. The final challenger, the champion of the Eagle God, awaits you in battle!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
localised_description: Zoishenk is being battered by an extreme blizzard, the likes of which you’d just seen at The Tower of Khrakk. Your scouts tell you that a dragon-like shadow has been spotted up ahead, moving directly into the heart of the blizzard where the weather is at its worse. This can be none other than the Scion of the Cold-Void itself! There is only one way to see this hunt through to its conclusion, and that is to follow the monster right into the eye of the storm. It is time to claim the legendary beast for the Gods!

You reach the edge of the forest, having taken on dozens of captives on the way. These unfortunates will serve as living bait to lure the Soul-Eaters out, who will likely be accompanied by the vicious Beastman herd they march with. The hostages are chained up and hammered to stakes upside down by their ankles, deliberately drawing their blood. The beasts will surely catch the scent, and it will be hard for them to resist the lure of injured, defenceless prey.

From a safe distance you watch the doomed hostages, as their screams echo between the trees. Out of nowhere, a frighteningly large tide of Beastmen suddenly emerges from the thickets, gorily devouring the victims, ripping them piece from piece, limb from torso. Then, almost as quickly as they’d appeared, they were gone. The scene of carnage and bloodshed is immediately surveyed and two pairs of hoof marks are found amongst the gored bodies, much larger than that of even the largest Cygors ever seen. Your bounty is here!

You give the order to march directly into the dark, uninviting wood, following the enormous tracks. The Forest of Shadows shall give up its prize – the Salzenmund Soul-Eaters will be yours to sacrifice!

Following your lead, your army strides into the wastelands of the far north. The slave was speaking the truth – your scouts report back that the monstrous Traygard has been spotted not far from your location, and if you move immediately you can cut him off at the Cliff of Beasts. At last! Your search may soon be at an end, and the great hunt will finally begin in earnest.

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul
localised_description: It did not take long for the location of the tunnel entrance to be discovered. There are multiple giant spider tracks leading into the subterranean passageway, making it easy to identify as the one you seek. Being cautious, you send scouts ahead to descend into the tunnel first, who return to tell you that the tunnel leads into an even bigger network of tunnels beneath. The spider tracks are as clear as day and the herd will be found, if only you follow them. All that remains is for you to lead your army down there…

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
localised_description: The Bretonnian herb collector you took so much trouble to find is almost mute with shock due to his experiences, but after some gentle coercing with torture, he reveals to you the location of the Giant’s dwelling. The lair of Blorgar the Mad Titan is located deep in Grey Mountains, in one of the few mushroom caves large enough for him to live in. It is time to march back there and enter the bowels of the earth to hunt the Giant down!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
localised_description: At long last, the dragon has taken your bait! While burning the region around the Oak of Ages to ashes, your scouts report seeing a great Forest Dragon lurking in front of the great tree. It can only be the Serpent of the World Roots itself, coming to the aid of the Oak. The time for raiding is over, Radixashen will be yours!

localised_title: Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
localised_description: Your scouts inform you that the crazy Dwarfs are in fact hunting the herd to settle an old grudge – revenge for the Mawherd's trampling of one of their past throng leaders. Stranger still, while you have been on the trail of this mighty mammoth herd, you have not seen any actual traces of its presence anywhere. Large herds of such gargantuan beasts are known to indiscriminately trample anything that gets in their way while on their migration routes – vegetation, settlements, people – but you’ve observed limited evidence of such activity. With the Dwarf expedition now heading towards High Pass, it is time to go and witness The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord for yourself, if indeed it is actually there!

The scale of the battle fought between the Stirlander Lord and the Abyssal Shrieker must have been immense. At the location of the hunter’s defeat you find swathes of land that once contained villages and vegetation that had been flattened in a massive skirmish, with the ancient remains of people and animals caught up in encounter strewn across the land. Following a trail of bones, you find the Terrorgheist’s lair in a nearby haunted forest – an obvious location for the dwelling of such an evil creature. You will surely succeed where the ‘great’ Stirlander Hunter failed!

localised_title: The False Pride of Knights Grudge
localised_description: As witnessed by Grimnir's disappointed glare, this army of Bretonnian curs stole victory from our throng. Such a grudge should be avenged!
Seen by Grungni's indignant eyes, the Chaos horde has cheated its way to victory against our brave Dawi throng - a grave grudge indeed! Right this wrong, and hunt down the Chaos filth.
Under Valaya's stern gaze, the rival wattocks of a failing Hold have claimed victory against us! Foolish Dawi - it is a grudge that must be settled!
Spied by a raging Grimnir, the umgi - who once claimed kith and kinship with the Dawi - dare to entrap and slay our throng. Hunt down this army and wipe the grudge from the Dammaz Kron!

Witnessed by Grimnir's vengeful sight, the Greenskin mob attacks our own throng and fell urk treachery has forced a dishonourable retreat! We cannot - will not - let such a stain on Dawi courage past. A grudge is recorded, ensure it is settled!

Observed by the judgemental glare of Valaya, the filthy blood drinkers have claimed victory against honest, breathing, beard-growing Dawi. They are an affront to the Mother Goddess, hunt down this host and send them back to the dark!
Seen through Grungni's resentful gaze, the manling Knights in their shoddy, umgak armour have raided this Dawi-claimed region. Defeat these cretins to restore honour.

Under Grimnir's raging sight, the Chaos corrupted umgi have raided our lands - a fell grudge indeed! Find these urks and defeat them, only then will Grimnir let such an atrocity against the Dawi relent.
Via Valaya's despairing glare, our territory has been raided - not by urk filth but by our own kin! A vile betrayal, a terrible grudge, and one that must be paid in Clan blood!
In Gazul's vengeful sight, the manlings of the Empire have raided Dwarfen lands and taken Dwarfen treasure! This must be paid for in blood!
Under the outraged sight of Grimnir, the grobi scum raid our mountains as they always have. Another grudge for the great book, another wrong to be righted, more Greenskins to hunt and kill!
Witnessed by Thungni, an Undead host has raided our lands. Hunt down this horde of filthy bloodsuckers and visit vengeance upon them!
Witnessed by Smednir's furious, fuming gaze, their crone of a goddess has sent her Knights sacking Dawi lands. Find these trespassers and hold them to account!
Seen by Valaya's agonised eyes, the northern manlings have despoiled our home, stolen artefacts and tainted sacred vaults. A grudge is in place, vengeance will be ours!
In Grungni's deplored sight, our kin have defiled a rival Hold. Such desecration of our own Karaks by treacherous Dawi cannot be tolerated! Find the enemy throng and punish them!

Under Grimnir's vengeful stare, the Empire has betrayed and defiled our Holds, stealing our secrets and ruining proud Dwarfen works - as is typical of their kind. Find this army and claim retribution.
Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, the old enemy, a Greenskin mob has sacked a Dwarfhold. The rage is deep, this is a grudge like no other! Find the grobi scum responsible and wipe them out!
Regarded by Valaya's resentful eyes, Uzkular have invaded and sacked our proud Dwarfhold. Revenge must be enacted; the grudge put right. Find this grave-scum host and destroy them!
Under Valaya's disappointed glare, infighting amongst the Dawi has led to an insurgency here. The grudge has been listed - end this despicable influx!
In Valaya's very own sight did the Bretonnian chufs dare take our homes and mines. Bring it back into Dwarf hands and curse every umgi for this treacherous act!

Before the eyes of Valaya, Goddess of Home and Hearth, the Chaos-sworn umgi of the north seize our land to honour their foul Gods. These wazzocks think they will be protected by their Ruinous benefactors. It is time we proved them wrong and took back what is rightfully ours!
Under the wrathful sight of Grimnir did Dwarfs of a rival Clan take this settlement by force. We cannot abide such wilful trespass. Remove them and restore the Dwarfhold to its rightful owners.
Viewed by a weeping Valaya, rival Dwarfs have taken a Hold in lieu of a debt allegedly owed by the original inhabitants' ancestors. Lies! Restore the true owners.
By Grimnir's stare, the Sigmar-loving umgi dare to take our homes and mountains. Record it in the book and ensure the settlement is returned to the Dawi.
Witnessed by Grungni, the urk and grobi bastards have taken our Dwarfhold. Is there a fouler grudge ever recorded? Get it back!

Seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Greenskins have taken a Dwarfhold. A vile sin, this grudge has been entered into the book and must now be wiped clean. Take the Hold back and kill any grobi in our way!

As witnessed by a weeping Valaya, the enemy did come to our ancient home and ruin it. The Halls of the Ancestors lie discarded, the vaults raided! This is a black grudge, return the Hold and slay any who get in our way!
Seen by Grimnir, the Undead dare to ransack and occupy our settlement. A grudge has been recorded, ensure it is settled.

As seen by Thungni's raging glare, innocent Dawi travelling through Stirland have been taken by the von Carstein Zangunaz and slain. Their bodies have been risen and made to perform a dread revel - a puppet re-enactment of Jaeger's travesty of a play, "Stoutheart Beardcomber and the Ostlander's Wife". This is a terrible grudge - for it is a terrible play - and one that must be paid with von Carstein heads!

Under Smednir's annoyed gaze, did the Dwarfs from Kraka Drak send their emissaries to Everpeak covered in Chaos-tainted beard ticks! Many Dawi set their beards alight to rid themselves of the parasitic embuggerence or covered their beards in acrid powder, which had the unfortunate side effect of bleaching said facial hair a drastic blonde colour! A grudge is recorded against the Norse Dwarfs - one that should be settled by ignoring these lice-carriers for a long time.

Via Morgrim's discriminating glare, the manlings of Kislev are befouling sacred Dwarfen ale by mixing it with their distilled potato juice! Such contempt for honest Dwarfs ales tainted by this 'vodka' - they have even dared name it a 'boilermaker' - cannot be tolerated! This is a grudge of the highest order, let us show these manlings how Dawi feel about this... violation!

Seen by Valaya's angry eyes, the Bretonnians have slain many thaggoraki in their fell nest to save a clutch of maidens, both umgi and Dawi. But it turns out that the kruti Knights, while gladly escorting the damsels back to safety, left the fair Dwarf maids to fend for themselves with sorry excuses about there not being enough room on the backs of their nags. An outrage and one that must be paid for with these Knights' blood.

Beheld in Grimnir's seething sight, Bugman's Brewery was once the greatest of all brewhouses, where the fabled Bugman's XXXXX was created - a few casks of which still exist. But it all ended when the grobi fell upon the fortified brewery, enslaving and killing the Bugman Clan, and - worst of all - drinking the ale! Such an atrocity is a grudge that can never be truly settled. Go and slay Greenskins to salve this open wound!

As witnessed by a vengeful Grimnir, the Orcs have taken great delight in reminding us of their 'claim' on the Dragonback Mountains, of how they have defiled Ekrund and stolen its wealth. Enough! Even if we lack the stout hearts to take it back, we can spike their grog. Let us give them a taste of Dwarf medicine!

Under Morgrim's disappointed glare, did the Dwarfs of Karak Ziflin steal away a cook bound for the kitchens of Karaz-a-Karak! The secret of his nutty fig pudding recipe was the reason - a spiteful move to deprive the High King of one of his favourites in petty retribution for a difficult Reckoner's inspection. A grudge has been recorded and there will be no negotiations with Ziflin until they give up the Halfling!

Witnessed by a concerned Valaya, the Karaz Ankor's ambassador to Nuln has returned with his beard shaved off! Apparently, the Countess Emmanuelle didn't take kindly to the Dawi's chance remark about the accuracy of the pupils at the Imperial Gunnery school! This is an affront to all Dwarfs - Nuln must pay!

By Grungni's indignant glare, the Imperial School of Engineers in the umgi city of Altdorf has claimed technical superiority over our kin! Such an offensive boast cannot go unchallenged, Dwarfen supremacy must be retained at all costs! Show the foolish manlings and their umgak machinery Dwarfen supremacy!

In the stern eyes of Valaya did the Elector Count of Ostermark commission skilled Dwarf Engineers to raise a mighty fortress and then short-change the Dawi by two pennies. An outrage! Ransack Ostermark to recover the cost!
Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows - kill him!
This bearded mortal is a threat to our plans. Send the oath-shackled fool to an early grave and take his soul for good measure!
One of Sigmar's little thralls challenges us. Ensure his death.
The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, he should be devoured by you and you alone!
The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, she should be devoured by you and your alone!
The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.
The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy him.
The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy her.
You are the one the Dark Gods favour as the Champion of Champions. Archaon's host is close, hunt down and kill the pretender!
The High King's throng is close - if you take Grudgebearer's head the whole Dwarf Race will bear an eternal grudge - a glorious act indeed!
The weakling southerners see Karl Franz as their saviour, let us disabuse them of that notion by killing this Emperor and taking his head for the glory of Chaos!
The enemy of Chaos is near! Hunt down his army and take his head before his troops. Their sorrow will be drank by Slaanesh!
The Orc known as Grimgor Ironhide, although an agent of destruction, plays no part in our masters' plans. His army is close, go and slay the beast.
That foolish grave-scum, Mannfred, like Nagash and Vlad before him, thinks he is better than the Gods of Chaos. He marches nearby - destroy him and watch his host crumble.
Our rival of the Gods' favour leads his followers through nearby lands. Pursue this pretender and destroy him - let the Ruinous Powers know there is only one true champion!
The Dwarfs march from their mountain holes close to us. They are led by their insufferable Lord. His soul would make a fine trophy for the Chaos Gods, go and claim it!
The crippled nation of the Emperor sends out his subjects to play war nearby. Let us show them this is no game - take their general's head as a prize!
The enemy is close by, we cannot dishonour Khorne by ignoring battle. Hunt down the foe and slay the enemy leader in the Blood God's name!
The Greenskin mobs are close, it would be a trifling matter to hunt down this filthy tribe and take their Boss' head for the Dark Powers.
An Undead host arises close to us, led by a Vampire. They think anchoring their souls to immortal remains keeps them from our masters' grasp. Prove that notion wrong - slay the corpse-lord!
This enemy army of Chaos shall fall before the might of our warriors. Smash them!
A Dwarf Throng comes. Slaughter them all!
So from the south of milk and honey come the weaklings of the Empire. Ravage them.
An army approaches, eager for battle. BLOOD FOR THE BLOOD GOD!
The Orcs come blundering forward desperate for battle, it is Khorne's wish we give it to them!
The meek-willed champion of a rival aspirant tramples across our lands making sacrifices to the Gods in a vain attempt to mock our legions. Avenge us!
The short flesh-bags of prideful hot air - the Dwarfs - dare to trespass on lands claimed by the Ruinous Powers. Destroy them!
Franz dares to send his forces north. He thinks his crippled god as powerful as our Dark Masters. Prove yourself to Chaos, find these so-called invaders and obliterate them!
Our enemies invade! They dare to fetter lands claimed by the Dark Gods, they must be punished!
An Orc rabble has invaded. Show these filth who should be invading who!
The Undead trespass on our lands. They think to spread the taint of Nagash against the northlands - show them the wrath of the true gods!
The Undead seek battle. In the Dark Gods names, tread them into dust!
The Dwarfen mountain realms are ready for ravaging - begin the harvest!
The lands of Sigmar are ripe for pillage and plunder. Time to raid!
Mortal concerns hold little interest for the Chaos Gods, yet the tribes put great stock in raiding, so we must reward them. Raid this enemy, make them pay!
The Greenskin lands generally offer little of value to the Chaos Gods, yet this region may hold some riches for our Dark Masters.
The Vampires, squirrel away their arcane treasures for their own selfish ends. They do not realise the power the hoard - get it back for the Ruinous Powers!
It is time to gather the tribes. We invade the soft, sweet mortal lands - their souls are ours to take! Raise an army for Chaos!
This Dwarfen settlement is condemned by the Dark Gods. Reap what you can from it; if you see fit, put it to the torch as well!
A mortal settlement ripe for raiding. Take its value and then send it to the many hells with fire!
This settlement offends our masters. Steal what you can and then bring fire to all.
These hovels belong to the Greenskins, see them destroyed in our masters' honour but only after we have taken anything of worth!
The Spawn of Nagash continue to eek out an existence in these broken castles, contrary to our Gods' demands. Take everything and leave the grave scum with nothing!
Champions of Chaos that swear fealty are useful servants - powerful and domineering… and should things go awry, we can blame them in lieu of the Chaos Gods' wrath!
Chaos is magic. Magic is Chaos. None can wield its incarnadine power like the Sorcerers of Chaos. We will be stronger with one in our service.
The Hellcannon is a Daemon-forged monstrosity. Part artillery, part Daemon - it should be brought to battle for the glory of Chaos!
The cavalry of Chaos makes the Grail-drivelling fools of Bretonnia look like children on ponies! Bring the Horsemen and the Knights of Chaos - make the ground quake as they charge!
Reap their souls, and cover thyself in gore. Khorne will reward those who fight up close, where the blood flows strongest!
While such methods are shunned by the Skull Throne, there is use in some limited missile attacks.
The creatures of the Chaos Wastes are blessings from the Dark Gods, we should use their mortal children and bring ruin to the enemy!
Our hordes lack significant numbers of chariots. We should forge these Daemon-machines and unleash them on the enemy as quickly as possible.
A vile champion of the Ruinous Powers challenges us directly. He is a threat to our nation and must be vanquished before his lies and taint spread further. By Sigmar, smite him!

A Dwarf agitator causes us trouble - we must silence him! It is a task that risks offending the High King, but we cannot be paralysed by fear of offending the Dwarfs, for they take on grudges far too easily.
The Electors send their men abroad to rabble-rouse and damage our cause. Find this so-called 'hero' and slay him. Let the rivals of the Emperor know that Franz can play this secret war too.
This enemy malefactor is a threat. By the comet, slay him!
This enemy malefactor is a threat. By the comet, slay her!
The Orcs send out their malefactors to disrupt our plans. Find the sorry Greenskin and slay him in Sigmar's name!
An Undead minion is abroad defiling Sigmar's lands with his foul stench and fouler actions. Send this creature back to the grave!
An Undead minion is abroad defiling Sigmar's lands with her foul stench and fouler actions. Send this creature back to the grave!
If the Elector Counts refuse to parley then we must take the lands in the Emperor's name through force of arms!
To ensure the security and prosperity of Sigmar's realm we must expand its borders. Begin the conquest!

localised_title: Take It Back From the Dead
localised_description: The Vampire Counts have always arrogantly believed the lands they hold dominion over are theirs, but they are and have always been within the Emperor's borders.
Our ancient allies have failed us. Let the Dwarfs know that their time has come, now is the Age of Karl Franz - the reckoning will ours! Declare war!
Mine Emperor has tried Shallya's dove but now is the time of Ulric's Wolf! It is war within the Empire!
Too long have we suffered these Greenskins to live. The time has come to march to war!
Too long have we suffered the Vampire menace to fester in Sylvania! We must purge the land of the Undead and return it to Sigmar's care. Declare war on these abominations!
We have been asked a boon by our potential allies - to wreak havoc upon their enemy by assassinating one of their men. If we do this, we increase our chances of ruling all our fellow men!

Our countrymen have requested that we weaken their enemy's position by seizing one of their regions. The men will bow to the Emperor if we succeed. Do this and increase our chances of bringing them entirely under our rule.
Our countrymen are in peril - they have requested that we defeat their enemy in battle. If we are victorious they will have no choice but to bow before the throne!
If we strike a blow against the enemy of our potential allies in battle, they will be more open to our requests. Do this - break the allies' foe and they will see the Emperor as a force for good!

We have been asked by potential allies to sabotage their enemy's war efforts by raiding their supplies. A grim task but if completed it will increase our chances of bringing them entirely under our rule.
Our fellow men have requested that we wreak havoc upon their enemy by ransacking the foe's lands. They may abide by the Emperor if we enact this dark mission.
Archaon leads his Swords of Chaos, corrupting the lands nearby - now is the time to answer the challenge and depose of the Dark Gods' champion once and for all!
The Ancient Alliance must die with the Dwarf High King. Grudgebearer is close - take his head, it is a heavy price but the Dwarf debt of blood is now too great.
To destroy this rebellion against the throne decisive action is needed. Kill this Faction Leader in battle and the men should turn back to their rightful ruler.
The foe is close, leading his dogs across lands. Bring him to battle and strike him down. Take the serpent's head and watch the body writhe!
Grimgor Ironhide is close! If we kill that mongrel dog in battle then his so-called Waaagh! will collapse as fast as his corpse. Break the beast and watch his support wither!

There are few ways to slay a Vampire, but decapitation works even on an Undead Lord as powerful as Mannfred. The Count is close, seek him out in battle - destroy him and witness his hordes literally crumble.
The Chaos Gods send powerful servants against us. Some will tell you glory awaits in slaying such a Chaos Lord, but that is false. There is no glory in this act, just survival…
This Dwarf Lord comes down from his mountains and dares to challenge us. Kill the little oaf and take his beard as a trophy!
A Noble of the Empire of some considerable rank and support, has decried the rule of Franz. He is a traitor and cannot be allowed to live or others will sense weakness.
This enemy Lord is powerful indeed. Think of the glory to be gained in killing him in battle!
A Greenskin Warboss, one chosen by his foul gods is a threat to our people. We must slay the brute before his power grows even stronger.
A Vampire Count has arisen, one that could challenge even Mannfred - but for now the creature is a threat to the Empire. It must be slain in Sigmar's holy name.
The forces of Chaos come to destroy us. Engage the dread army - For Franz, for Sigmar!
A Dwarf throng readies itself to battle us. We should not disappoint the bearded fools. Show the stunted folk what men of Sigmar can do - engage!
